Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Wintson's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Waterloo, a small town where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group of teachers is seeking for from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous SMT/Kiva loan has made a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mrs. Winston A.  (third from right) is the head teacher at the school. She was born in Hastings, 20 miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is age 55, a widow with two children. Both of her children are in Senior Secondary School (SSS). She has been a teacher for 34 years now. Mrs. Winston will use her share of the loan to buy house-building materials – cement, sand, etc.-- to start constructing a house consisting of two bedrooms and a parlor.

loans.use: Buy house-building material – cement, sand, etc--to start constructing a house

loans.name: Lolita's Group

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Lolita is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lolita Q..

Lolita is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. Lolita owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and married with two children who go to school. He runs a cafeteria in his hometown to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has two employees. He also keeps animals for commercial purposes to increase his income.

Jonathan hopes to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 43 year old married woman from Lebanon, who has three children. She repairs and does all type of clothes for men and women, also she does curtains, and bed sheets and more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to open a sewing shop. 

Fatmeh has been working from her house as a seamstress, and lately she has realized that she needs more space knowing that she has a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, family members and people from her region. Also, the fact that she receives her clients at home has been inconvenient for her family. This is her second loan, and she has reimbursed her previous loan on time. Her first loan let her purchase thread for her business. 

Fatmeh is speciA. in her work because she is known for her good and precise work. When she first started her business, she couldn’t afford purchasing a sewing shop because she didn’t have enough income; however know she has increased her customer base and her income. She learned the business when she was young so she has always been sewing. She plans to keep on improving her work and to expand her business to the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To open a sewing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock for store

loans.name: Kouser Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Kouser perveen is very confident that an investment in her husband's business will help it greatly, because she knows that he is very hard working person but the problem he faces is the lack of capital to invest in his business. 

Kousar perveen has applied for a loan from Asasah which will help her husband improve his scrap business by adding more scrap. Kousar perveen lives in Multan and does embroidery work to support her family financially. 

She is very hopeful that she will be able to help her children complete their education by increasing her household income through investment in the business.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es casada, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella y estudian, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, animales menores, que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también de casa en casa, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de gallina, chancho y cereales.
Maria sueña con construir mas ambientes en su casa  y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has seven children, six of whom live with her and are students. She travels around to different markets in the area to buy cereals and young animals which she then sells in the Ayacucho markets as well as door-to-door. Sometimes her husband helps her. Maria is a member of the Lirio Community Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy chickens, pork, and cereals. Her dreams are to build more rooms on to her house and to see her children get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, pork and cereals

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
Edmundo C. is from the town of Talibon. He is 48 years old. Edmundo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edmundo owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. He works hard to earn more and be able to support his children's education.

Edmundo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmundo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edmundo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, CEVI has numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush A. is 25 years old, and lives with her mother. To support herself and her mother from a young age, Siranush opened a clothing business which she has run since 2002. She rents a spot in a trading market place, from where she sells women’s clothing. Siranush regularly imports clothing to meet her clientele’s demand. It is more expedient for her to travel to the neighboring country to make the purchase personally. This loan will cover the purchase of clothing and customs fees.

loans.use: To cover the purchase of clothing and customs fees.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen L. D. Q. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Alegría, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada. La señora Maria del Carmen posee una tienda en la que comercializa diferentes tipos D. productos, ya sea para el cuidado y limpieza del hogar como también alimenticios, dicho negocio  esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que La señora María del Carmen no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda.
texts.en:
María del Carmen L. D. Q., 41, lives in the town of Alegría, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company. Maria has a store in which she sells different types of products, both household products and foods. This business is located in her house. She is asking for a loan so she will have enough money to stock her store. María asks this because she does not have the necessary funds to do it, and it is very necessary both for her and for her husband because this business allows them to cover their household expenses. She wants to be able to stock her store with products like detergent, canned foods, bread, snacks, drinks and other products which are basic necessities in a home and which are also asked for most in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products to stock a store

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en:
Enriquieta C. is from Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Enriquieta is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Enriquieta owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling of fruits in the local community. Enriquieta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Enriquieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Enriquieta is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Enriquieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
la sra. Teofila C. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Puente Trojes El Paraiso, Teofila se dedica a la venta de granos de maiz, este tipo de negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas compran maiz para hacer tortillas, tamalitos y tambien lo compran para comida para animales.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sacos de maiz ya que las exigencias de sus clientes han incrementado y a veces se queda sin maiz para la venta.
esta es la unica actividad que Teofila realiza para generar dinero para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Teofila C. is 59 and lives in the el Puente Trojes El Paraiso neighbourhood. Teofila sells corn. This type of business is very good since many people buy corn to make tortillas and tamalitos, and they also buy it for animal food. She will use this loan for the purchase of bags of corn since demand has increased and at times she runs out of corn to sell. This is Teofila's only job to generate income to cover her household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more planks

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun N., 32, is a professional tailor, making US$3 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has two children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US$5 every day, recharging batteries. Moeun N. would like a loan of US$1200 to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows.

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Edda Del Socorro tiene 60 años, es madre soltera y posee 4 hijos y dos son menores de edad a su cargo. La señora Edda se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y cosméticos, pues no solamente esta experiencia ha obtenido con estos negocios ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pues vive en una pequeña comunidad rural, esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con créditos, ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante. Todos los días se levanta temprano para atender a sus clientes que le solicitan variedad de productos. El financiamiento es para la  compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, resaltadores, hojas y cosméticos.
texts.en: Edda Del Socorro is 60 years old. She is a single mother and has 4 children: two are not yet adults and still in her care. Edda's work is selling school supplies and cosmetics. She has obtained her experience not only from these businesses, but also from her previous work selling clothing. She lives in a small rural community, and this is not her first experience with loans. Through great effort, she has been able to get ahead. Every day, she gets up early to serve her customers, who request a variety of products from her. This loan is for buying notebooks, pencils, erasers, highlighters, paper and cosmetics.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme remarquable de 48ans très ambitieuse et responsable ayant 5 personnes en charge. Commerçante des friperies. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors du premier prêt.
Le prêt lui à permis à améliorer sa manière de gérer son commerce car elle à appris la gestion de stock, comment tenir un journal de caisse et grâce à cela ses revenus journaliers ont augmentés de 30.000frs à 55.000frs.
Avec  le prochain prêt, elle va augmentée son stock pour faire accroître son capital en achetant divers ballots de friperie comme les draps et serviettes non utilises.
Elle à améliorer ses conditions de vie et de ses 4 enfants, qui en plus ont été inscrits dans des institutions privées; elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout de son objectif, toujours avec Hope pour qu'elle accomplisse ses ambitions
texts.en:
Celine is a remarkable, ambitious woman of 48 years old who is responsbile for 5 persons. She is a seller of cloth. She already received and successfully reimbursed a previous loan, which allowed her to improve the management of her business by learning how to manage her stock and keep a record of transactions. Her daily profits increased from 30.000 frs to 55.000 frs.

With is asking for another loan in order to further increase her stock by purchasing large bundles of cloth such as sheets and towels. She increased the quality of her life as well as those of her children, who are also currently enrolled in private education institutions. She would like to continue with her objectives and work with Hope microfinance institution to achieve her ambitions.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of sheets and towels

loans.name: Anna Wanjiru

texts.en:
Anna Wanjiru K. is a 52-year-old widow with three children aged 20, 25 and 32. They live in Lodwar, Kenya. Anna has had a business selling clothes for the past 12 years and now has an income of 26,500 KES per month.
She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend. She is applying for her fourth loan, of 60,000 KES, from KADET, after paying off her previous loans successfully. With this loan she plans to buy five bales of second-hand clothes to sell during the Chrismas season.
In the future, she hopes to operate a bigger boutique and extend her services to the town centre.

loans.use: To buy five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with seven children. Five of his children attend school, while the other two have graduated. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

Wilson operates a hawking business, selling biscuits and sweets from door to door to his neighbors and to shopkeepers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. With his KES 30,000 loan he wants to purchase a motorcycle and start a motorcycle business. He hopes to purchase a light transport van in the future.

Wilson decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and start a motorcycle business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. propietaria D. una banda musical llamada Show F.,ella dirige la banda musical animando diferentes compromisos como bautizos,cumpleaños y matrimonios,la socia quiere mejorar la banda musical. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar los uniformes para la banda musical.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Justina. She is 50, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business. She owns a musical band named Show F.. She manages the band, arranging different engagements such as baptisms, birthdays and weddings. She wants to improve the musical band. She is requesting this loan to purchase uniforms for the musical band. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase uniforms for the musical band.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Marta is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products like dried fish and squid in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Marta is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried squid. This will be the fifth loan she has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Florita owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Florita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yonny Daniel

texts.es: El señor U. Gonzáles Yonny Daniel se dedica a la labor de chofer de mototaxi la cual es propia también trabaja como albañil de tal manera cuenta con dos ingresos. Vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con sus padres ya que es soltero no tiene carga familiar. Solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi. Presenta buenas referencias ya que su mamá es cliente de la Caja Señor de Luren lo cual está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mr. Yonny Daniel U. Gonzáles works as a mototaxi driver; he owns the mototaxi.  He also works as a bricklayer so he has two sources of income.  He lives in the family home with his parents since he’s single and doesn’t have a family of his own to support yet.

He is asking for a loan for mototaxi service and repair.  He has good references since his mother is a Caja Señor de Luren client and is repaying punctually.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev P. is a widowed farmer who lives with two children in the Takeo province. She works raising animals and growing rice, typically making US $1.70 per day. She is also supported by two children working in a garment factory. 

Khiev P. wants to take out a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rujim

texts.en:
Rujim A. is from the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Rujim is single. 

To make a living, Rujim owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Rujim has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rujim joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Rujim is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rujim from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 61 years old, is married to T. Paul,  65 years old.  Together they have three children. Erick is 33 years old, Samantha is 28 (they are both working), and Caren is 23 years old and is in college.  T. is a businessman.  Alice runs a school located in their remote but busy area.  She has been in business for 3 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 2,500.

Alice was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has applied for her first loan to purchase desks for her school. If the loan boosts her business she plans to save for the future use. 

Alice dreams of starting a university in the future. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy desks for her school

loans.name: Abra Emefa

texts.fr: Agée de 59ans, Mme Emefa a 05 enfants et est mariée à un retraité.  Elle est dans le domaine de la vente d’habits de prêt à porter  il ya 34ans. Elle achète ses marchandises chez les dames qui viennent de la Chine et revend au grand marché de Lomé. Elle n’a pas eu de difficultés pour  payer ce premier prêt c’est pour cela elle sollicite encore ce montant pour acheter  plus de marchandises  pour vendre et avoir plus de bénéfices
texts.en:
Mrs. Emefa is 59 years old and has five children. Her husband is retired. She started selling ready to wear clothing 34 years ago. Her suppliers are ladies from China, and she conducts her sales at the grand market of Lomé. 

Having repaid her first loan without difficulties, she is seeking a new loan in the same amount to acquire more merchandise and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Srun S., 57, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Pre-Angkorean Temples. S. produces traditional baskets and sells fruit, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 78 on food and USD 90 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more fruit and baskets to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and baskets to resell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. is divorced and has six dependents. Aba sells kenkey (a sourdough dumpling) and fish at Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.

As a single parent, taking care of her dependents has been a little challenging. She needs a loan to increase the quantity of kenkey she can produce so that she can meet the needs of her family.

Aba plans to reinvest the increased profits from the expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of kenkey produced so she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Georgina; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de granos secos, la socia vende granos secos como trigo, papa, cebada y moraya,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos secos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Georgina is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dried grains.  She sells dried grains such as wheat, potato, barley and 'moraya' (freeze-dried potato).  She works from 8.00am to 8.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Georgina would like to expand and improve her business selling dried grains.  She is requesting this loan to buy dried grains wholesale.

Georgina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy dried grains wholesale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta, de 45 años reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí educó a su hija Mariluz de 15 años de edad. Que ahora vive en la capital donde recibe una buena educación que es su principal deseo. Ella tuvo que enfrentar momentos difíciles en su vida. Como madre soltera afrontó las responsabilidades de educación y gastos económicos de su hija. Los que asumió gracias al apoyo de “la agricultura”, actividad que le enseñaron sus padres y la que sigue realizando. Ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en la siembra de café, plátanos y palta en sus propios terrenos agrícolas; donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que acondicionó una pequeña casa dentro de sus cultivos. De esa manera podrá brindar la atención que requieren para ser frutos de calidad. Ahora ella se encuentra en la cosecha de café donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ganancias anuales por la venta a los acopiadores de la zona. Su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital que subsidia gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, que le ayudó a invertir más y generar mejores ganancias; las cuales gasta en la educación de su hija, que es su razón de vivir. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener el apoyo financiero que necesita. Jacinta de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del salario a los peones que le están ayudando en la recolección del los granos maduros de café. Asimismo comprará instrumentos como machetes y palas para limpiar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 45 years old and lives in the community of Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This is where she educated her 15 year-old daughter Mariluz.  Her daughter now lives in the capital where she is receiving a good education.  This is Jacinta's main wish.

Jacinta has had to confront some difficult moments in her life.  As a single mother, she had to face up to the responsibility of educating her daughter and covering her expenses.  She managed this thanks to the support of 'farming', a business activity that her parents taught her and which she continues to be engaged in today.  Jacinta has 15 years experience growing coffee, bananas and avocados on her own farmland.  This is where she spends most of her day since she fitted out a small home amongst her crops.  This means that she can give her crops the care that they need in order to provide good quality fruit.

Right now, Jacinta is harvesting her coffee.  She makes most of her annual profits by selling coffee to middlemen in her area.  Her biggest difficulty is a lack of capital but she manages thanks to to the support of her community bank which helped her to invest more and make better profits.  She spends these profits on educating her daughter as she is her reason for living.

Jacinta belongs to the 'Aroma de Café' (Aroma of Coffee) community bank and this is her first loan from MFP where she is certain that she will be able to obtain the financial support that she needs.  With your support, Jacinta will invest the money she has requested in paying the wages of the laborers who are helping her to collect her ripe coffee beans.  She will also buy tools such as machetes and spades with which to weed her crops.

loans.use: to pay the wages of the laborers who will help to harvest her coffee.  She will also buy machetes and spades

loans.name: Mashibei

texts.en:
Mashibei is 54 years old, married to James, and they are blessed with four children: they are thirty one years old, twenty nine years old, twenty two years old, and fourteen years years old. She has been running her livestock business for the past eleven years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 14,000 which she uses to take care of her family.

She has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use the entire loan to purchase more livestock.

She plans to use the profit from her business to buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to start a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to rear and sell later on at a profit.

loans.name: Edwin Jonathan

texts.es:
Edwin Jonathan tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como las enfermedades en los cultivos.Su sueño es comprar un solar y una casa.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jonathan is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He does not have children.

The members of the San Jacinto Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in Guare Parish, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Edwin is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his products at the Sin Rival and Suarez Commercial Centers, and then sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn and rice, as well as fertilizers for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops. His dream is to buy a piece of land and a house.

Edwin greatly enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 42 years old, is a pig feeder. Her husband is a farmer.  Their income is $14 per day. She has four children, all of whO. are studying. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $25 on rent, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like a loan of $600 to buy pigs and pig feed.  She plans to get a pig farm with her husband when she can save money.  She plans to send her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong was born in 1985, is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a driver.  She has been selling clothes in the market for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 Vietnamong (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007.  In the last cycle, she borrowed 7.194.000 VND and repaid punctually and this time she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). Aisha has a call center. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days a week. Aisha sells her products retail from home.  Aisha has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more sim packs and airtime She also generates additional income by selling paw paws. The main business challenges for Aisha include the rainy season which hinders customers from reaching her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop selling Airtime and Sim packs. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and sim packs

loans.name: Tao

texts.en:
Tao is a 43-year-old married woman living in the Reussey Keo Commune. 

Currently, she is a farmer. She has been farming for many years with her husband. She grows rice crops on land her grandparents own. From this business, she earns about $2 each day. 

She and her husband have given birth to two children. They are school-age. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, she is requesting a loan in order to grow her farming business. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting her farming business. 

She hopes that this loan will create more income for her family so that they can enlarge their house and send her children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth trabaja como enfermera particular y su esposo es chofer. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar mercadería, específicamente variedad de dulces y tener la posibilidad de abrir una tienda de dulces. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en la zona de Villa Huayna Potosí en la ciudad de El Alto; Elizabeth es casada y no tiene hijos . Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008 y se encuentra muy satisfecha con el crédito anterior que se le otorgó a través de Kiva y ahora desea repetir la excelente experiencia por segunda vez.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth works as a private duty nurse while her husband is a chauffeur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, specifically candy, so that she can pursue the possibility of opening a candy store. Elizabeth lives in her own home in the District of Villa Huayna Potosí in the city of El Alto. She is married and has no children.

Elizabeth has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and is very satisfied with her previous Kiva loan. She now wants to repeat her excellent experience for a second time.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of candy so that she can open a candy store.

loans.name: Lzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with 3 children. 

She runs a general store and has been in business for 5 years.  She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stock for her store.

Luzminda has been a MIGS member of PMPC for four years.  She is proud because they help her in terms of money when she needs it.  

In the future, Luzminda hopes to own a grocery store.  She is described as an honest person, a loving wife and good mother to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Merline Nadège

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 36 ans, célibataire avec une fille de 13 ans,a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de première  en 2004, elle se lance dans la vente de poisson sale. 
Ayant déjà bénéficie de 3 cycles de prêts auprès de Hope ,elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables, ses revenus ont largement augmentes, elle a en moyenne 40000 fr a 80000 fr par jour.

Pour ce quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer son stock en achetant des cartons de poissons sales, comme 10 cartons de Krovin,10 cartons de morues, 10 cartons de requins, 10 cartons de soles....Elle a commence a vendre le poisson en détails, en gros ,et demi gros.

Tres entreprenante, elle est très engagée dans le commerce, parce qu’elle tient a aller loin dans son commerce, avec les bénéfices , elle a achète  un terrain, ou elle est entrain de construire un dépôt pour qu'a la longue elle puisse faire la vente en gros du poisson sale. Tres bonne gestionnaire, elle s'occupe de la scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en:
Merline Nadège is 36 years old, single and has a daughter aged 13. She left school during her sixth year of high school and started selling salted fish in 2004. She has already completed 3 loan cycles with HOPE and has repaid her previous loans successfully. She has also seen a solid increase in revenue to, on average, between 40 000 and 80 000 francs a day, and has managed to build up considerable savings.

Merline Nadège is requesting a fourth loan so that she can restock on salted fish, including 10 cartons of Krovin fish, 10 cartons of cod, 10 cartons of shark and 10 cartons of sole. As well as selling fish to individual customers, she is also starting to sell fish semi-wholesale and wholesale. 

A very enterprising woman, Merline Nadège is fully engaged in her retail business and has big ambitions for it. She has already used some of her profits to buy some land on which she is now constructing a warehouse so that, eventually, she is able to build a wholesale business selling salted fish. A responsible and organised mother, she is making sure her daughter gets a good education.

loans.use: to buy cartons of salted fish wholesale.

loans.name: God Is Bless Group

texts.en: Adama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adama was born in a village called Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone, about 25 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has three children. Two are in primary school and one is not of school-going age. For many years now, Adama has been selling market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), oil, onions, sugar, fish, and so on. This is the second loan that Adama and her group members have applied for from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Adama will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, oil, onions, sugar, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Mrs. Chet is 32-year-old woman who has been living in a suburb area of Phnom Penh. She is married to Mr. Hong, a local farmer and cow breeder. The couple wishes to have children but unluckily, they don’t have one yet. Chet helps her husband in earning income by selling fried bananas to the people in the community. As shown in the photo, she is frying her bananas. Through this simple business, she can generate approximately $5USD a day. This year, Chet’s husband plans to buy a cow for breeding, yet their capital is inadequate. And now, Chet is asking for a loan from Kiva’s funders to support her husband’s business. This loan will help this family increase their profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en: Benigno is married with two children. He is sixty-three years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Benigno runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, he earns P2,500 doing this business. He requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock for his general store. He has been a member of PMPC for more than two years. In the future, Benigno hopes that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has six children between the ages of 22 and 30. Her husband is a businessman. For the past thirty years she has been selling charcoal. A problem she is facing is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase coal bags for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase coal bags for her business.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом зерновых культур. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Растениеводством она занимается уже год. Кредит берет для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Guldasta is in the business of growing vegetables and planting crops. She is 26 years old. She is married, with two children. She has been involved in agriculture for a year. She is requesting a loan for seeds for winter wheat.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for her children.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 10 years and sells a variety of items including snack foods, sugar, soap and other groceries.  Arlene has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is married and the mother of 5 children: three of whom are in school. Rubina is a very caring lady. She spends her time at home and completes her household responsibilities. She takes care of her family by fulfilling their needs. She is raising her children with great care and discipline so they become good citizens and make their parents proud. 
Rubina’s husband is a talented businessman. He is a blacksmith by profession. He makes and sells iron boxes which are used to store items such as clothes, quilts and blankets. This is a very popular and necessary item for a house.  
He has 10 years of experience in his work. 
Rubina has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying of iron and nails in larger quantity to make iron boxes to sell. 
She is hopeful that her husband will make positive use of the loan which enables him to meet his orders on time and generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy iron and nails for iron box making business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à HEREMAKONO CENTRE, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’huile alimentaire avec SAFIATOU, de céréales, de poissons, des condiments alimentaires et de la restauration.
SAFIATOU, seau plastique sur son pied, en chemise rose, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 bidons d’huile alimentaire. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of DANAYA are all married and, in average, are 38 and have 4 children. They live in monogamous families in HEREMAKONO CENTRE, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is the fourth time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is into cooking oil with SAFIATOU, cereals, fish, condiments, and catering.
SAFIATOU (the one with a plastic bucket in her lap, wearing an orange shirt) plans on buying 5 drums of cooking oil. She buys these items from wholesalers at the big market of Bougouni. She sells them at the big market of Bougouni as well as door-to-door to a customer base composed of men and women, who pay cash or on credit.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband pay for their daily expenses. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy drums of cooking oil.

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.en:
Geoconda is a seamstress who makes sheets and clothing. She has 8 years of experience in this type of activity. She started off as an assistant for someone else and moved on to take a course where she significantly improved her skills. Today she dedicates most of the day to her sewing and also helps her mom at night at her small restaurant. She needs the loan in order to invest in a new sewing machine now that hers is beginning to falter.

Geoconda is 25 years old and has 3 children. One of her kids has already started school and the others are still at young ages. Her husband drives Geoconda’s mother’s car as a taxi in order to bring in some income. Their dream is to purchase their own car and make improvements to their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest in a new sewing machine now that hers is beginning to falter.

loans.name: Paul Ngang

texts.en:
DESCRIPTION
Paul is married and father of six children. The death of two of his children and the high cost of keeping children off crimes are challenges, and he has decided to nurture his children to be exemplary in society. Decaying moral especially among young people is his motivation. With her three previous loans she succeeded in providing his community with food, Take-off capital to his son, and training his children in diverse survival skills.

Given a loan of $600, he plans to increase his son’s capital, buy more pigs, sticks and nails to repair pig-fence. His son commitment in operating groceries store, his experience in piggery, praises from community are indications that he will succeed. 

He plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Cultivating crops and assisting son with start-off capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To establish a hatchery

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng S. O. is 29 years old and the mother of one child. She runs a small booth selling different kinds of grocery products to the people in her community. This business’s activity earns her around $2.50 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3.70 each day from working as a fisherman and construction foreman.

Currently, S. O. would like to add different kinds of products to her store to meet her clients’ needs but she faces a financial constrain. Therefore, she is requesting for a $1,000 loan to help her purchase greater varieties of goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to meet her clients'  needs.

texts.en: T. (34) is a member of Yamida. She lives with her husband and two children. To supplement her husband's earnings, she is selling food and soft drinks in her place. She has six years of experience running this business, and she believes that it will be a good business. From the business she earns $2, and her husband earns $50 per month. Now she would like to expand the business, so she needs to borrow $100 to increase her earnings with additional products.

loans.use: To buy more products to run her business

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
Beronica is 34 years old, is married and has two children whom she is responsible for since the father of the children travels. At the moment she is renting a room in her mother in-law’s house, who gave Beronica the opportunity to put her business of selling Patasca (a meal) at the house. Simultaneously Beronica sells cosmetics.

A year before her main business was the sale of Yanbal cosmetics. It is not longer her main business since selling the meal Patasca is doing better. The business has a high demand because of the excellent location,( it is close to a bus stop) That’s why she has clients always. In addition,not many people dedicate themselves to the make this typical plate.

Beronica is asking for a loan of U$ 300. She is planning to buy 3 sets of tables for her business (U$80 per set) and wants to invest the rest of the money in ingredients .

She has had two loans from Kiva and she has paid it excellently. This is her third loan. She also has a loan with CRECER which she has been paying on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Beronica es una mujer de 34 años de edad que está casada y tiene dos hijos que están totalmente a su cargo ya que el padre de los niños se encuentra de viaje. Actualmente vive en alquiler y la dueña de casa, que es su suegra, le dió la oportunidad de poner su negocio de venta de Patasca en el mismo lugar, paralelamente Beronicase dedica a la venta de cosmeticos. Desde hace un año aproximadamente es que Beronica se dedica al 100% al negocio de la venta de comidas (Patasca), ya que antes su principal negocio era la venta de los cosméticos, ofrecía y promocionaba productos de Yanbal, ahora este negocio paso a un segundo plano. Todo negocio de comidas es bien demandado sobre todo por la excelente ubicación que tiene el puesto de Beronica, se encuentra cerca a una parada de transporte público de pasajeros, es por esta razón que siempre cuenta con clientela, además que no muchas personas se dedican a la elaboración de este plato típico. Con la presente solicitud Beronica se comprará tres juegos de mesa para su negocio de comida aun precio de $us. 80.- cada uno, el resto del dinero piensa invertirlo en ingredientes para la elaboración de la Patasca. Anteriormente ha tenido dos créditos en nuestra Institución, los cuales a cancelado excelentemente, este es su tercer préstamo. También tiene una deuda en Crecer que está pagando puntualmente.

loans.use: TO BUY 3 SETS OF TABLES

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
A. Khanlar was born in the Gubadli region, which is now in the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory and situated in the west part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.  Right now, he lives with his family in Sumgayit city.  He is 48 years old and father of two children.  His elderly father and mother live with him as well.  He is the only breadwinner of his family. 

He started his bread baking business in 1997.  Having borrowed a loan in 2005 for the amount of $500 from Normicro, he expanded his business.  A second time, he borrowed $800 and made repair works to his business place.  The loans were both paid back timely. 

Now, he would like to receive a $1200 loan in order to buy necessary equipment for his business and increase his number of clients.  He will repay the loan within 12 months.  He hopes to eventually expand his business, which will further improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: in order to buy necessary equipment for his business and increase the number of clients

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children. She sells matooke (green banana) in the market. She intends to use the extra business profits to construct a shelter for her matooke.

loans.use: To expand the business from retail to wholesale

loans.name: Anna's Neema Group

texts.en:
Anna E., age 48, is single with 1 child. Anna owns a charcoal business, which she started 6 years ago. Working from 6am-6pm daily, she earns about $18 a month from this business.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Anna belongs to the loan group called Neema and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Grace M., Happiness Y., Agnes I., and Hadija H.. These women have businesses dealing in cothing, snacks, and food vending.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock (inventory)

loans.name: Ziada's Amani Group

texts.en:
Ziada is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 8 years old. Ziada owns a small salon and sells cloth. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

In the past, Ziada has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more items for business.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola I. is 40 years of age, married with 4 children, and hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. Bola has been selling kerosene for 1 year. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and has been in her business for the past 7 years. Bola is requesting a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more kerosene for sale. This will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Mariamu's Mt Everest D Group

texts.en:
Mariamu, age 35, is married with 3 children (ages 12, 2, and 6 months). She runs a soft drink retail shop, which she started in 2001. She works from 6:30am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $180 from her sales.

In the past, Mariamu took a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more inventory of soft drinks. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have clothing businesses and sell general items.

In the picture, Mariamu is second from the right.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of soft drinks

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Kudiratu O. lives in the town of Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria. For the last four years she has made a living selling chin- chin, a popular local snack. Kudiratu is 38 years old and married with four children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the last four years, and has applied for a new loan for $700 to buy more flour so that she can bake chin-chin in large enough quantities to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour for baking chin-chin, a snack made from flour

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria H. works selling household cleaning products. Since she began her business, she has continued to increase her income and has been able to take care of her young daughter. As a single mother, Maria has sole responsiblity for her child's welfare. Her business has enabled her to maintain her small home, and she's made good use of the loans she's received from Ceprodel, using the money to purchase more products to sell. She is requesting a new loan to grow her business, increase her income, and continue to care for her young daughter.

La señora Maria H. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos químicos de limpieza para el hogar. Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido a su familia el cual consta de su pequeña hija a la que tiene que mantener por ser madre soltera.

Desde que inició con su negocio ha logrado mantener su humilde hogar y ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de los productos químicos de limpieza del hogar. Hoy en día una vez mas solicita un crédito para la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER BUSINESS SELLING HOUSEHOLD CLEANING PRODUCTS.  THE INCOME FROM HER BUSINESS ENABLES THIS HARDWORKING SINGLE MOTHER TO CARE FOR HER YOUNG DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Fatoumata Lamine

texts.fr:
Fatoumata Lamine C., married with three children in her care, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for six and a half years. She buys and sells brushes and bananas, contributing towards her family’s daily expenses and improving their living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata Lamine C., mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle achète et revend des balais et des bananes. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell brushes and bananas

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: IF. Emmanuel is 43 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the business of making furniture for a long time. He requests a loan amount of $700 to buy more furniture materials. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy furniture materials

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: L aeñora A. C. tiene 46 años de edad,es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya son casados, sus otros dos hijos, tienen 18 años este estudia El bachillerato con computacion y el otro tiene 13 añosa de edady cursa el primer año de secundaria, su conyugue es de oficio mecanico y vende repuestos de bicicletas, aportando de esta menera al nucleo familiar, la actividad eocnomica de la señoara es una pequeña puleria ubicada en el kilometron 104 carretera leon chinandega mejor conocido como telica, actividad que tiene de llevar cabo cuatro años , teniendo la vision de obtener otros ingresos ya que ella es profesora y el slario del maestro no es muy bueno, y su esposo como mecanico que tambien es muy pequeño los ingresos de ahi la necesidad de poner una pulperia y ayudar en la fromacion de los hijos, su amyor sueño es poder inyectarel mas capital a su peuqeña puleria hasta convertirla en una miscelanea y ofertar gran variedad de producots para el consumo del hogar y ser una de las mas grandes del sector, con el credito pretende ir fortaleciendo su actividad e inventario comprando arroz, azucar aceite, gaseosa, detergente cosmeticos, pollo, huevo, leche y otros productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. C. is 46 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom are married. Her two younger children, both boys, are 18 and 13 years old. Her older son is finishing high school, where he studies Computer Science, and her younger son is a freshman in high school. Her partner, who she lives with, is a mechanic and sells bicycle parts to help support the family. For the past four years, Mrs. A. C. has owned a small local store located at Kilometer 104 of the Leon Chinandega highway, which is better known as Telica. This is her second source of income: she is a schoolteacher, but does not earn very much since her teacher's salary is so low. Since her partner doesn't earn very much as a mechanic, either, she decided to open the store to better support her children. Her greatest dream is to inject more capital into her small store to offer a wider variety of merchandise for household consumption and to grow the store into one of the biggest in the area. With this loan, she plans to expand and strengthen her inventory by buying rice, sugar, oil, soda, detergent, cosmetics, chicken, eggs, milk and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for local store

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her elder son is a painter. Her younger son is in 5th standard. Her eldest daughter is in 10th standard. Her younger daughters are in 7th standard. Anwar baji’s husband has a grocery shop and has been running this shop for the past 4 years. Anwar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sadaf baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (potatoes, cooking oil and spices) to make Punjabi items (samosas and pakodas). Rani baji wants a loan to buy plastic sheets for her plastic sheets selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul lives in district 9 of Kabul Afghanistan. He was in Pakistan for more than 10 years with all the members of his family. He had worked in a shop for refrigerators and other electronic materials where he had a good number of clients, but after the collapse of the Taleban in Kabul he came back and opened a shop in Kabul. For the first time his business was not good in Kabul because he didn’t have enough clients here, but now he can attract a good number of customers.

Now he requests an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 18 months to enlarge his shop and buy some necessity materials to further his business. 

He is very happy now that he has good business and can enlarge his shop. He would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for furthering this loan in Afghanistan. He plans to be a good engineer in this field and would like to continue his partnership.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Yat H., 56, is a widowed farmer living in the Kampong Cham province with her children. She typically makes $1 US each day, and one of her children is a goldsmith. The climate conditions have been unfavorable in Cambodia this past year for farming and this has caused food prices to soar. Inflation has also been out of control, and this has turned into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Yat H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1000 US to invest in the goldsmith business. She sees this business opportunity as a way to increase her income and to provide a higher standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: To invest in the goldsmith business.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
These women are Kadiatu K. and Aminata T.. They have named their group Together as One. They are both local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to expand the size of their businesses. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is twenty-eight years of age. She was born in Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Her husband is an architect and the two of them have three children. The eldest is in class four, the second is in class two, and the last is just three years old. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for five years now.

Kadiatu sells market food, cigarettes, soft drinks, and sometimes bowls. She will use this new loan to expand on her business by buying one “batter” of cooking oil (five gallons make a batter), one batter of palm-oil, a bag of rice, two gross of cigarettes, mints, gum, bars of soap, and so on. A batter of cooking oil costs Le 75,000, a batter of palm-oil is Le 60,000, and a bag of rice costs Le 102,000. All of these items she will have to purchase in Makeni except for the bowls which she will have to travel to Freetown (Le 372 round-trip) to buy.

Kadiatu’s dream is to save a lot of money so that she can buy herself a plot of land (a plot of land usually costs something between US$ 500 to US$ 1000 depending on the location) and to see that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying palm-oil, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
A. Nabi is 67 years old. He is married and the father of 3 children. Nabi is a hard-working man who has struggled to provide for his family and educate his children, who are today, working adults thanks to his example. Nabi is an enterprising man who constantly tries to make things better and to improve every day. He works hard in his fields and spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing the land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Nabi needs tools and fertilizers to continue his difficult work of tending his crops, so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. He is applying for a loan of $ 500 USD. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Nabi.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian U. is 29 years old and married with one child. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is a LAPO client. Lilian hopes for a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilber C. es nacido en la provincia de Manuel Maria Caballero de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, actualmente vive en la planchada localidad del Torno, hace aproximadamente unos quince años que vive en el lugar.Esta casado la esposa e hijos le colaboran en las tareas culturales durante todo el año. 
El se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, además también se dedica a la ganadería cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno.
Quiere seguir aumentando capital en la ganadería.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilber C. was born in the province of Manuel Maria Caballero in the City of Santa Cruz and now lives in the La Planchada area of Del Torn where he has been for the past 15 years. He is married and his wife and children help with the work throughout the year. He works in agriculture and raises livestock and has 15 head of cattle. He wants to add to his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting Kidney Beans

loans.name: Afde No 15 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 15 ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Grand Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Certaines d’entre elles exercent l’activité de restauration, et certaines vendent de tissus.  Elles ont appris à cuisinier depuis elles étaient jeunes, donc elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans ces activités. Les habits des femmes en Afrique de L’Ouest font un parti de la culture essentiel, et toutes les femmes port les vêtements très colorants, donc le commerce de tissus marche bien.  Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock de tissus et de renforcer son activité de restauration, au comptant au marché Grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000CFA ($60) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
“Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE Numéro 15” is composed of five women who average 38 years of age and who live in large traditional extended families in the Grand Thiès district in the city of Thiès, located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. They know one another through ties of community and kinship. Some of them do food catering, and some sell cloth. They learned how to cook when they were young, so they are very experience and in high demand in these businesses. Women’s clothing in West Africa is an essential part of the culture, and all women wear very colorful clothing. Commerce in fabrics therefore does well.

With regard to improving the quality of their services and expanding their businesses, the members of this reliance group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They received a group loan before from IMCEC, and they indeed repaid it.

The group members plan to use this loan to replenish their stock of cloth and to bolster their restaurant business, accepting cash at the Grand Thiès marketplace.

The group members hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for family needs, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and to strengthen their restaurant business

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Eudosia es conviviente, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo, Eudosia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Eudosia viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eudosia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergente
Los sueños de Eudosia son mejorar su casa y educar a su hija.
texts.en:
Eudosia is a member of the Solution Communal Bank. Eudosia is a common-law wife, is 49 years old, and has one child. She has a store in her home where she sells general groceries every day with the help of her daughter. In addition, Eudosia travels to the regional markets where she buys cereal grains, which she then sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Eudosia needs a loan of 1,200 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap and detergent. Eudosia dreams of improving her house and of educating her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, soap, and detergent

loans.name: Olesta

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Olesta T. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 16. Olesta has been running a shop since 1994 selling common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and currently earns about $150 a month. Olesta is requesting a loan in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Las Productoras De Patahuasi Group

texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Productoras D. Patahuasi” are from the community of Patahuasi, Vischongo District, in the Province of Vilcashuaman. The community can be found at 3600 meters above sea level. The principle activities of the community are agriculture and raising livestock.
