The members of the bank are involved in different businesses. For example, Yolanda, who is married with 5 children, sells cheese that she first buys in markets. Previously she was dedicated to buying and selling small animals. With the loan that she hopes to obtain, she will invest in buying cheese. Yolanda hopes that her children will become professionals and that her family will better itself.

Maximiliana is married and has five children. Maximiliana and her husband have a grain mill where they offer the service of grinding flour and where they also process purchased cereal. The loan that Maximiliana hopes to obtain would be invested in buying mO. cereal and maintaining the mill. Maximiliana dreams that her children will become professionals. 

Dina lives with her partner and 3 children. She has a grocery stO. in her house where she sells basic groceries. She does this with the help of her spouse. With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will buy mO. groceries. Dina dreams that her children will study at university one day and that her business will improve.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, groceries, cereal and to pay for maintaining a mill.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. is a borrower in the Semkini group at the Kihesa branch of BRAC in Iringa, Tanzania. She is twenty-three years old and single. 

Sara has been a food vendor in Iringa for one year and hopes to expand her business. She works for twelve hours a day and usually makes about $92 a month in profit. She wants to invest more money into her business and increase those profits. 

To reach this goal, she recently applied for and received her first loan from BRAC Tanzania. The loan is for 200,000 TZS, which is about $150. She will use this capital to improve her vending business. When Sara begins to gain extra profit due to the loan, she plans to invest it back into the business, so that it can continue to grow.

loans.use: To improve her vending business

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Hawa R., age 32, is married with two children aged 14 and 10 years. She has had a grocery business since 2008 and also sells food and chips in the same place. She works from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $190.
 
This will be Hawa’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to improve on the place where she does her business.

Hawa will share this loan with her group, Forkland, which totals 21 members. The members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Hawa is in the middle in a blue and white dress, front row.

loans.use: To improve on the place where she does business

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun P., 38, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with her five children in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 each day, while her husband works recharging batteries. Her husband makes about US$5 each day as well.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Oeun P. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for their transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Delia es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Delia tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad, en donD. brinda servicios D. impresiones, también tiene cabinas D. Internet y reparación D. computadoras.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que  será invertido en L. compra D. tintas y papeles.
Los sueños D. Delia son tener mas capital para tener productos en stock.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the cooperative bank Ccatarisun, which means "Let's rise up" in Quechua. Delia is single, 22 years old, and lives with her parents. She has a printer's shop in a rented site located in the center of the city. She provides printing services and also offers cubicles with Internet access and repair of computers. She needs a loan of $325, which will be invested in ink and paper. Delia's dream is to have more capital in order to have products in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ink and paper

loans.name: Turfosa Achieng

texts.en:
Turfosa Achieng is a forty four year old lady married to Amos, a teacher. They have seven children between the ages of 25 and 11. She runs a small cafe in a semi-permanent building and has done so for the last three years. Income generated from this business has helped her educate her children and uplifted her living standards. Her clients are mainly employees from the town and teachers who are her husband's colleagues.

Turfosa learned about KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing client and she joined. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to extend her veranda and purchase more seats to accommodate more clients during the lunch time hour.

She aspires to purchase and develop a plot of land, where she can move her business.

--------------- About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en:
Maylene is 24 years old and engaged in the direct selling of Avon and Natasha products. She sells beauty products, sandals, shoes, clothes, bags and other accessories. According to Maylene, her business is going well but she still wants to buy additional products to sell in her village to gain extra income for her daily needs. In line with this, she is now asking for financial capital of 4,000 PHP. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise, which she believes will also increase her income.

Maylene is still single and she is helping her parents. She hopes that she can access the loan she is requesting. She works hard to earn more profit for her family's welfare.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es: María Cruz A. D. F. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango en la capital D. El Salvador. María vive con sus dos hijas y su esposo quien se dedica a la carpintería. María tiene una tienda con seis años D. experiencia, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa donD. la mayoría D. sus clientes son los vecinos D. la zona, el crédito que solicita María es para solidificar su tienda y también la carpintería D. su esposo que urge D. materiales para aumentar la producción D. sus muebles.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: La Buena Union 1, 2 And 3 Group

texts.en:
S. is the group coordinator of Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) La Buena Union (The Good Union). His story is representative of the others in his group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients.

S. is 51 years old and lives alone in a rural area near Sabana D. la Mar in the Dominican Republic. He lives in a house maD. of wood with cement floors. He has unreliable access to running water and electricity. S. has two sons that are grown and live on their own.

This will be S.' first loan with Esperanza. He is a farmer and plans to use the money to buy farming tools and seeds to plant. He will then sell his fruits and vegetables to local merchants. He hopes to be able to produce more with the supplies he purchases with this loan so that his business can grow. S. would like to continue to work hard so that he can improve his living conditions. Specifically, he would like to make improvements to his house. His roof and walls leak when it rains and he hopes to be able to repair the roof and someday build a house with cement blocks.

loans.use: Farming supplies, seeds, equipment

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una socia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 43 años, madre de dos hijos menores, Rosario se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarro, este negocio funciona en su casa, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la venta. Integra el Banco Comunal “Las Caribeñas” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de lubricantes.
Con este crédito de 2,500 soles comprará accesorios y lubricantes de motos y  motocar. La meta de Rosario es seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas y así poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario, 43, is a cheerful, hard-working member who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of two minor children. Rosario sells replacement parts for motorcycles and vehicles from her home. She and her husband work together. She has been a member of the “Las Caribeñas” communal bank for the past 3 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy lubricants. With this 2,500 sol loan she will buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants. Her goal is to continue working to increase her profits in order to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamadou Koné  est âgé de 29 ans, marié  et père d’un  enfant.  Il vit  dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs autres ménages au quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).

Mamadou a abandonné l’école en classe de 3ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour des raisons personnelles. Il commença alors à apprendre  le métier de tailleur  auprès de son oncle et cela pendant 3 ans. 

Après cette phase d’apprentissage riche en expériences, il décida d’évoluer seul depuis maintenant 14 ans. Il jouit d’une grande notoriété due à son de génie de création de nouveautés.
En plus de cette activité de tailleur, Mamadou Koné fait également de temps à autres la commercialisation de céréales.

Dans le souci  de renforcer  son activité, il  a fait recours  au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser  pour acheter, 2 machines à coudre  de marque 20 U.  

Il  s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou. Monsieur  Mamadou   Koné fait ses prestations et vend ses habits au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de se prendre en charge (nourriture, habillement) et assurer les besoins de l’atelier. 
Son ambition est de faire du  stockage commercialisation de céréales à Ségou.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mamadou Koné is 29 years old, married, and father of one child. He lives in a traditional extended family with several other families in the Darsalam neighborhood in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mamadou abandoned his studies in the third grade of basic school (Malian educational system) for personal reasons. He then started to learn the tailoring trade alongside his uncle for three years. After this stage of his apprenticeship, during which he learned a great deal, he decided to branch out on his own; that was fourteen years ago now. He has a great reputation due to his genius for creating unique items. In addition to his tailoring business, Mamadou Koné also occasionally sells grain. In an effort to improve his business, he has turned to the loan program offered by the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is Mamadou's first individual loan, with which he intends to buy two 20U sewing machines. He buys his supplies locally in Ségou. He makes the clothes and sells them for cash or credit to both men and women. With this loan he hopes to generate a monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow him to take care of his expenses (e.g., food, clothing) and provide for the needs of his workshop. His ambition is to get into commercial grain storage in Ségou.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is 28 years old and married with one child. Wissam has owned a phone shop where he buys new and used phones. In 2007, he also started repairing phones. Today, Wissam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more phones and phone tools, so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Este comité integrada por 18 mujeres emprendedoras se encuentra en  décimo ciclo. Cada una de la integrantes cuenta con un Perfil diferente ya que cada una se dedica a  una actividad independiente  y se detalla como sigue: 
Maria E. V..Venta de mercaderias
Elida V..Venta de comestible
Maria F. M.Venta de merceria
Maria i. M.Venta  de carbòn
Maria Perez.Venta de Ropas
Isabel L..Venta de frutas 
Fermina A..Venta de empanadas
Teresa T..Venta de ropas
Ancia Teresa L..Venta de plateria
Johana G..Venta de ropas
Maria Natalia T..Venta de Tele Bingo
Angela Lucia O..Modista
Mariza M..Venta de lenceria
Maria Liz  M..Venta de cosmeticos 
Yolanda A..Venta de comidas
Ester A..Venta de frutas
Luciana G..Venta de ropas
Sandra M..Peluquera
 Se puede mencionar el caso especifico de la señora la Sra. Angela Lucia O. quien tiene 38 años de edad , con un 1 hijo que se queda con la  vecina  ya que su mama  Doña Angela trabaja fuera de su casa, además de su trabajo ambulante en su casa los fines de semana ella confecciona ropas para criatura y  sabanas sale a vender por los asentamientos. Su  sueño es tener una  casa propia, actualmente tiene una casita  precaria hecha de pedasos de tablas, a través de la ayuda de la  Fundación desea refaccionar su pequeña casita.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 18 enterprising women who are in their 10th loan cycle. Each one of these members has a different profile because each one has a unique independent business that is explained as follows: Maria E. V.: merchandise sales Elida V.: foodstuff sales Maria F. Meaurio: notions sales Maria i. Mareno: coal sales Maria Perez: clothing sales Isabel L.: fruit sales Fermina A.: the sale of empanadas Teresa T.: clothing sales Ancia Teresa L.: silverware sales Johana G.: clothing sales Maria Natalia T.: Tele Bingo sales Angela Lucia O.: dressmaker/designer Mariza M.: lingerie sales Maria Liz M.: cosmetics sales Yolanda A.: food sales Ester A..Venta: fruit sales Luciana G.: clothing sales Sandra M.: beauty parlor It is worth mentioning the specific case of Señora Angela Lucia O.. Angela is 38 years old and has one child who she leaves with a neighbor since her mother, Doña Angela, works outside of the house. In addition to her business selling in the street, during the weekends she makes clothing for infants and bed sheets and sells them in the housing settlements. Her dream is to have her own house; currently she has a meager cottage that is built with planks of wood. With the help of the Foundation she would like to renovate her small cottage.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Bingo cards for sale, fabrics for dressmaking, work tools and merchandise such as fruit, flour, pasta, eggs, rice, sugar, clothing and household utensils

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa M. est un jeune homme âgé de 29 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 4 ans. Il est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis octobre 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficie  de prêt. Il évolue  depuis 2003 dans le secteur de la couture et.ses services sont destines aux enfants, aux hommes et aux femmes.Il a choisi le métier de tailleur par passion et a commence par être  apprenti-tailleur. Ce qui le passionne le plus dans son activité c’est le fait de confectionner de beaux habits. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour élargir son salon de couture et installer des accessoires pour rendre plus confortable l’accueil des clients. Il envisage aussi d’acheter une nouvelle machine pour rendre plus compétitive son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices  et mieux assister sa petite famille et ses parents.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr Moussa M. is a young man aged 29, who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne in the town of Yoff. He is married and the father of two children, aged 2 and 4. He became a member of the Yoff branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC in October 2009 and had never got a loan. Since 2003 he operates in the dressmaking business and provides his services to children, men and women. He chose to become a tailor because he had a passion for dressmaking, and began as an apprentice tailor. His greatest passion in his business is creating beautiful dresses.

He applies for a loan of 300,000 CFA francs to expand his salon and install accessories to make his store more comfortable for his customers. He wants also to buy a new sewing machine to become more competitive, increase his profit and better provide for his small family and his parents.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his dressmaking salon

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles S. is a 40 year old business man. He is married with three children. Charles is a trader who deals with utensils. He has been in this business for over 3 years. Charles is asking for a loan to purchase home utensils such as basins, cups, plates, spoons, forks, knives, frying pan, sauce pans, flasks, clocks, and so forth for sale. His aim is to expand his business. Charles's future plan is to open up another branch. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To purchase home utensils for for sale.

loans.name: Democrita

texts.en:
Democrita G. is a 60-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Miranda, Bolobitoon, Hinigaran City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her eatery and general store.

Democrita’s husband Ernesto helps her run the business. They have six children who are between the ages of 19 and 32. Some of their children have their own work, and one child is currently going to school.

Democrita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her eatery and general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $175 from her business activities.

Democrita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which was also funded by Kiva lenders, was used to fund the operations of her eatery and general store business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 16th loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her business. Democrita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Tamarsu' group from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of strenthening their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales, better profit and consequently improve their living standard. 

Forty-year-old Mariatu T. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka and is married to a businessman. They 4 children who are attending secondary school. For 15 years now, Mariatu has been selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, books, etc. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying these items wholesale. 

(On the right in the photo is the Loan Officer, Abdul Karim Conteh, handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, soaps, and books wholesale

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: LUIS TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, EL ES UN CLIENTE CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGO CON TFC FINANCIERA, SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE HACE YA DOS AÑOS, EL VIVE EN CASA DE LOS ABUELOS DE SU CONYUGE, TIENE  UN MENOR HIJO DE 02 AÑOS DE EDAD, LUIS SUEÑA CON TENER SU CASA PROPIA Y DARLE A SU HIJO LO MEJOR POR ELLO TRABAJO DIARIAMENTE PARA PODER CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE LA MANUTENCION DEL MENOR, EL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE UNA MOTOTAXI, SE LE PROPONE EL CRÉDITO POR CONTAR CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES, VOLUNTAD Y CAPACIDAD DE PAGO.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is a TFC Financiera client who has behaved well with respect to his repayment obligations. For the past 2 years he has provided public transportation services. He lives in his spouse's granparents' home and has a two-year-old son. Luis dreams with having his own house and providing the best for his son. He works daily to support his child. He is asking for funds to buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). The loan is offered thanks to his good personal references, his good will and capacity to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo).

loans.name: Kisindizi A Nambere Rose Group

texts.en: N. Rose is a hardworking businesswoman, 32 years old who is staying with her spouse. They are blessed with five children. Four of the children are schooling. She is a farmer and she has been carrying out farming activities for over 14 years. She cultivates crops like maize, beans, sugar cane, tomatoes, vegetables, and so forth for sale. She is using the loan to plow her farm, purchase fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and so forth for the good of her crops. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To plow her farm and buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en: Pamella isa single of two children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two roomed house where the family stays. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family,rent and school fees. Pamella owns a retail shop selling cosmetics and sells to all categories of people at both retail . Pamella is proud of her business because she can pay rent,school fees and feed her familty. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping and goes for shopping twice a month . She  . Pamella works seven days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of cosmetics, like hair conditioners, weaves, braids and creams. Business challenges includes tarnsportation and evr increasing prices of cosmetics. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big in order to buy a plot of land  to build a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics like hair conditioners, creams, weaves and barids

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario vive en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; es profesor jubilado y percibe una renta muy pequeña con la cual mantiene a su familia. Recientemente tuvo un accidente que le hizo perder la vista, además tiene un hijo paralítico por lo tanto el crédito que solicita es para que su esposa ayude en la familia, comprando y vendiendo diferente mercadería, para así ayudar con los gastos y de esta manera poder salir adelante.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mario lives in his own home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. He is a retired teacher who receives a very small income to support his family. Recently, he suffered an accident that caused him to lose his sight; also, he has a son who is paralyzed. The loan he is seeking is to help his wife to start a business to help support the family; she will buy and sell various products in order to help with the household expenses and help the family to move forward. Mario is an Impro customer who has always paid back his loans so he is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell (clothing, kitchen products)

loans.name: Evelyn Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Evelyn Vanessa posee un negocio de venta de mercadería en general como cosméticos perfumes y ropa de manera ambulante, tiene 31 años de edad  es madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo. Evelyn sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, pues a pesar de que todos los días son muy difíciles nunca se da por vencida siempre está pendiente de que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día, ya que ella  es muy responsable. El financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisas, trajes y ropa interior. Su deseo es salir adelante cada día.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn Vanessa runs a traveling sales business in which she sells general merchandise such as cosmetics, perfume, and clothes. She is 31, and is the mother of two children who are able to go to school thanks to her hard work. Evelyn goes out everyday to sell her products on her bicycle which is her only mode of transportation. Even though her days are very difficult she never gives up because she is responsible, and knows that she can't let her children go hungry. The loan is for the purchase of pants, skirts, shirts, suits, and underwear. Her wish is to keep moving forward everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother. She had three children and all of them died. She now takes care of the grandchildren from her late children. Mary resides in and owns a four room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

Mary used to have a pub but changed her business enterprise to a retail shop, which she has been running for a few months. Her customers are the local people and her neighbors. She works seven days a week. Mary’s business challenges include seasonality and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her shop in Nsooba. Mary wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, rice, boxes of soap and cooking oil. Besides this business, Mary also gets some income from rental rooms. She hopes to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as sugar, cooking oil, rice and soap

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 40 years old. Virginia is married and has four school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is now requesting her fourth loan from HSPFI, for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married  to a business man and they have seven children, all of whom are at school. She plans to use the loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She does not have any additional income. She works in Kawempe market selling bananas. Her major business challenge is transportation. She buys bunches of bananas from Mbarara and Masaka Districts and uses public transport to and from Masaka. Hadjah works seven days a week and aspires to see her business grow so she can start selling wholesale. She joined MCDT because it was helping poor women get a living. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees. She rents a two-roomed house which has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa B. currently sells charcoal at her home and is requesting a loan in order to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  She is 41 years old and married a watchman. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loans, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the village of Dadda in Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old. Maria is married and has nine grown children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock with her husband. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Iktimal

texts.en:
Iktimal is a 57 year old married woman living in Tripoli with her husband and 3 children.  Iktimal has been selling candies and clothing since 2000 and by doing this helps her husband make their living.

This is Iktimal’s fifth loan with Al Majmoua.  She invests her loans in increasing and improving her business. This time for sure she will use the loans for the same purpse, in addition to doing necessary maintenance on her house.

She hopes to open a clothing shop and to start selling candies wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
La señora Miriam Gutiérrez P. tiene cincuenta años de edad, es casada con el señor Rosario G. Gutiérrez, en el cual tienen en su poder a un hijo Rafael de diecisiete años de edad que estudia la preparatoria por que quiere ser ingeniero agrónomo.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar ingredientes, como son: harina, aceite, huevo, royal, canela, para la elaboración de panes, así también comparar pollos para venderlo aliñados (destazados) en la misma comunidad. Para que con ello logre obtener ingresos en su hogar y salga adelante con su familia.

   Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y juntos mantenga una aportación para salir adelante dándose el mejor apoyo de trabajar cada uno con su actividad.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus dos negocios, compra  todo lo necesario y no verse limitada de ninguna de sus a dos actividades, y pueda tener  mejores ingresos cada día.

   Su sueño es que con sus ahorros logre construir una casita más amplia donde vivir cómodamente, también quiere apoyar a su hijo a que termine una carrera para que tenga mejores logros en la vida.

    Miriam se integro al grupo por una invitación que le izo su hija doña María Irene quien es la representante del grupo a solicitar un préstamo para trabajarlo en sus actividades, el grupo se llama el lirio la razón del grupo es porque en casa de una de ellas tiene une flores de lirio.

   Los integrantes del grupo lirio son tres y cada una con diferente actividad:

  María Irene G. Gutiérrez: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas para venderlo en la región.
  Miriam Gutiérrez P.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes en la elaboración de panes, como son: harina, leche, huevo, aceite, entre otros.
  María de Jesús Ramírez R.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de cortes para su sastrería y elaborar ropas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 50 years old, married to Rosario, and they have a son, Rafael, 17, who is in preparatory school, because he wants to be an agronomic engineer. Miriam is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like wheat, oil, eggs, yeast, and cinnamon, to bake bread. She also wishes to buy chickens to dress and sell in her community. This so she can obtain income and advance her family. She was motivated to carry out this activity to help her husband earning household income and, together, to make a contribution to their advancement, each one giving the best they could with their own activity. With the earnings obtained from her two businesses, she can buy all the necessities and not see herself limited in either of her activities, and she can have better income each day. Miriam's dream is, with her savings, to be able to build a roomier house where they can live comfortably. Also, she wants to help her son finish his education so that he can achieve more in life. Miriam joined the group by invitation of her daughter, Maria Irene, who is the group's representative in soliciting a loan for the group's activities. The group has 3 members, each with a different activity: Maria Irene: borrowing for her business, buying and selling clothes in the region Miriam: to buy ingredientes for baking bread (like flour, milk, eggs, oil, among others) Maria de Jesus: to buy cloth for her sewing shop to make clothes. The group is named “El Lirio” because in one member's house there are irises.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTS SUCH AS FLOUR, OIL, EGGS, AMONG OTHERS, TO BAKE BREAD TO SELL

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia;  La socia tiene  38 años de edad;  ella es natural de Oropesa y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia compra y vende golosinas en la entrada del molino 1, este es un centro comercial muy amplio en el cual la socia a adquirido un local para vender sus golosinas traídas de la frontera con Bolivia, La socia esta deseando viajar y requiere el préstamo para comprar su mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para vender en su local. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Celia, 38, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is from Oropesa and a single mother of two children.  She is a retailer.  She buys and sells sweets at the entrance to El Molino #1 which is a large shopping center where she acquired a stand in which to sell the sweets she brings from the border with Bolivia.  She wants to travel and needs the loan to buy merchandise.  She is asking for funds to invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell in her stand.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and at the same time pledges to repay it in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise to sell.

loans.name: We Believe We Self Group

texts.en:
Memunatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memunatu was born in Makeni city about 32 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children who are attending school. For seven years now, Memunatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and slippers. 

This is not the first loan that Memunatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Memunatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy gara lappers making materials like caustic soda, powder, inks, white cotton cloths, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of gara cloths. She will also buy dozen of slippers to add to her business. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower, Rugiatu K., who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials (caustic soda, powder, inks, white cotton cloths, etc) and slippers to add to her business

loans.name: Julia Maxmiliana

texts.es:
Julia Maxmiliana tiene 56 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Julia Maxmiliana es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es costura de profesión y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio donde brinda servicio de costura de la ropa de sus vecinos, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de  belleza, ropa y zapatos. 

Julia Maxmiliana con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 800 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar de la línea de cosméticos perfumes, ropa y zapatos de la línea de costura desea comprar materiales como por ejemplo tela, hilos, botones, etc.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia Maxmiliana is 56 years old and lives in the city of Cusco. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Patron de San Sebastian” [Saint Sebastian Patron] of Arariwa Microfinance Unit for a long time. Julia Maxmiliana is married and has four children. She is a seamstress and has a small workshop in her house. She provides sewing services to her neighbors and also sells beauty products, clothes and shoes.

Julia Maxmiliana will invest the loan of $ 800.00 USD in the purchase of cosmetics, perfumes, clothes, shoes and sewing materials like fabric, thread and buttons.

She is very grateful for the opportunity provided and commits herself to make the payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials: fabric, thread, buttons, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  2 children, all of whom are in school.  

Mary  has a business of  crafts.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Mary  sells her products door-to-door, by means of wholesale.  

Mary  has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more mats and baskets. The main business challenges for  Mary  include  transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to start weaving mats and baskets herself.    

Mary  lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy mats and baskets for resale

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “Hormiguitas” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  ocho integrantes,  este es su cuarto ciclo.  Las señoras manifestaron su bienestar por que tuvieron un ciclo sin mayores contratiempos.   Esperan que el ciclo que viene sea de igual manera, un ciclo sin problemas.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuenta con: costura, costura de chamarras, venta de pescados, tejido a mano de guantes, venta de miel de abeja, tejido de mantas y venta de fresco y chantilli.

La presidenta, la señora  Wilma es una mujer joven, tiene un hijo.  Ella comenta que desde hace cinco años teje manoplas y las vende a una empresa que las comercializa por mayor.  Un familiar le enseñó a tejer.   Sin embargo, en esta oportunidad está solicitando crédito está destinado para iniciar un  negocio de venta de verduras en un puesto de su Zona, los días viernes y sábado. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta participar en su grupo, compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Hormiguitas” (Hard-Working Women - literally 'Little Ants') community bank is part of the Panamericana regional office.  It has eight members who are in their fourth loan cycle.  The ladies have demonstrated the well-being of their group by experiencing a loan cycle with no major setbacks.  They hope that their upcoming loan cycle will similarly present no problems.  The ladies' businesses include: sewing, sewing jackets, selling fish, hand-knitting gloves, selling honey, knitting blankets and selling fruit drinks and whipped cream.

The group's president, Wilma, is a young woman who has one child.  She says that she has been knitting mittens for five years.  She sells them to a company who then sells them wholesale.  A family member taught her how to knit.  However, the loan which she is requesting on this occasion will be used to set up a business selling vegetables from a stall in her district on Fridays and Saturdays.

When we asked Wilma what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes to take part in the group and share with her fellow group members.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with four children. Two of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food stall selling business for over ten years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamgeni faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season the number of customers that turn up is low. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu because of no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase stock of food staff and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Grupo Megan Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Grupo Megan, el nombre se escogió porque cuando el grupo se estaba formando nació la hija de la señora que formo el grupo y así se llama la niña, el grupo esta en el Estado de Hidalgo y es de 12 integrantes.Olga Lidia es presidenta del grupo,tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, cuenta con estudios de secundaria y tiene  2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de calzado y solicita el préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y elevar sus ventas. Sus clientes nos  comentan que es una mujer trabajadora, amable,de excelente carácter, ella sueña con poder  rentar un local  comercial para poder vivir tranquilamente sin verse en la necesidad de trasladarse a trabajar y  descuidar a sus hijos, dado que es madre soltera y único sosten económico de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Grupo Megan' (Megan's Group).  They chose this name because when this group was being set up, the lady who started it gave birth to her daughter whom she named Megan.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo and has 12 members.

Olga Lidia is the president of this group.  She is 36 years old and a single mother.  She has a high school level of education and two children.  Her business is selling footwear and she is requesting this loan so that she can stock her business and increase her sales.  Her customers tell us that she is a hard-working, kind woman of excellent character.

Olga Lidia dreams of renting business premises so that she can live peacefully without having to move around to do her work and neglect her children.  She is a single mother and the only source of financial support for her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en: Naranhuu is 59 years old and lives with her two children in an apartment in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her  daughter is disabled and her son is in primary school. She makes a living by owning and operating a grocery store where she sells a variety of food items to her customers. She opened the store in 2006 and has since built it into a successful and stable business. Today her daily average income exceeds 250,000 MNT and her monthly profit is between 400,000 and 500,000 MNT. She has one employee who is a salesperson and earns 300,000 MNT a month. Naranhuu is very hard working and determined to achieve her goals. She says, "I plan to repair my car in the near future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to improve her store and to buy a new refrigerator with glass door for groceries.

loans.use: To improve her store and repair her car

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the village of Guiwanon, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Guava.

Marilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, instant noddles, canned goods, coffee, milk, and toothpaste in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy Amada

texts.es:
La Señorita Nancy P. es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza cultural y natural, su variedad en la gastronomía, su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

La Señorita Nancy tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al comercio, ayuda en la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que viven es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia es profesional, es profesora de un colegio donde dicta clases de Ciencias Naturales hace 4 años. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y bisutería. Su meta es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Nancy P. is a member of the Yanbal communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, known for its beauty, culture, nature and variety of foods.  Its people are very friendly and hospitable.

Nancy is 28, single, and she lives with her parents who are in business.  She helps with the household expenses in the house that belongs to them.

Our member is a professional.   She has been a teacher in a school where she has taught natural sciences for the past 4 years.  In her free time she sells Yanbal products.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and the money from her loan will be used to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her goal is to travel the world.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg, 35, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver for a company, and one of her two sons attends a local school. 

She began selling clothes in 2008. She imports consumer goods from China, and her sister who lives in Russia helps her sell the clothing there. She is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I want my two children to get a good education and buy an apartment so they can have a comfortable life." 

Naranchimeg is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to use for purchasing more clothes from China to sell in Russia.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China

loans.name: Maris

texts.en:
Maris is a 28-year-old married woman living in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has two young children aged four and three.

Maris is a farmer and so is her husband. They both till their land to plant and harvest rice crops. Part of the harvest is used for family consumption and the rest is sold to the market. Maris currently needs farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She requested to borrow 6000 PHP which she will use to supply her farm.

Maris works hard to help her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gangerel

texts.en:
Gangerel is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own apartment and their children go to a local school. In 1993, Gangerel began repairing cars in her backyard. Her business has now become more stable and she has gained significant experience. Gangerel is a hardworking and honest person who says, “I want to take care of my children’s study and help them finish their college.”  

Gangerel is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase equipment for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and have her own workshop.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair equipment

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion G., a CCT* community partner, is a simple woman with a simple dream in life. At 57, she had earned a degree in college and is running a household with her husband Romeo, a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver. They have three children: one who is still studying in high school, and two who are already working. They live as a family in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Her current focus is on making her sari-sari (variety) store survive competition and level up into something like a grocery. Weekly she observes which products sell the most and which brands are the most in demand. Aside from her sari-sari store, she also has a mineral water business. Monthly, Salvacion earns approximately Php 9,500.

To help her advance her business, Salvacion is applying for a loan amounting to Php 19,000. She will buy more quick-selling items such as toiletries, canned goods, and instant noodles to add to her inventory of products. She sees this as a sure way to increase her profits over time.

Salvacion simply dreams of getting away from poverty and giving her family a prosperous life. She desires that as her business grows with the application of every entrepreneurial skill and the spiritual support CCT gives her, every member of her family will experience not only happiness, but joy that transcends all circumstances.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rosebella works hard to support her family.  She has a firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sari-sari store.  Rosebella is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Rosebella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her home and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice W. K. is 25 years old, single and has two children, 9 and 12 years old. Her business is located at the Thika main stage, where there are a lot of people passing by. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Alice runs a general store where she sells items such as flour, rice, sugar, beverages, cooking oil, detergents, etc. to the local people. She has been in this business for the last three months and says that it is profitable. The major challenge Alice faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more items to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cooking oil, flour, rice, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en:
Hayel is a 50-year-old married man who is the father of four children.  He has been selling water and working in agriculture since 2000.  His businesses are doing fine, but they are not enough to pay for his children's education expenses.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's education expenses.

Hayel is a hardworker and is well-known in his region.  Most of his clients are from his region. His work in agriculture is seasonal.  In the summer seaon, he sells water when the request for water rises.  

Hayel plans on expanding his business in the future through the purchase of a wheat mill.  He hopes to improve his business so he can keep on educating his children to higher levels.

loans.use: pay for his children's education expenses

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and married. She is blessed with two school-aged children. As one way of gaining income, she put up a small general store where she sells different grocery items and other basic daily needs. Erlinda has operated this business for almost four years. 

Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve this kind of business in order to help her husband with getting income for the sake of the future of their children. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist her in the business in order to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items, soft drinks and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fedah

texts.en:
Fedah is 60 years old and married.  She supports her spouse Joseph and her five children. She has been operating a maize farm for the last 28 years, and generates a monthly income of KES 50,000.

With her fifth loan from KADET of KES 20,000, Fedah intends to purchase fertilizer, which will help boost the harvest and support her livestock.  She hopes that in the future she will be able to generate enough income to support her family and provide for their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es originario del municipio de El Sauce de la comarca San Ramón, es un señor luchador que tiene una gran familia trabajadora con tres hijos los cuales los está preparando profesionalmente para que se defiendan en la vida, actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en adquirir medicina general, ropa, plásticos los cuales los ofrece por mayor a los dueños de pulperías y farmacias de la localidad, esta actividad la ejerce en conjunto con su esposa e hijos.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y construir su propia vivienda, adquirir sus bienes del hogar y vehículo. Una de las necesidades que tiene este señor es contar con más capital para adquirir por cantidad mayor los productos que ofrece a sus clientes ya que cada día por lo favorable que vende ha ganado más clientela, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de tales clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro comes from the town of El Sauce, in San Ramón region.  He is a hard-working man who has a great, hard-working family.  He has three children who are studying to become professionals so that they can get by in life.  Pedro currently owns his own business which involves acquiring medicines, clothes and plastic products which he sells wholesale to grocery store owners and pharmacy owners in his town.  He carries out his business together with his wife and children.

Since he started his business, Pedro has been noted for the fact that he meets his customers' demands and, thanks to his efforts, he has been able to get his family ahead in life, build his own home, acquire goods for his household and buy a vehicle.  One of the needs that he has is to have more capital so that he can acquire the products that he sells to his customers in larger quantities since he has gained more customers owing to how well he makes his sales.  For this reason, he decided to request his third loan from Ceprodel, with the aim of satisfying the demand he has from his customers.

loans.use: to buy medicine, underwear and plastic products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 42, is married to Joseph and blessed with five children aged between 2 and 20 years. She does farming, mainly crop farming, which she has been doing for 20 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD and she has repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan funds to buy maize seeds, French bean seeds and potatoes for planting. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds, French bean seeds and potatoes to plant

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
La señora Santiaga es casada, tiene 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos y ninguno de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la producción de zapatos para damas, inicio este negocio como operaria y ahora quiere hacer su propio negocio, hasta el momento lleva 10 años realizando este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para comprar pieles, charolina, pegamento, tiner, suelas, etc. en el futuro espera contar con maquinaria para aumentar su producción y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Santiaga is married. She is 59 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has six children and none of them are studying. She is dedicated to making shoes for women. She began this business as a machine operator and now she wants to start her own business. Currently, she has ten years experience with this work. She counts on the support of her husband who is dedicated to the same job.

She decided to request a loan to invest in materials to buy leather, patent leathers, glue, paint thinner, soles etc. In the future, she hopes to have machinery to expand her production and obtain more income.

loans.use: to purchase material for shoes.

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Buikwe Group

texts.en: 40-year-old Robinah has had a farming business in Lugazi for the last 20 years. She is a happily married mother of four. She also has a second business: a retail shop. Both of these businesses are indispensable to her family. Her retail business has been very busy lately. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, cooking oil, etc. Her farming business generates 200,000 UGX in income each month. She intends to use her loan to purchase more commodities for her retail shop, such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc. Her retail shop often runs short on inventory.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc. to resell

loans.name: Bris

texts.es: Bris tiene 25 años, vive en casa de su madre , en su tierra natal con sus padres y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía desde hace 2 años, actividad que lo realiza en su misma casa, y que son comercializadas al por mayor a los comerciantes artesanales; pero en algunas ocasiones los lleva a la ciudad para venderlos de manera ambulante. Su taller se ubica en su casa, en un espacio que acondiciono para estos fines. Uno de sus mayores obstáculos en su trabajo es cuando escasean los materiales que necesita, como el calabacin, por ello requiere abastecerse de este material para poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que Bris tiene con MFP, considera que es una gran oportunidad  para mejorar e implementar su negocio de la cual tiene muchas expectativas de mejorar. En esta ocasión, comprará al por mayor materiales para la elaboración de sus obejtos artesanales.
texts.en:
Bris is 25 years old.  She lives in her mother's house in her native land, with her parents and her two children.  She has been working selling handicrafts for the last two years, which she does from home and then markets them at wholesale to the handicraft retailers.  However, on occasion she takes them to the city to sell as a street vendor.

Her workshop is located in her home; it is a space that is suitable for this end.

One of the major obstacles in her work is when she lacks the materials she needs, such as gourds, as she needs to have this material in stock to be able to meet her customers' needs.

This is Bris' first loan with MFP; she considers it to be a great opportunity to improve and grow her business, for which she has great expectations of improvement.

On this occasion, she will buy materials at wholesale for making her handicraft objects.

loans.use: to buy gourds at wholesale.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Махфират уже три  года как занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Makhfirat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 29 years old, married and has four children.  Makhfirat has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow, in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Zakhida

texts.en:
Zakhida is a hardworking widow with three children. Her hard living conditions and poorness pushed her start her business. For the past 10 years, Zakhida has been running a cattle breeding business. She buys small calves, raises them, and then resells them at a profit. Zakhida is also engaged in gardening. 

Zakhida is requesting an 800 AZN loan to buy cattle and expand her business. She hopes to use her profit to make plans for her older son’s wedding.

loans.use: to purchase calves and fodder

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste has been a motorcyclist for more than four years. He is 33 years old and is married to a teacher. They have one child who is two years old and has not yet been able to attend school.  He will buy another motorbike for transportation with the loan. The profits will be used to buy a plot of land where he plans to build his own house. He dreams of buying a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a married mother of five, completed junior high school. Married to a driver, she sells fruits such as oranges, pineapples, etc. in Ayensudu, an activity that enables her to help support her husband in educating, feeding and clothing their children. Rebecca will use the loan to obtain more fruits to sell, and plans to reinvest the resulting new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to obtain more fruits to sell.

loans.name: José Martir

texts.es:
El señor José Mártir, tiene  51 años de edad, es casado, tiene más de veinte años de residir en el Barrio  El Way del municipio de Intibucá.
Tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando en secundaria y dos ya cursaron sus estudios secundarios.
Se dedica al comercio desde hace veinte años, vendiendo ropa nueva (pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos de niña, cobijas, suéteres, ropa interior y calzado), su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos y le ayuda en la administración de su negocio. 
Él ha solicitado un financiamiento por la cantidad de L. 12,000.00  el que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería y aprovechar las ventas de la temporada de graduaciones en los colegios. 
Su negocio es muy estable y está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Intibucá, tiene buena experiencia en esta área comercial. El espera brindarles la educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
José Mártir, 51, is married and has been living in the El Wey neighborhood in Intibucá Township for over twenty years.  He has four children; two of them are in secondary school and two have completed secondary education.

He has been a merchant for twenty years selling new clothes (pants, shirts, blouses, girls’ dresses, blankets, sweaters, underwear and footwear).  His wife does housework and helps him run his business.

He has asked for a L12,000 loan to buy more merchandise to take advantage of sales during school graduation season.  His business is very stable and is located in the Intibucá municipal market.  He hopes to provide his children with an education so that they will become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Diana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por el sector del Descanso en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una mezcla entre lo colonia y la moderno, sus amplios paisajes naturales, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente quienes son cálidos y amables hacen de esta ciudad hermosa y muy hospitalaria.

La Señora. Diana tiene 45 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos de 23, 21, 18, 16, 15 y 13 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes y tres de sus hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto su trabajo.
 
Doña Diana es comerciante y se dedica a la venta ambulante de limpiones de cocina, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 21 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de limpiones de cocina.

Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Estrellitas communal bank.  She lives in the Descanso area in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a mix of colonial and modern.  Its vast natural landscapes, the gastronomical variety that captivates the palate of both natives and outsiders, and the warm and friendly people make this a beautiful and very welcoming city.

Diana is 45 years old and the single mother of six children, ages 23, 21, 18, 16, 15, and 13.  Her three oldest children are married and live on their own, and three of her children study in a high school in the city.  The house in which she lives is her own property, being the fruit of her labor.
 
Diana is a merchant who works as a street vendor selling kitchen wipes, a job she has been doing for 21 years.  She works from Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, and she's going to use her new loan to buy kitchen wipes.

Her goal is to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wipes.

loans.name: Imani Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani SHG Group in Western Kenya! Stephen is the facilitator of the Imani SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Stephen is a father of four children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had a good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Stephen will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Imani SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize. Stephen is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  She takes care of her additional family members (sisters) as well.  

Florence has a business of a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days out of every week.  Florence sells her products from home, by means of retail.  

Florence has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenge for Florence is the increasing price of cosmetics and theft.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon.  Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está casada con el señor Adelio, tienen 3 hijos, una de ellas ya terminó sus estudios secundarios y dos de ellos están en la escuela aún. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de herrería hace ya como 10 años.
Teresa vivió hasta los 16 años en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, luego vino a Asunción en busca de trabajo y empezó en una casa de familia como empleada doméstica durante 9 años, más adelante se casó y tuvo a su primer bebé, y como no podía dejarla a nadie su cuidado, habló con una amiga y decidieron estudiar juntas la carrera de Corte y Confección, y de esa manera una vez recibidas iban a poder trabajar desde su casa.
Actualmente trabaja para una funeraria muy conocida en el país, en donde su trabajo consiste en confeccionar las prendas para revestir los ataúdes y las mortajas(vestimentas para los difuntos).
El crédito que retira es para ella un gran apoyo porque de esa manera puede adquirir para sus máquinas de coser, lo cual le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of Villa Elisa and is married to Adelio. They have three children, one of whom completed high school while the other two are still in school. Her husband has worked in a blacksmith shop for the past ten years.

Teresa lived in the city of Coronel Oviedo until she was 16 years old. She then went to Asunción in search of a job and she worked at a family’s house as a maid for nine years. Later, she married and had her first child. Since she had to care for her baby, she spoke with a friend and they decided to study tailoring together so that they could work from home once they completed their studies.

Teresa currently works at a well-known funeral home in Paraguay where she makes garments to cover the coffins as well as the deceased. The loan is of great help to her because she can use it to purchase sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zoxra

texts.ru: Zoxra 58 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Kurdmakhmudlu vmeste so sovim mujem i detmi. Zoxra uje 7 let kak imeyet svoy magazin gde prodayet pisheviye produkti. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazi dlya razmesheniya bolshe nujnix tovarov.
texts.en: Zoxra is 58 years old, married and has three children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives with her husband and children in the Kurdmakhmudlu village in the Fuzuli region.  Zoxra has had her store, where she sells food products, for seven years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN to expand her store in order to fit more needed products.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Nanjii

texts.en:
Mr. Nanjii, 55, is a carpenter and makes Mongolian traditional furniture for his neighbors and his permanent customers. He has been running his business for 20 years and lives with his wife. All of his children have moved out.

Now he needs money to increase his business working capital. It is important for the persistent running of his business. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase raw materials for carpentry.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for carpentry

loans.name: Fathia

texts.en: Fathia is a 32 year old single married from Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to maintenance of the rooms. In the future she would like to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Everlyne, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Kitale area of Kenya. Everlyne, 30, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through those years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Everlyne is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. She is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Everlyne could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Everlyne, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Everlyne believes that this loan will be of great help to her. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Everlyne to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.
She hopes to be able to make progress as a smallholder farmer and to have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Ampara and her husband have a workshop where they make and sell gates, fences and other metalwork.
