Ampara is in charge of commercializing the products that her husband makes and running the administrative part of the business. Her and her husband have had this business for 4 years now and are looking to make it grow. They need the loan because they have had a boost in orders, but they do not have the raw materials to complete them.

Amara and her husband have 6 children together. Life has not been easy for them because of the tough financial situation. They see hope in their business as it has steadily grown and built a strong customer base. They hope that with the extra profits they make they will be able to provide their children with better food and education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: They need the loan because they have had a boost in orders, but they do not have the raw materials to complete them.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married and has three young children. He began his business 25 years ago by working as a street vendor in the city of Escobedo and he wants his children to continue studying so that they can have a better future. He requires a loan of $650 to buy vegetables and fruits so that his business can continue to grow. In this way he can offer a better quality of life to his family.

The power to help this family is in your hands. Manuel needs your support. Make the decision to contribute, they will be very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel es casado y tiene tres hijos menores. Él inició su negocio hace 25 años instalándose en los mercados ambulantes en el municipio de Escobedo y quiere que sus hijos continúen estudiando y puedan llegar a tener un mejor futuro. Ahora requiere de un préstamo de $650 dólares para la compra de verdura y fruta para que su negocio continúe creciendo, y de esta manera ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

En tus manos está el poder ayudar a esta familia, Manuel necesita de tu apoyo, decídete a contribuir, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 35 years old. She is a single women living with her two children. She left her husband two years ago. Since 2005, she has been responsible for her children.

She applied to get $1200 from Al-Aman to develop her hair salon. She wants to bring modern equipment to her salon. As she said, "I want to offer the best services to my customers." She wants to bring more customers to her salon through marketing and increase her income.

loans.use: To develop her hair salon

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina has a little kiosk at the Central Market in Melitopol. She sells women’s clothing and shoes and would like to be able to purchase some extra seasonal inventory. Her kiosk is located in a very central location for shoppers and is attractive and well organized. She has run her little store for 14 years. Through the help and support of Nadiya Ukraine she was recently able to find a better kiosk which has helped her business expand.

In order to purchase the necessary inventory for her business, Valentina has requested a $700 loan. She currently has $1500 invested in inventory. Valentina is a hard-working and very trustworthy client with Nadiya Ukraine and has an excellent credit history.

Valentina and her husband, Anatoily, have two sons. Her goal is to continue developing her clothing business and earn extra income so that she will be able to take her two sons and her husband on a special vacation.

loans.use: Purchase additional seasonal inventory for her women's apparel shop

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a mother of 10 from the village of Asau Savaii, but married to a business man from Mulivai Leauvaa. She joined our program in 2006 when she needed help for her business. She is now applying for another loan to help buy more inventory for her shop and to pay her children's school fees. Asia is the best saver in our centre and a very good supporter for doing the centre's guarantees.

loans.use: To restock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: I Nyoman Kartikayasa

texts.id:
Breeding Kereman cows (cows that are raised in the barn) is very popular at Jembrana district, west of Bali. Besides saving man-power, it's also more efficient. We can raise Kereman cows faster so that we can sell it in 4 to 6 months. Therefore, I Nyoman Kartikayasa used the loan from Dinari to buy 1 cow (2-3 years old) which cost Rp. 3,500,000 (about $386). The rest of the loan was used to cover the cow's food expense. I Nyoman Kartikayasa feeds the cow twice a day in the morning and in the evening. The basic food is processed food made from the mixture of rice chaff, corn and ground soyabean dregs. The estimated cow's food per kg is Rp. 1,500 (about $0.16) (Rp.1,500 x 120 days = Rp. 180,000 -- about $20). This processed cow's food is given every morning. In the afternoon, he feeds the cow with natural food such as grass, jackfruit leaves, and cocoa skin which contained good protein for cow. When the harvest time comes, the cow's weight was 415 kg and its price is Rp. 15,000 (about $1.65) per kg. Hence, the net income (after subtracted with the initial capital and cow's food expense) was Rp. 2,545,000 (about $281). I Nyoman Kartikayasa is very pleased with this business. He hopes to get more loans from Dinari so that he can raise more cows. He can use the income to cover his family's daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Di Kabupaten Jembrana, Bali Barat, pemeliharaan sapi Kereman ( sapi yang dikandangkan ) sangat diminati oleh masyarakat . Selain menghemat tenaga, juga lebih efisien. Dengan adanya sapi kereman yang pemeliharaannya cepat, jangka waktu 4 - 6 bulan sudah siap untuk dijual. Oleh sebab itu lewat Dinari, I Nyoman Kartikayasa memperoleh modal pinjaman Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor sapi yang sudah cukup besar ( umur 2 – 3 tahun ) dengan harga Rp. 3.500.000,-. Sisanya dipakai untuk biaya pakan.. Sapi kereman I Nyoman Kartikayasa diberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Makanan pokoknya makanan olahan ( konsentrat ) yang terbuat dari dedak padi yang kasar, jagung, ampas kedelai yang dihaluskan kemudian dicampur menjadi satu. Perkiraan harga pakan per kilogram adalah Rp.1.500,- ( Rp. 1.500.- X 120 hari = Rp. 180.000.- ) Pakan olahan diberikan pada pagi hari dan untuk siang hari diberi makanan alami sebagai makanan tambahan seperti rumput, daun nangka dan kulit coklat ( kakao ) yang proteinnya bagus untuk sapi. Pada saat panen berat sapi I Nyoman Kartikayasa 415 kg dengan harga per kg Rp.15,000,-. Jadi pendapatan bersih setelah dipotong modal sapi dan pakan yang menjadi Rp. 2.545.000,- selama empat bulan. I Nyoman Kartikayasa sangat senang dengan usahanya ini . Harapannya supaya pinjaman dari Dinari bisa meningkat agar bisa pelihara lebih dari 1 ekor. Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipakai untuk keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To purchase cow and cow food

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a mother of 4, 35 years old, and comes from the Shibiri area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and is also a seamstress. She has been in business since 1997.

She has been a member of LAPO for the past three years. She now requests a loan of $700 to buy more clothes to sell and a sewing machine.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell and a sewing machine

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty is 27 years old, divorced, and has four children. She plans to build more pig sties with the extra profits from her current business.

loans.use: To buy more pig sties

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose lives at his parents house on Muños Reyes street in the area of Calacoto in the city of La Paz. He is 21 years old and is a chef by profession. He studied at the Escuela Hotelera where he learned how to make national and international dishes, which has made him highly sought after. He has contracts for events every weekend, the earnings of which support him and pay for his studies. The loan he asks for is to buy a professional kitchen in order to serve his clients with greater ease. He does not have a prior history with our organization, but an analyses of his cash flow indicates that Jose will be able to pay monthly dues for the loan and at the same time cover his personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Muños Reyes de la zona de Calacoto de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 21 años de edad y es Chef de profesión. Estudió en la Escuela Hotelera, lugar donde aprendió a elabora platos Nacionales e Internacionales, por lo cual es muy solicitado y tiene contratos para eventos cada fin de semana, con cuyos ingresos se mantiene y paga sus estudios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una cocina profesional y así tener más facilidad para atender a sus clientes. No tiene antecedente histórico con nuestra Institución, pero el análisis de su flujo de caja indica que Jose podrá pagar las cuotas mensuales del préstamo y al mismo tiempo cubrir sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase a kitchen

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha M. is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells cooked food and cool drinks and has been in business since 1994. She needs a loan of $700.00 so that she can purchase a deep freezer to cool her drinks and store more foodstuffs to cook.

loans.use: To buy deep freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and to make some renovations in her home

loans.name: Cira

texts.es:
Cira works constantly, creating her own source of income through selling merchandise, including personal items such as: hairpins, combs, ponytail holders, etc. She sells the merchandise in the fairs (markets) two days a week - Wednesdays and Sundays in the city of Jauja. Her perseverance in her job has permitted her to support herself for 5 years. In addition, her job has provided her with much satisfication with the money that she has earned. She wants to improve her small stand in the fair and although she still works by walking around and selling her items, the loan will supply her with better merchandise for her small stand and will without a doubt, improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Cira trabaja constantemente creando su propia fuente de ingreso mediante la venta de mercería es decir de artículos personales como ganchos, peines, colets etc. en las ferias de los días miércoles y domingos en la ciudad de Jauja, su constancia en el trabajo que realiza le ha permitido mantenerse durante 5 años y además le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones por la rentabilidad que le genera. Ella quiere mejorar su pequeño puesto en la feria y aunque aún labora de manera ambulante surtirá con mayor mercadería su pequeño espacio de ventas que sin duda mejorarán sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase work capital to offer a greater quantity of products

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. lives in the town of Okoko, in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene to customers from two storage tanks which she owns. She has been in this business since 1998. Patience is 39 years old and married with four children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years, and has applied for a new loan of $1,200 to buy more kerosene to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Dolly Dermis

texts.es:
Ms Dolly is a member of the communal bank Las Divinas, located in the Jr. Progreso 168, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is the mother of 2 children, but her income is not enough to keep up with the expenses of the home, so Dolly with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decided to invest on the beverage industry by selling juice. Currently she has one establishment to sell juice. She gets up at 6 o'clock in the morning and prepares all the juices that she sell from 6 am to the 9 am. With this loan of S/. 1500 which will be paid in 6 months, Ms Dolly bought carbonated water, papayas, orange, bananas, milk, apples, bread, ham, butter, etc. Dolly is very happy with her business because she is doing well, and her effort and dedication have paid off. Her family is her inspiration and she desires to offer them the best in order to improve their lifestyle and offer her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dolly pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Progreso 168, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para mantener los gastos familiares, es así que Dolly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de jugos. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de jugos, para lo cual se levanta a las 6am, a preparar sus jugos que los pone a la venta desde las 6 am hasta las 9 am. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró gaseosas, papayas, naranjas, plátanos, leche, manzanas, panes, jamón, mantequilla, etc. Dolly esta contenta con su negocio porque sale adelante por su esfuerzo y dedicación, con el único impulso que es su familia, ella desea brindarles todo el apoyo a través de su trabajo para darles una mejor condición de vida y de educación.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and carbonated water

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is 50 years old and mother of four children, two who are independent and two of them students who live with her. She lives with her husband Mauricio and they work together to get ahead. Her business sells groceries and essential products. Eugenia is a woman who always works hard to get ahead, and she began this business a long time ago. Thanks to her friendly customer service and above all, good financial management, she now has a moto-car, which gives her children work. She feels good about the work she does as it provides an inventive to dream of greater and greater things. She would like to expand her business and repair the moto-car, and for this reason she is requesting this loan. With your help this mother will be able to get ahead in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eugenia, D. 50 años D. edad es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 D. ellos independientes y 2 estudiantes que se encuentran a su cargo, vive junto a su esposo Mauricio y ambos se propusieron seguir adelante. Su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad, Eugenia es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio desD. mucho tiempo atrás, gracias a su amable atención y sobre todo buena administración, tiene ahora un motocarro, con el cual brinda trabajo a sus hijos. Se siente bien con el trabajo que realiza ya que le incentiva a soñar cada vez más alto. Quiere ampliar su negocio y reparar su motocarro, para realizar esto necesita del préstamo que ahora solicita. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expand her general store and repair her moto-car

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. repairs refrigerators. With the additional funds from Kiva lenders he was able to learn how to install satellite dishes. He is happy with Kiva lenders because he now has an additional business. He lives in Uromi, Edo state, Nigeria. John is single and he is a LAPO client. He hopes for the loan amount of  $1200 to purchase materials for the installation of satellite dishes. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: Repairs of refrigerator and installation of satellite dishes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is married and the mother of six children. Two of her children are currently in school, while the rest have completed high school. 

She has been selling yams, cassava and plantains for the past nine years to support her children in school. She treks to the surrounding villages of Koforidua to purchase goods such as tubers of yam, cassava, and plantains and resell them to her customers in the city market, Accra. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more tubers of yam, cassava, and bunches of plantains from the farmers instead of buying from the market dealers. This she believes will increase her sales and income to support her two children who are in school. 

Comfort is a member of the group called "Nyame Mma" (God children). Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams, cassava, and plantains

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura H. has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may increase her inventory and grow her business.

Ashura is 43 years old, married, and has an 8-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokkhorn Rom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for 19 people who live in Roka Village in Kandal. Mrs. Sokkhorn R. is the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Huonh Hoeurn, is a fisherman. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. Sokkhorn R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband’s business. Mrs. Sokkhorn R. is 24 years old and the mother of two children, ages 2 and 4.
 
Four members of this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term (EoT) loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. These loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeurn E. lives in Siem Bouy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tun Tha, is a fisherman. He now wants to expand his business but he does not enough money to buy a lake for fishing. Thus, Mrs. Savoeurn E. decided to ask for a loan to purchase it for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family.

She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a lake for fishing.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Las casas de hoy en día que realizan las inmobiliarias para ofrecerlas a los trabajadores que cuentan con prestaciones del gobierno a través de sus empleos, son demasiado pequeñas y los ocupantes no satisfacen sus necesidades, este es el caso del Sr. M., a pesar de que tiene solo dos hijos, su vivienda fue realizada con una sola habitación; el objetivo es ampliar la casa, para que sus hijos tengan una recamara propia.
Él trabaja para una empresa que se dedica a reparar los automóviles y su salario no es suficiente para contemplar la mejora. 
Ansía lo antes posible realizar el proyecto; por supuesto, con la ayuda de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The houses that are being offered for sale to workers these days, subsidized by government loans, are too small. They don't meet the needs of their owners. Sr. Martinez is one example. Despite having two children, his house was built with only one bedroom. He wants to expand the house so that his children have their own room. He works for an auto-repair business and his income won't cover the costs of the addition. He hopes to finish the project as soon as possible with, of course, your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build addition to house.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with six children and lives in Ntabesi, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon.  Vivian plans to invest her loan in her already existing provision. She will divide her loan between articles such as rice, savon, sugar, magi, palm oil and transportation costs.  She plans to contribute 50,000 CFA (approximately $100 USD) of her own savings towards her business plans.  
 
This is Vivian’s second loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2007.  From her past experience, her articles are in high demand in her area and she can sell it quite quickly with fast turnover.  Bringing palm oil and other articles from the main market to her community will reduce the transportation costs of her clients as they will be able to purchase these items nearby.  She is confident that this loan will allow her to provide more products and therefore sell more as she will buy in bulk.  
 
With the profits from this loan, Vivian hopes to expand her business.  She also plans to support her children, improve their education, and improve her family’s living standards.  She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is set up so that her payments are small and regular.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase rice, savon, sugar, magi, oil.

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.ru: Бедимогов Бекназар проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми.Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает бухгалтером и кроме того занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин продуктов питания. Занимается бизнесом уже 10 лет. Сейчас планирует увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Beknazar B. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. He is 46 years old and is married with five children. He works as an accountant and has a groceries store. He has been in this business for the ten years. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to increase cash flow. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Zadit

texts.es: Zadit tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos; Jackeline de 27, Cristian de 26, Franchesca de 24 y Steffany de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la preparación de buffets, pastelería y bocaditos para eventos; ya sean matrimonios, fiestas de 15 años, bautizos, etc. Para lo cual trabaja con todos sus hijos, ya que es un negocio familiar, donde participan todos. Ellos trabajan por pedido y mientras más grande es la fiesta mayor es el esfuerzo de Zadit y sus hijos, ya que tienen que cocinar mayor cantidad de platillos, y es muy cansado. A pesar de todo el trajín a Zadit le gusta su trabajo porque mantiene unida a toda su familia. Felizmente los ingresos recompensan su trabajo y toda su familia puede vivir tranquila. Pero los deseos de todos es mejorar y hacer de su pequeño negocio algo mucho más grande y más rentable. Para el futuro, quieren alquilar un local para poner una fuente de soda y tener un negocio más estable. Zadit tiene varios años trabajando con MFP y ha sido muy  puntual en sus pagos, actualmente esta en un grupo con 2 de sus amigas. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la comprar de una cocina industrial, ya que son mucho más potentes para poder preparar mayor cantidad de platillos, mejorando su capacidad de servicio.
texts.en:
Zadit is 48 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and four children: Jackeline, 27 years old; Cristian, 26 years old; Franchesca, 24 years old; and Steffany, who is 14. For five years she has been catering, preparing buffets, cakes, and appetizers for functions such as weddings, quinceaneras, baptisms, etc. All of her children work alongside her in this family business, and everyone participates. They work by request, and the bigger the party, the harder they work, since they need to prepare more dishes, and it can be quite tiring.

Despite all this hustle and bustle, Zadit likes her work because it keeps her family united. Happily, the income from this work allows her family to live worry-free. But all of them still would like to improve and grow their business, making it even bigger and more profitable. For the future, they want to rent a little space in a market to house a soda fountain and have a more stable business.

Zadit has been working for several years with MFP and has been very punctual in her loan payments. Currently she is in a group with two of her friends. She will use the money she is requesting to buy an industrial stove, because they are much more capable of preparing large quantities of food, which will improve her business capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an industrial stove

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are in the junior high and the basic schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Aquase, a fishing community near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Evelyn says that it is important for her to work hard to make some income to support her husband and take care of the family. She is a trader. She sells grocers, such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She buys the goods from wholesale dealers in Cape Coast, the regional capital, and sells them in her community. She owns a shop by the roadside in which she sells. Evelyn also supplies firewood to local food vendors.

She has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Reina Janeth

texts.es: Reina Janeth C. E. reside en Tonacatepeque junto a sus dos hijos ,el mayor de 14 años y la menor de 5 años. Como toda madre soltera trabaja muy duro día con día por el bienestar de sus hijos, es así como Reina trabaja arduamente en su salón de belleza el cual cuenta con dos años de poseerlo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el capital necesario para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, esto con el fin de hacer más confortable la estancia de sus clientes de manera que pueda percibir más ganancias las cuales contribuyan a la economía familiar y le facilite el poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Reina Janeth C. E. lives in Tonacatepeque with her two sons, the oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Like all single mothers, she works hard every day for the welfare of her children. This is why Reina works hard at her beauty shop which she has owned for two years. She is asking for a loan to obtain the necessary capital to improve the infrastructure of her business so that she can make her clients more comfortable in her shop. This will allow her to obtain greater profits which will contribute to the family economy and will allow her to provide her children with all the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her beauty shop.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Queen M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. Queen has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 2001. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Queen is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Queen thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita J. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Anita runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp to the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarfa

texts.en:
Sarfa S. is married and has six dependents. He makes car seats and room furniture for sale. He also sells spare parts for cars at Abotoase near Hohoe. He has done this business for a while now. His wife is a trader. Sarfa uses his income to pay school fees for his children.

Sarfa will use the loan to buy more materials for making car seats and also to buy other spare parts for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to to reinvest to increase his capital and profits.

In the photo, he is the one in the cream and black shirt. Those in the blue overalls are his workers.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making car seats and to buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita G. is the business owner of a tailoring shop that makes traditional Nepali clothing such as the sari and the kurta-salwar. She has two employees in her shop who help her to meet her regular orders.

Sita’s husband is currently employed as a taxi driver and the couple have one son who is ten years old and currently in school.

Sita is applying for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase new fabrics for her tailoring business. She traveled to the BPW Patan office (Kiva's field partner in Nepal) to apply for this loan and hopes to receive the loan amount at the group loan meeting in her district of Kulashwor at the end of the month.

Sita explained that because it is monsoon season right now, her business is a bit quieter than usual. The loan will help to tide her over and allow her to make many new items of clothing until the business picks up again after the monsoon season.

Sita is proud that she can make a contribution equal to her husband’s to her family’s expenses and looks forward to gradually expanding her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Seoub

texts.en:
Seoub S., 37, is married and lives in Battambong province with her five children. Daily, she is busy with her work of raising pigs, making around US$4. Her husband is a construction foreman who commutes from place to place for his business, typically making US$7 each day.

S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase pigs to raise. Raising pigs is a good way for her to generate some extra income for her family, and she will be able to raise her standard of living. It is a difficult time economically for most Cambodians because inflation has soared. However, S. sees these pigs as a good opportunity for her to help her family and to make it through these difficult times.

loans.use: Buying more pigs to raise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es: Mercy tiene 19 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y siente que ya es hora de ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Aunque todavía es muy joven, ha decido apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, es por eso que obtuvo la licencia para vender en un puesto de la escuela primaria “Cerro Colorado” de su ciudad. Ella es una buena vendedora y no permite que los niños traviesos se lleven algo sin pagar. Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es acabar con todo su stock para renovarlo rápidamente, lleva un año en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a todos los niños en la hora del recreo, ya que tiene que estar muy atenta a toda su mercadería.  Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes que le genere mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Mercy con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar un poco todos los días para lograrlo. Ella es muy alegre en su banco comunal y por ello, muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para surtir mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Mercy, 19, is a very happy young woman. She lives in her parents’ house. She feels that it is now time to help with the household expenses. Even though she is still very young, she has decided to help her parents with the family expenses. That is why she got a license to sell in a place at the primary school, Cerro Colorado, in her city. She is a good sales person. She does not let mischievous children take something without paying. On the other hand, what she likes best about her business is to sell all of her stock and rapidly replenish it. She has been doing this for one year. The most difficult thing is having to watch all of the children at recess time. She has to be very attentive about all of her merchandise. In the future, she hopes to have a grocery store that generates better income. This is Mercy’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time. She is prepared to save a little every day to be able to do that. She is very happy in her Community Bank, and she is very dear to her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy sweets to better stock her location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en: B. Samuel is a 55 year old leader of his group in Mubende. He is married with 8 children of which 2 are still in school and the rest managing their own business while he also takes care of 6 dependants. Samuel has a retail shop business in Mubende that has been running for 9 years and he is able to make weekly net profits of 20,000/=. Samuel is a good client that also knows how to handle his customers well. In future, he would like to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop to be managed together with some of his children as well as be able to build a very nice house for his family. Samuel is seeking for a loan to be able to invest more into his shop by buying more products for resale like cooking oil, muffins, bread, toilet rolls and so on since this will enable him pay for his children’s school fees and more business expansion.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida is a member of the Embakassy borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 27 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1  child . Her child is 6 years old.

Reida has owned a clothing business selling kanga and vitenge for 7 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Reida`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 In order to buy more kanga and vitenge for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Reida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more kanga and vitenge  for  sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda tiene 9 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. cristalería.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar plásticos D. todo tamaño y calidad al por mayor para venderlo en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Cuturapi”, which is located in the central village of Cuturapi in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 56 years old, widowed, and has 9 children. Sabina lives in Cuturapi and has a 2nd graD. education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 9 years. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300 soles, enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling glassware.

Sabina is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 soles so that she can buy plastics of all sizes in wholesale quantities. She plans to resell them at the regional fairs.

Her greatest wish is to continue working. Sabina enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastics for resale

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El socio Leopoldo, pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; nuestra socia es natural del distrito de Anta en lka provincia del  Cusco.

Nuestro socio  tiene 32 años de edad, el es casada y tiene 2 hijos, nuestro socio radica en la ciudad del Cusco y alterna sus actividades con la mecánica, el socio es de profesión mecánico y realiza trabajos en su área y desea el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y de esta manera producir más.

Nuestro socio valora y agradece el préstamo que le brindan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leopoldo, a partner of the “KANTU SAN JERONIMO” communal bank, comes from the Anta district in the Ika province of Cusco. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. He's based in the city of Cusco and mixes his activities with mechanics as he's a mechanic by profession and carries out work in his area. Leopoldo would like the loan to be able to invest in his business and thereby produce more. He appreciates and is grateful for the loan which will offer him such means and commits to repay his instalments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in mechanics

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is from Anta, and is part of a communal bank there consisting of 19 members.  The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is 50 years old and married with four children and two grandchildren.

Hipolita has a grocery stall at the Sunday market in the main plaza.  She also raises 80 chickens.  Each one costs 40 Peruvian soles (about $14 US) but the price can rise and fall with the market so her business changes.  With this loan, she will feed her chickens and stock her grocery stall.

Hipolita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To feed her chickens and stock her grocery stall

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a widow with eight children. She is 58 years old. She takes care of her children alone. She sells ogogoro (local gin) at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She sells long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed herself and her children. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 

She hopes to sell her local gin at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more local gin to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.en:
Twenty years ago, Margine learned the art of selling clothes from her mother, whom she helped with her clothing sale business. With this loan, Margine will buy more clothing to resell. Margine is now 36 and has two children of her own, both of whom are in school. Margine’s goal is for her sons to obtain careers of their own, so that they are able to have more than she is able to provide.

Margine has an excellent credit history with Fundación León 2000. She says that her loans have helped her by maintaining her small business which provides a good income for her and her family. Margine worries about the unemployment that plagues Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen C. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. Trabaja como asistente en una pequeña empresa, además su cónyuge la apoya realizando la actividad de taxista en su propio vehículo el cual adquirieron hace varios años con sus ahorros. Su casa se vió afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 por lo cual a la fecha han ido construyendo de manera progresiva, actualmente le falta techar el área construída por lo cual necesitan apoyo para culminar la construcción de dicho ambiente de su casa. Son personas muy trabajadoras que invierten en mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Su sueño es poder culminar la construccion de su casa totalmente. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen C. is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. She works as an assistant in a small business and her husband helps out driving his very own taxi cab, which they bought many years ago with some savings. Carmen's house was affected by the 2007 earthquake and they have been re-building it little by little ever since. Right now, they have to add a roof to the already built area, and to finish this construction, they need help. Carmen and her husband are hardworking people who try to invest in the betterment of their and their kids' lives. Their dream is to completely finish building their home. They are grateful for the support we can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making their home better

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells clothing in a local market called “Yubileinyi.” Nadezhda offers assorted clothing items of different sizes and styles. She has her own loyal clientele. Nadezhda has been in this business for 5 years. Presently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas of working capital. 

Nadezhda loves working in this sphere of commerce because it brings her a stable income and helps her to meet people’s needs. She would like to continue expanding her venture. This time, Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital, which she believes will help her be successful in maintaining continued growth in this business.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and paste at home and is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Poni is 40 years old and is widowed. She has five children; her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Selva

texts.en: Selva P. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol beverages and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell. Selva is 48 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and to open a bar. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Vicenta Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Vicenta Chera tiene 55 años y es dueña de un comercio en la zona del Barrio Trinidad Mariano Roque Alonso , la misma es oriunda de Asunción.
Anteriormente ella trabajaba como empleada domestica y poco a poco fue ahorrando el capital y empezó a vender cervezas, y en salón que tiene en su casa utilizando su heladera.
Luego su negocio fue creciendo y compra mas productos para vender no solo bebidas ya contaba con mercaderías de uso doméstico.
Y con el tiempo mandó hacer un pequeño salón frente a su casa  donde ofrece sus productos.
texts.en:
Vicenta Chera, 55, owns a store in Trinidad Mariano Roque Alonso neighborhood; she is originally from Asunción. She used to work as a domestic employee. Gradually, she had enough savings to start selling beer from a room in her house where she had a refrigerator. The business grew and she began to stock items besides beverages; she now had home use products. In time, she had a small room built in front of her house that she uses as a store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like: sodas, wine, beer, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Catalina De

texts.es: Catalina tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan con quien tiene 3 hijos. Su vivienda es propia y viven allí desde hace unos 8 años. También viven con ellos su cuñada y a veces su suegra que vienen por temporadas a visitarlos. Catalina tiene su negocio de Restaurant donde sirve unos riquísimos platos típicos de Cochabamba los cuales son muy apetecidos por los habitantes de la zona que también son de esa región del país. El negocio lo tienen desde que se fueron a vivir en la zona con lo que han ampliado y mejorado su vivienda. Por su zona no tienen competencia ya que están ubicados por el kilometro 14 de una avenida muy transitada y a pesar de ello tienen mucha clientela fija. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de sillas, mesas y más fardos de cerveza ya que su negocio ha crecido y necesita estos implementos para atender mejor a su clientela. Catalina es una excelente cliente, responsable y con mucha antigüedad con Agrocapital. También trabaja con en otras entidades financieras donde también demuestra su responsabilidad en sus pagos. Se hace notar que en la foto aparecen 2 de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Catalina is 44 years old. She is married to Juan and they have 3 children. They have their own home and have lived there for eight years. Her sister-in-law lives with them also, and sometimes her mother-in-law when she comes to visit. Catalina has a restaurant where she serves delicious dishes typical of Cohabamba. The dishes are enjoyed by the people within the zone. They’ve had this business since they went to live in the zone and it has allowed them to expand and improve their home. They have no competition, as they are located on the 14th kilometer of a well travelled main street and they also have steady customers. They need this loan in order to buy chairs, tables, and more cases of beer. Their business has grown and they need these items to better serve their customers. Catalina is an excellent client. She has been responsible and a client of Agrocapital for some time. She has also worked with other financial institutions and has also demonstrated responsibility with her payments. Her two daughters appear in the photograph with her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tables and chairs

loans.name: Nalani

texts.en:
Nalani is 50 years old and is a married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara, with her husband and four children -- three sons and one daughter. This family owns two businesses: carpentry and spice making. One son is helping in the businesses while the others are studying.

Nalani has a business selling spices to customers in her town. She is seeking this loan in order to purchase additional spices because during the New Year's festival season in April, there is a much higher demand for spices. She has been working in this business for six years.

Nalani has asked for a 15,000 LKR loan to buy spices for the festival season rush of business. She hopes to use some of the additional income for increased spending in the family that comes with the season. In the future she hopes to provide more nutritious dietary options for her family.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more spices to process and sell

loans.name: Tayo

texts.en:
Tayo is into the making of snacks like egg rolls, buns, fish rolls, donuts and puff-puffs. She supplies her customers after she has finished making them. Her snacks are nice and her customers patronize her a lot. She is asking for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more flour, yeast, show glass and one popcorn machine, in order to satisfy her customers. 

34-year-old Tayo is married with one kid. Her husband is a transporter and they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their financial support.  
.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, yeast, show glass and a popcorn machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice W. M. is a hard-working 37-year old lady. To earn a living, she sells clothes in her hometown. She practiced farming before she ventured into this business in 1997.  She has many customers because of her experience and her good customer care skills.

Alice is a member of a group in Faulu Kenya called the "Kiambaa Shiners." The group meets on a weekly basis in order to save their money. Alice has benefited greatly from this group, which guarantees loans that she can access to improve her business. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale operation so that she can improve her standard of living in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya, which she will use to add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a wife of A. R. and they are both citizens of the Pakistani city of Multan, which is famous for its shrines and garments. They are very hardworking people who run a grocery shop in the community. They support each other by splitting their working hours – Shamim serves customers in the morning and A. R. serves them in the evening.
The couple has been doing this work for over six years. Shamim is applying for a loan to buy groceries, such as lentils, cooking oil and washing powder, to expand their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for their grocery store

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando M. was born in Tete province, Changala district, and he is 40 years old. He studied till 9th grade so far and is currently attempting 10th grade. He lives with his partner (she is in the photo) and has four children with her, aged 14, 12, 8 and 4, all going to school.

They moved from Tete to Maputo because of Fernando’s work in the army. He has been in the army since 1980 and is presently serving as a battalion chief in the Catembe base across the bay from Maputo, the capital of Mozambique.

This is Fernando’s fourth loan with Hluvuku, Kiva's partner in Mozambique. He intends to by blocks and bars to carry out the constructions in his house. He hopes he can upgrade his home and provide his family with a suitable place to live. He is confident he will be able to repay with his regular income as a soldier.

Fernando came to request the loan in person but he was at work when we had the chance to visit his construction site  to take the photo, so his life partner is posing in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy blocks and bars for house construction

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Mrs. Ork N., 45, has a pig-raising skill that she learned from her grandparent and currently uses this knowledge to make a living. She has built a pigpen where she breeds many pigs and she also sells the pigs to a buyer when the pigs come to maturity.

Besides this, Ork N. and her husband take time to cultivate a rice crop for the propose of eating and selling as well. This approaching rainfall season is the best for growing and Ork N. is applying for a loan to plant rice crops.

Ork N. now has four children: one is married and three are single. Ork N. was not available when the photo taken so her daughter is pictured instead.

loans.use: To plant rice crops

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is a 28-year-old motorbike taxi driver, using his motorcycle to transport passengers to various destinations around town. He has been in business for a year and has one employee. The primary business challenges he faces are the risk of accidents and many competitors. In addition to his motorbike taxi business, he has a second job as a butcher.

Nahashon is married and has a son 5 years old and a daughter 1 year old.

Nahashon plans to use the 20,000 Kenya shilling loan to purchase another motorbike. He is hoping to expand his business to achieve a better living standard. In five years, he sees himself purchasing a vehicle for his business.

Nahashon describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a young mother from Bethlehem. She is a teacher and the mother of three children. Maha has a B.A. degree and started working as a teacher one year ago. Her husband is a handyman who doesn't have a stable job. 

Maha's husband owns a small piece of land, so she decided to start a small business selling flowers and fruits. She plans to buy seedings to start growing flowers and, maybe, trees. 

Maha wants to use the returns from this business as a second source of income.  In the future, she hopes to save some money to expand her business and save for her three children's higher education.

Maha's husband, Ahmed, appears in the picture with one of their sons.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela, de 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a sus 3 hermanos mayores. Como es la hija mayor, se siente en la responsabilidad de apoyar a sus padres. Es de esta manera que durante el día trabaja en local que ofrece servicio de Internet, y al término del día se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos. Lo modalidad de venta de este último trabajo es por medio de  catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, quienes le pagan semanalmente, eso le motiva a continuar con este negocio. Esta muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; ya que mediante estos ingresos apoya a sus hermanos menores, y eso le da mucha satisfacción personal. En  adelante planea ampliar su negocio y con esas ganancias quiere forjarse una carrera técnica. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, además está agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible en integrarse al crédito grupal. Con el crédito que solicita, tiene planeado comprar más productos de belleza, de esa manera piensa abastecer con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marisela, 20, is a hard-working young woman who lives with her parents and 3 older brothers. Because she is the oldest daughter, she feels a duty to take care of her parents. During the day, she sells Internet services and during the evening, cosmetics. She sells cosmetics from a catalog to her friends and neighbors and they pay her weekly. The revenue from the business is her motivation for continuing it. She is very happy with the business because the income allows her to support her younger siblings, something of great personal satisfaction for her. In the future, she plans to expand her business and use the earnings from it to forge a career in technology. This is Marisela's first MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She says, too, that she is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to join the lending group. She will use the loan to buy more beauty products so that she can meet the demand for them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products to resell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Being born in a town where farming is one of the most common livelihoods, Florenda and her husband have been farming since they were young. Both their parents were also farmers and that was their main source of income. Florenda inherited a rice field from her parents; however; she didn't have enough capital to maximize the land for rice production or any agricultural business. In 2008, Florenda decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) and get a loan to finance her farming business. 

Eventually, after Florenda's second loan from ASHI, she was able to accumulate some savings and make their farming business grow. Her 4 children who live with her and her husband have been very supportive. This loan is intended to finance her farming business. It is supported and agreed upon by her family, who promised each other that they would all help Florenda repay her weekly installment to ASHI on time.

Florenda's long term goal is to have a rice production business someday so that she can give the opportunity of employment to others, especially to her extended relatives in their barangay (village). Florenda hopes to maintain a long term sustainable farming business.

loans.use: To finance her farming business

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia B. is an individual client from Kampala. Her dream is to build and expand her business selling second hand clothes. She has been operating for the last three years in the old taxi park and in Kalerwe-Kampala. Sophia is a single mother of two school-going children. Her plan is to buy more clothes to resell once she receives this loan. She credits her cousin with helping her get off her feet in this business. Prior to beginning this business, she was selling mostly gomesi, which is a garment particularly in high favor with old women in the rural areas for traditional functions. Her small business, notwithstanding its many challenges, generates close to 150,000 UGX a week. She attributes this to hard work, good customer care and a sense of friendliness. She says this loan will come in handy in helping her expand her business. In her estimation, she will be able to buy more clothes and establish a vantage place for her growing business, which means more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco está casado desde hace 20 años, tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería general y ofrece el servicio de disco móvil,  el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda  de esta manera puede aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a con los gastos del hogar. El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo. Razón por el cual necesita el crédito para la compra de ropas como remeras, camisas, vestidos, pantalones y otros. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
José Francisco has been married for 20 years and has two children under his care. He sells general goods and also offers mobile disc jockey services. His business is located inside his house, thus he is able to increase his income and help with the household expenses. He states that the only way for his business to grow is via these loans because it is very difficult for him to accumulate enough working capital. For this reason, he needs this loan to purchase T-shirts, shirts, dresses, pants, and other merchandise. He is a very responsible person who has the desire for self-improvement. He is a cheerful and enterprising man who will no doubt achieve all the goals that he has set for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Petronila;  La socia tiene 75 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la atención de sus tiendas de abarrotes, ella tiene su negocio en mesa redonda y solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio la socia desea comprar azúcar, arroz, leche para implementar su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Machu Picchu" community bank, located in Huanchac district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Her name is Petronila. She is 75 years old and the single mother of 3 children. Petronila runs grocery stores and she wants a loan to set up a another store. The loan will be used to buy basic household goods like sugar, rice, and milk to set up the business. 

Petronila appreciates and values this loan made possible by Asociación Arariwa, and is committed to repaying her loan within the established period of time.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (basic household goods).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes wants a loan to purchase women, men and children's wear to sell in her clothing shop. She is a 28-year-old lady married with four children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Agnes operates a clothing shop where she sells clothing for men, women and children. She dreams of educating her children and turning her shop into a big boutique.

loans.use: To purchase women's, men's and children's wear to sell in her clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old and single. He graduated from primary school and has a bakery shop. He will use this loan to purchase a kneader machine with basin and flour. He is a professional and has good experience in this job. He has lots of clients due to his good quality in the market. Most of the owners of restaurants buy bread from him. This loan will help him to increase his production and that will raise his income.

loans.use: For purchasing kneader machine & flour

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 27 years old. She is married and has one child who is two years old. Her husband is a businessman who sells a variety of items for home consumption. Delphine sells food. She has spent 6 years in this business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food to sell. She plans to save the profits from her business. She says her business succeeds because of she is quite popular and well-known.  She would like to have a Frisian cow in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum C. is 40 years old and is a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province. To earn a daily income, Prum C. works as a police officer in his community, and has a proper salary every month. He has a life partner in his wife, who is a fish seller in the busy market. The couple has three children, all of whom are single. Because fish selling is the main way for his family to earn money, Prum C.’s wife wants to expand her business to a bigger size than it is at present in order to earn more profits. For this reason, Prum C. is applying for a loan for his wife to purchase more fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Edmund0

texts.en:
Edmund0 J. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito, Soliven. He is 44 years old. Edmund0 is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edmund0 owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Edmund0 has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edmund0 joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmund0 is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edmund0 from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta B. is from the town of Sto. Niño, Agusan Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has a 22-year-old child. Julieta's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julieta hopes for her business to grow so she can continue to provide for her family. Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna T. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Paterna is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Paterna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling snacks and other delicacies like fish crackers in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Paterna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for fish crackers. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Paterna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for fish crackers

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda R. is 52 years old and widowed with five adult children. She is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. To make a living, Esmeralda owns and operates a tailoring business. Her primary source of income comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Esmeralda joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her first loan from ASKI. Esmeralda plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and material

loans.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin está formado por 12 mujeres y un hombre quienes luchan en sus trabajos y en diferentes actividades diarias para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar a sus familias, son personas muy amables y carismáticas. Viven por el sector de Zhullin o en sus alrededores, este sector se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca y Azogues.

La Señora. María Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive por el cantón Cañar, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y ha fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este gran grupo de señoras luchadoras.
Se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica tres días a la semana de 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. 
Doña María Mariana tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 4 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela del sector. Su esposo labora como ayudante de un bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para iniciar en este negocio. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.

La Señora Blanca Marina Pérez vive por el sector del Descanso vía a la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10 años y un bebe de 10 meses de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su hija de 12 años  estudia en una academia de belleza, su tercer hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector, con su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener una casita donada por la curia. 
Doña Blanca Marina trabaja hace 10 años como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Hace 3 meses se ha dedicado a la cría de pollos.
Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su mamá, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para crecer más en este negocio. Su meta  es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Zhullin community bank is made up of twelve women and one man who work hard in their jobs and different business activities so that they can offer their families a better life.  They are very kind and charismatic people who live in the Zhullin neighborhood or surrounding areas.  This neighborhood is characterized by the fact that its inhabitants work raising animals and farming crops.  A lot of the population works in different businesses in the cities of Cuenca and Azogues.

María Mariana C. is a member of the Zhullin community bank.  She lives in Cañar canton and this is the first loan she has taken as a member of her community bank.  She was invited to join this group of hard-working women by her sister.

María Mariana works as a cleaner three days a week, from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children aged 10, 8 and 4 months.  Her eldest two children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband works as an assistant on a bus.  They do not own their own home but rent.  María Mariana will invest her loan money in buying fruit to set herself up in a fruit selling business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Blanca Marina Pérez lives in Descanso neighborhood, in the city of Azogues.  She is 34 years old, is a single mother, and has 4 children aged 17, 12, 10 and 10 months.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her 12 year-old daughter attends a beauty academy, her third child (a boy) is attending a local elementary school.  Through a lot of hard work, Blanca has managed to obtain a small house, provided by the church.

Blanca Marina has been working as a cleaner for 10 years.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 9.00am to 3.00pm.  For the past 3 months, she has been raising chickens.  This is the first loan she has requested through her community bank and she was invited to join by her mom.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens so that she can grow more in this business.  Her goal is to get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fruit and chickens

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Sok Y., age 31, who lives in the Province of Kompong, Chhnang province in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Sok Y. has run this business since 1999 and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She was married, but she divorced her husband back when her kids were still young. She has one child who is good at making baskets, and she always sells her finished products to people who come to order directly at her house. 

In order to earn extra income, Sok Y. will be using the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita N. is from the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 44 years old. Pedrita is single. To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables like eggplants & squash & also dried fish in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pedrita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish & vegetables. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pedrita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish & vegetables.

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: James Gichuru

texts.en:
James is married to Anne and they have two children. He has been operating their general store business which sells foodstuffs, and a secondary business distributing office supplies as well as photocopying office documents, charging customers for usage. These two businesses have been in existence for 12 years and he gets a monthly income of Kshs 15,000.

James was introduced to KADET by existing clients and he is now servicing his tenth loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock like sugar and flour and reams of papers to use in the photocopying of office documents.

James will use the profits to expand his business and educate his children, and he describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as sugar and flour and also reams of paper for photocopying.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
