Olivia L. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has five children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Olivia has a poultry firm, which she has had for over 10 years.  She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.  

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens she sells.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Olivia hopes to open up a livestock farm.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en: Haidee is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Haidee has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. Haidee has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna Diakité est une femme mariée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfant et son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, dès à son jeune âge, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus.
Pendant des années elle a tenté plusieurs activités, sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida d’apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente des ignames auprès de mère.
Avec une expérience de 7 ans, elle maîtrise son activité. Elle s’approvisionne en igname à Gueya. 
Dans le cadre du renforcement des activités, elle décida de prendre un autre prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 sacs d’ignames.
Elle mène cette activité au grand marché de Bougouni mais aussi à la maison. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna Diakité is 36, married, and has 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in Torakabougou, a district of Bougouni.
As she quit school when she was still young, she decided to undertake incoming generating activities.
For years, she tried out various activities, but was unsuccessful. This is how she decided to learn the business of buying and selling yams with her mother.
With 7 years of experience, she now masters the trade. She buys her yams in Gueya.
In order to strengthen her business, she decided to get a loan from Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 bags of yams.
She works in the big market of Bougouni but also at home.
With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 50 000 FCFA. With this benefit, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Karla Mafalda

texts.es:
Karla es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 01 hijo.  Karla estudió educación superior. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos (Esika).  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de bisutería y embutidos.
Con éste crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, comprará productos como: aretes y joyas.  Karla trabaja sola en el negocio.
Su sueño es tener más capital para poner una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.	
Le gusta la responsabilidad y la alegría de las socias.
texts.en:
Karla is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 20 years old, single, and has one child.  She completed high school.

Karla has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She invested that money in her business selling Esika cosmetics.  She also sells jewelry and cold meats.

Karla's dream is to have more capital so that she can set up a store selling basic household products.  What she most likes about her community bank is the responsibility and the cheerfulness of the members.

loans.use: to buy earrings and other jewelry

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en: Gerard, a 33-year-old father of  two children aged two and six, the eldest of whom is in school, has been selling shoes for the past 10 years.  Having built  his own family house from business profits, Gerard is now requesting a loan to buy 150 pairs of shoes and expand his business. With the increased profits and his savings, he plans to buy another house to rent out and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married with 4 children. Leonila is 48 years old and lives in Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila makes and sells Ice Candy to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan to buy wheels, chains, bearings, sprockets and other parts of a motorcycle.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Leonila hopes to have her own store..

loans.use: To buy spare parts like wheels, chains, and other motor parts.

loans.name: Jovis

texts.en:
Jovis is 36 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three school-aged children. Jovis owns and operates a carpentry shop. She has a cabinet-making business with her husband. They make cabinets from wood, wardrobes, dressers, and storage chests. She runs this type of business for over six years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 per month from this business. Jovis has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 at GDMPC to purchase materials for cabinet making.

Jovis has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jovis hopes to have a furniture stall in the town and gain more profit from this business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for cabinet making.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, one of whom is in school. She has been in the retail business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Edith sells her products from home. Edith has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil and bans of bread.  She generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Edith include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to educate her children up to university only. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and bread

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 30-year-old man who is married and has two sons and one daughter. He lives in Sa'eer village near Hebron, Palestine. Issa lives with his family in a house with a cement floor. Issa doesn't have enough cash as he is a Palestinian National Authority employee and earns a small salary, therefore he needs a loan of $1,200 to cover the expense of installing tiles in his house.
When Issa gets his FATEN loan, he can pay in cash to purchase tiles for his house. FATEN loans are repaid on a monthly basis, which will be much easier on him. By getting this loan, Issa and his family will improve their housing situation and have better living conditions. Issa is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to install tiles in his house.

loans.name: Ely Yessenia

texts.es:
Ely, una joven de 28 años de edad, es originaria de San Antonio una comunidad ubicada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, es madre de un hijo, esta casada, cuyo nivel académico es básico, solo curso hasta sexto grado de primaria. Inicio en el negocio de la agricultura a los 19 años de edad, con ayuda de unas tierras que su madre le dio para que trabajara en ellas de las cuales hoy en día ocupa una parte para sembrar café orgánico con ayuda de su esposo ambos trabajan sembrando café. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra de siembra de café. Con esta inversión espera a darle un mejor mantenimiento a su siembra de café y obtener un excelente rendimiento en su cosecha.
Su siguiente paso es mejorar su vivienda , poner a estudiar a su hijos, mejorar sus siembras `para darle un futuro mejor a su hijo y dedicarse a otra de las actividades que mas le gusta la costura como otro medio de subsistencia.
texts.en:
Ely is a 28 year old young woman.  She is from the San Antonio community in the Yali municipality of Jinotega.  She has a son, and she is married.  She has a basic level of education.  She only attended school until the sixth grade.

She started in the farming business when she was 19.  She had the help of some land that her mother gave her to work.  She now uses part of that land to grow organic coffee.  Her husband helps her; they both work growing coffee.

She needs the loan for maintenance, to pay for supplies, and to pay for the labor of planting the coffee.  With this investment she hopes to give her coffee crop better maintenance and get an excellent yield from her harvest.

Her next step is to improve her house, to send her son to school, and to improve her crops in order to give her son a better future.  She will also do another business activity that she likes more.   She likes sewing as another way of making a living.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, to pay for supplies, and to pay for the labor of planting the coffee.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 42 years old and married with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Meriam requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. Her hope is to build a house with the extra income from this loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en unos de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco y donde vende accesorios de celulares. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Elizabeth de veces en cuando viaja al país de Bolivia a comprar productos porque son baratos. 

En esta oportunidad  Elizabeth requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios como por ejemplo estuches y parlantes para celulares. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco and she lives in the same city in which she was born.  She is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have one child.  Elizabeth has a small sales stall in one of the markets in the city of Cusco where she sells cell phone accessories.  She has been in this business for one year and it is doing very well.  Elizabeth sometimes travels to Bolivia to buy products because they are cheap there.

On this occasion, Elizabeth needs a loan to buy accessories such as cell phone cases and speakers.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known as being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and also because it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Rhea Catherine

texts.en:
Rhea Catherine is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rhea Catherine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She also buys and sells chickens like "cal" chicken or white leghorn chicken. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages  to sell.

Rhea Catherine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhea Catherine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.ru:
Rafail jenat i imeyet trex detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Rafail 52 qoda. 
Eto vtoraya ssuda Rafaila , on udachno oplatil svoy perviy kredit bez zaderjki, za svoyu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive. 
SEychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Rafail zanimayetsya skotovodstvom uje 7 let, ranshe on razvodil ovec, seychas on razvodit korov. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/164214
texts.en: Rafail is married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Rafail is is 52 years old.  This is Rafail's second loan.  He successfully repaid his first loan without delays and is very grateful to Kiva lenders for that loan.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and develop his business.  Rafail has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years.  He previously bred sheep and now breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is a 30 year-old woman who is married and has one son.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Maysoon wants to improve her house by painting, changing tiles, windows and doors, etc.  She needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Maysoon gets the loan, she will be able to pay for making these improvements to her house.  This will enable her to live with the family in healthy and better conditions. Maysoon is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To pay for improving her house conditions.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments and children's wear. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more traditional Ugandan dresses and children's wear for the holiday season, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and continue to grow her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase traditional dresses and children's wear.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Alberta has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of rice to sell.

Alberta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 51 years old and lives in Sipalos, Sibutad. She is married with two children. Estrella has a hog raising business and earns approximately PHP 3700 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14900 to purchase feed for her piglets. Estrella has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sacks of feed for her piglets

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 04 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos, la casa está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, específicamente en el Caserío Palominos, una zona agrícola productora de mango y limón, ubicada en la región Piura, a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Gabriel se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y porcino), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una hectárea de terreno agrícola en donde tiene mango y limón en producción.

Por otro lado trabaja como vigilante en un fundo agrícola de la zona, con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Gabriel se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la alimentación y sanidad del ganado con el que cuenta, así como en la fertilización de sus frutales. El es un cliente nuevo en Edpyme Alternativa y goza de buenas referencias en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 4 children.   The house is located in a rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, in a specific area called Caserio Palominos, an agricultural zone where people grow mango, lemons and other fruit.  It's located about 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

Gabriel raises sheep and pigs until they reach an ideal size and weight to sell in the local market.  He also has a small piece of land where he grows mango and lemons.  For additional income, he works as a security guard.  The income from his various businesses has enabled Gabriel to improve the quality of life for his family.  

Gabriel is requesting a loan to purchase food and medicine for his animals, as well as fertilizer for his fruit trees.   He is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and has good references from his local area.

loans.use: to purchase food and medicine for his livestock, as well as fertilizer for his fruit trees

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred deals in the spare auto parts business in Masindi, Uganda. He is 49 years old and responsible for taking care of his three children. 

He had a kiosk selling fresh foods five years ago, and this acted as a stepping stone to his current business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He desires to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. 

Fred wants a loan to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Ashiatu

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Ashiatu.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 15, 12, 8, and 5 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her because he is her relative attending school in the city.  In 2010, Ashiatu established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and to be recognized in the community. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ashiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy rubber sandals, foam slippers, and two slim slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Ashiatu plans to have a bigger business, to educate her children, and to build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic slippers

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 34 years old. She has four children, all of whom attend school except the youngest. She is married to a businessman. 

She has spent four years running a market business. She expects to use the loan to buy more market items such as rice, sugar, and maize flour to sell. She plans to save the profits as well as paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se unieron para trabajar juntas y por medio de este trabajo en conjunto salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Leticia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo.
Sus ventas han ayudado a Leticia a tener los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y de esa forma poder tener un estilo de vida decoroso. Ella se esfuerza constantemente para ser mejor cada día. Dice que tiene muy buena clientela y eso la ayuda mucho.
Solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de gaseosas, agua tónica, cervezas, whiskys y demás tipos de bebidas.
texts.en:
Twelve women from the city of Itá, all of them friends and neighbors from that city joined together to work together and through this work get ahead and support each other.  They are currently in the third cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Program.

Leticia is one of the group members.  She is a very hardworking woman and she comments that she sells all types of beverages.

Her sales have helped Leticia to have the necessary income to help her family get ahead and to have a decorous lifestyle.  She strives constantly to be better every day.  She says that she has a very good clientele and this helps her very much.

She is asking for Kiva’s and Fundación Paraguaya’s help to buy soft-drinks, tonic water, beer, whisky and other types of beverages.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, tonic water, beer, whisky and other types of beverages.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five women from the village of Effock in the southern region of Casamance. Represented by group leader Jacqueline D., the group describes their business activities as follows:

“Background: Effock is a village in reconstruction after having experienced more than ten years under the fire of war with the [separatist conflict] crisis in Casamance. Being in reconstruction, we need financial support which will help us manage our enterprises properly in order to better face this new phase that we are beginning.

Purpose of the loan: To combat migration from rural areas, reconstruct our village, and improve the living conditions of its inhabitants.

Business activities: Our principal activity is maraillage; that is, we purchase fish from the village fishermen which we sell in the town of Oussouye, to travelers on the national road that passes through our region, and also to hotels. We also conduct commercial activities, selling local products that we produce ourselves, such as palm oil, oysters, clams, etc.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le village de Effock, est un village en reconstruction après avoir vécu plus de 10 années sous le feu de la guerre avec le problème en Casamance. Etant en reconstruction, les populations nous avons besoin d’un soutien financier qui va nous aider à bien mener nos activités pour mieux affrontée cette nouvelle phase que nous entamons.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode, dans le cadre de la reconstruction du village, améliorer les conditions de vie des populations.

Activités : Notre activité principale est : le maraillage c\\\'est-à-dire que nous achetons du poisson auprès des pêcheurs du village et que nous revendons à Oussouye, sur la route nationale aux passagers et aussi dans les structures hôtelier. Nous menons aussi des activités commerciales en vendant des produits locaux que nous produisons nous même tel que : huile de palme, huîtres, mollusques etc. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchasing fish; purchasing containers for palm oil; renting canoe for collecting oysters and transportation of goods to market

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en: Kweku is 49 years old and father of 5 children who are all in school. He has run an elecrical shop in his community for the past 10 years. Having participated in the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION in October, 2006, he decided to join the KIVA program by seeking a loan. He intends to use the loan to buy more stock for his shop. This will enable him to undertake some repair work in clients' houses and work directly on their appliances which will lead to increased income levels.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Leah C.

texts.en: Leah is a widowed mother of eight. All of her children have been schooled and the youngest is in form one. She started her business in 2004 in order to support her family’s basic needs.  She gets her stock from Nairobi where she goes once per week.  She is also a farmer. With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock and reduce the number of times she has to go to Nairobi, thus reducing the cost of her operations. Through her business, she has been able to educate her children and develop her farm.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Business Description

Fernando started his business one year ago. The products he sells to stores and schools are: cookies of different flavors, gelatins and flours. He tends to his customers personally every day from 6 am to 3pm.

Use of the Loan

Fernando needs the loan to invest in the purchase of more and new confectionery products, since he’s been presented with the opportunity to expand his business out of town.

Personal Information

Fernando is 46 years old. He has three children, two of which help him with his business. His wife works as domestic help, and he works as a driver several nights per week. Theirs is a mixed construction house, part of which is used for the business. Fernando wishes to become better and grow along with his business, so that his children can go to college and complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Fernando inició su negocio hace 1 año. Los productos que vende a las tiendas y escuelas son: galletas de diferentes sabores, gelatinas y harinas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am a las 3pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Fernando necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más y nuevos productos de confitería, dado que se le ha presentado la oportunidad de expandir su negocio por las afueras de la ciudad.

Información Personal

Fernando tiene 46 años. Tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales colaboran con él en la atención del negocio. Su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica y él trabaja como chofer varias noches a la semana. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta, de la cual ocupan una parte para su negocio. Aspira a mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio, para de esta manera lograr que sus hijos ingresen a la universidad y terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy more products for distribution

loans.name: Alegría

texts.es:
The desire to actively contribute to his family's income during his free time has led Alegria to gain experience in selling fresh fish to his community. He begins very early in an air-conditioned space outside his home so that he can work and take care of household chores without any problem. Thanks to the income that his daily efforts generate, he can satisfy his household's most pressing needs and keep his family happy. Because keeping his product in optimal selling condition is essential, Alegria wants to purchase a freezer for his fish in order to sell hygienic fish in good condition. This is why he is requesting a 400 dollar loan that he promises to repay in 6 months. With your generous help, you can help make Alegria's dream a reality. Alegria and his family appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El deseo de contribuir activamente en sus momentos libres, con el ingreso familiar ha llevado a Alegría a adquirir experiencia en la venta de pescados frescos a su comunidad. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde muy temprano en un espacio acondicionado en las afueras de su vivienda de esa manera puede trabajar y atender las labores de su hogar sin dificultad. Gracias al ingreso que genera su desempeño diario puede satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar y mantener a su familia contenta.debido a que es imprescindible tener este producto en condiciones óptimas para la venta, es que Alegría desea adquirir una máquina para congelar los pescados con el propósito de ofrecerlos con higiene y en buen estado. Por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Con tu generosa ayuda podrás hacer que este deseo se convierta en realidad Alegría y su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to improve the conditions in which Alegria sells fish every day

loans.name: Sedaget

texts.en: Sedaget Z. and her husand (husband is pictured) own and operate a furniture store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sedeget is 57 years old and is married with four children. She and her husband have been involved with this business for a number of years and have already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that she is a trustworthy customer. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $725 that she will combine with some of her and her husbands own funds to purchase new inventory for the store.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for her store.

loans.name: Yance

texts.es:
Yance is a strong man who works hard every day to obtain a good harvest, never wasting a moment of valuable time. Thanks to his efforts he has been able to provide for the well being and education of his family. Yance grows bananas, citrus fruits and mangos to sell to wholesalers. He is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, increase his production and grow his business. Let's join together to help this hardworking father reach his goals.

Yance, es un hombre de mucha fuerza física, día a día trabaja arduamente para obtener una muy buena cosecha y es por eso que no desperdicia ni un instante del valioso tiempo que posee en el cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivo; gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado sostenerse y brindarle a su familia educación y bienestar. Con su trabajo mantiene eficientemente a su hija y este hecho lo impulsa aún más a seguir labrando la tierra. Él siembra plátanos, cítricos y mangos para ofrecerlos a los comerciantes mayoristas y es por esa razón que aprovecha al máximo el tiempo en el cuidado de sus productos para que en la cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos de su arduo trabajo.Su propósito es solicitar un préstamo para incrementar su producción con la compra de más semillas para su cultivo. Solidaricémonos con este increíble padre para que continúe sembrando a fin de que pueda cosechar muchas alegrías

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SEEDS AND INCREASE HIS HARVEST, GROW HIS BUSINESS AND BETTER PROVIDE FOR THE WELL BEING OF HIS FAMILY.

loans.name: Tochiddin

texts.ru:
Tochiddin R. is 31 years old, has secondary education. He is a teacher and has 4 children. Tochiddin has been in the retail business for the past 5 years and has been selling small merchandise like sawing materials, glue, children's toys, hair clips and other things. For this purpose he is renting a space at the central market of town of Yavan called Tidjorat. He wants to use his loan to buy more assortment of merchandise. This loan will give local residents an opportunity to shop at the market for small, but very useful things for the home at moderate prices.

Tochiddin plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Точиддин, возраст – 31 год, образование высшее, специальность – учитель, женат , имеет 4 -х детей. Точиддин в течение 5 лет занимается торговлей мелкими товарами народного потребления такими как нитки, клей, детские игрушки, заколки и другое. Для этого он арендует торговую точку на центарльном рынке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на пополнение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать у себя на базаре не большие, но очень нужные вещи в домашнем хозяйстве по умеренным ценам.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian dedicates himself to providing transportation to the public; he relies on two vehicles, one of which he rents out while he drives the other, stationing himself at the taxi stand in Chapare. Julian has two daughters, aged 9 and 12. His wife also works, devoting herself to selling tablecloths at CANCHA.

Both have many years of experience in their lines of work, and both face stiff competition. What helps them out is that they are both affiliated with trade union representatives in their fields. These unions are well organized, and the demand for their services is high. Julian will use this request to complete the purchase of his vehicle, since the money he's making doesn't cover it. He has very good credit history, and his behavior with this institution was very good.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Julian de dedica al transporte público, cuenta con dos movilidades de las cuales una la alquila y la otra la maneja ubicandose en la parada de taxis del Chapare. Julian tiene dos hijas que tienen 9 y 12 años de edad. Su esposa también trabaja dedicando al comercio de manteles en la CANCHA. Ambos tienen muchos años de experiencia en los rubros que se desempeñan y si bien la competencia en los mismos es bastante elevada lo que les fortalece es que son afiliados a Sindicatos representativos de sus rubros, estos sindicatos están bien organizados y paralelamente la demanda por estos servicios es también elevada. Esta solicitud, Julian la utilizará para completar la compra de un vehículo ya que el capital con el que cuenta no le alcanzó. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios y su comportamiento con la Institución fué muy bueno.

loans.use: Cash to finish paying off his car purchase.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Every morning Alcira goes to the city of Palca to sell the herbs she cultivates on her land. This town is well known for the huge numbers of vendors that come to sell on market days, and it was this fact that motivated Alcira to dedicate herself to this type of work. The income she has made from this job has contributed to improving the quality of life for her beloved family. It is because of this that she would like to improve the quality of the products that she plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Alcira, todas la mañanas sale a vender las hierbas que extrae de sus terrenos para comercializarlas en la ciudad de Palca, este lugar es muy conocido por la inmensa cantidad de comerciantes que proliferan los días de feria, y precisamente está característica ha animado a Alcira a dedicarse a esta labor. Los ingresos que ha percibido por esta labor han contribuido a mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida familia y por este motivo desea incrementar la calidad de los productos que estima sembrar.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her products.

loans.name: I Gede Kenul

texts.id:
I Gede Kenul is a paddy farmer located at Pangkung Buluh village. He is married and have several children. His job as a farmer is the main and only source of income for his family.

He works on a land of 1.5 hectares (around 15,000 square meter) and he is awaiting for harvest season at the moment. The main problem he is facing in farming is lack of capital to enable him to buy a high quality paddy seeds and also to buy the farming utilities. Therefore he is applying for a loan from Dinari foundation. He will use the loan money to buy high quality seed fertilizer and pesticide. He hopes to be able to improve the quality of his paddy harvest by having all of those.

With this his revenue will increase and he will be able to finance his children's education to higher level and also to help him to meet his family's daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Gede Kenul seorang petani padi yang berlokasi di desa pangkung Buluh,menjalankan usahanya dengan penuh semangat walaupun ditengah teriknya matahari. Semua karena rasa tanggungjawabnya terhadap keluarga dan pendidikan anak-anaknya.Apalagi istrinya sebagai ibu rumah tangga tidak mempunyai penghasilan yang tetap.Jadi semua masalah keuangan menjadi tanggungjawab I Gede Kenul .Lahan yang digarap sekitar 1.5 hektar dan kini sedang menunggu panen. Tapi dalam penggarapan lahan ini I Gede Kenul mengalami kekurangan modal baik dalam pembelian bibit maupun pemeliharaannya. Oleh sebab itu I Gede Kenul mengajukan pinjaman kepada Yayasan Dinari. Pinjaman ini dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,penggarapan sawah,karena semua penggarapan menggunakan tenaga traktor,karena I Gede Kenul tidak memiliki Sapi yang dipergunakan untuk membajak, kemudian membeli pupuk dan obat-obat vestisida lainnya. Dengan harapan hasil yang diperoleh akan meningkat dari pada panen sebelumnya yang hanya menggunakan bibit lokal ,dan pemeliharaanya tidak maksimal. Panen yang akan datang ini diharapkan keuntungan yang diperoleh menjadi meningkat ,sehingga I Gede Kenul bisa menyekolahkan anak-anaknya ketingkat yang lebih tinggi, dan keluarganya bisa sejahtera dan tercukupi.

loans.use: To buy high quality paddy seeds, pesticide and fertilizer (Membeli bibit padi jenis unggul, anti hama dan pupuk)

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Every day Doña Dolores lets her demanding customers taste delicious dishes from their beautiful region and this fills her with satisfaction. The decision to open a restaurant two years ago in her own home on the advice of her neighbors was the best decision and today she has enjoyed a wonderful reception from hundreds of people. She is happy because her business has allowed her to support her youngest son, 15 years old, to reach his goals and future desires. She would like to continue her work and for this goal she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días Doña Dolores hace degustar a su exigente clientela ricos platillos de su bella región y esto la llena de satisfacción. Haber decidido hace 2 años abrir un restaurante en su propia casa por consejo de sus vecinos fue su mejor decisión y actualmente goza de la gran acogida de centenares de personas. Está contenta porque este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su ultimo hijo de 15 años a alcanzar sus metas y próximos anhelos.Desea continuar con su labor y para este fin solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to expand and improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Asadulla

texts.en: Asadulla H. is a 47 year old man who raises and sells sheep to local bazaar traders in the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. He lives with his wife and five children in the Bilasuvar internally displaced persons settlement. He has nine years of experience in sheep breeding. Asadulla applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase more sheep for his sheep herd. He and his wife are unemployed and the sale of sheep is their only one source of income for their family.  He will purchase 10 sheep for 60 USD each and 200 USD of fodder with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Noema

texts.en: Noema P., 59, is married with seven children. Noema runs a plantation business and it's well supported by her grandsons. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Noema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Noema would like to purchase gromoxone, sting and knives for her plantation.

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is 34 years old. She is married with three children aged twelve, six, and three years old. She own a small shop and has been selling clothing since 2006. Every day she works from 11am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Esta now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing and other items for her business to increase profits.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing and other items at her shop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela, 52, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has a son, 15, in high school. Her husband is a supervisor for an industrial company and contributes to the family's living expenses. Angela has operated a small general store for a year, a business that she started with help from her husband and her own hard work. She gets up early to make breakfast for her husband and son so that she can open the store each morning in time for students on their way to school to stop and buy what they need from her. The loan will be used to stock the store with basic grains because they're costly now and it's become difficult to buy them in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

Ángela habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, que actualmente esta estudiando la secundaria, su esposo es supervisor industrial, y le apoya económicamente en los gastos del hogar. Doña Ángela tiene una pulpería que comenzó con esfuerzo propio y con ayuda de su esposo, ya tiene un año de tenerla, ella se levanta temprano a preparar el desayuno para su esposo y su hijo para luego abrir la venta en la mañana ya que aprovecha a los estudiantes que van hacia la escuela y que muchas veces requieren de sus servicios. El crédito será usado para la compra de granos básicos para surtir la pulpería, ya que actualmente éstos tiene precios elevados y se la hace más difícil adquirir en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Polieni

texts.en: Polieni F., 46, is married with 9 children. She has 3 years of experience in the groceries business. She sells to the village and general public 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (250 USD). SPBD loans are Polieni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Husband works as a labourer for one of the government's departments.

loans.use: Purchase to improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Thi Hoa Hoang Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1963 (Ms 10030019 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, vịt và đi chợ rau. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê có thu nhập. Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Chị Hoa còn tham gia hoạt động xã hội và người nhiệt tình, sôi nổi nên mọi người yêu mến đồng thơi là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
Tạ Thị Lý, sinh năm 1965 (Ms 10030017 ), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ 
Đỗ Thị Khanh, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 10030021), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Nguyễn Thị Oanh, sinh năm 19 (Ms 10030022), mức vốn vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng cắt tóc.
Hoàng Thị Hải, sinh năm 1969 (Ms 10030025 ), mức vốn vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ rau và nuôi lợn.
Trần Thị Chín, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 10030018 ), tham gia mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng nước giải khát.
Hoàng Thị Chuyên, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 10030020), tham gia mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau và nuôi lợn.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 27 years old, married, with two children. Her husband is a wounded soldier. She has been a member of TYM since 2007. Now her primary income is a grocery store. Her family also receives some income from her husband's salary, which keeps their household economy very stable. Nguyen Thi would like a loan of 9 millionVND ($550USD) to invest in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng R., 47, sells porridge and the Khmer traditional noodle in her village located in Kampong Thom Province. Her husband is a sugar palm seller who climbs palms, makes palm juice, then turns it into palm sugar for sale. She has five children, two of whom are married while three remain single. One is employed as a staff of a local NGO and another one works in a purified water company.

Mrs. R. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase some bamboo-trader equipment to use for climbing the palm tree. From the remaining loan,  she would like to save and buy a second hand motorcycle to transport the sugar palm to sell in the market.

loans.use: To improve sugar palm business

loans.name: María Salome

texts.es:
En el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, la señora María Salomé N. se dedica a atender su pulpería muy alegremente vendiendo todo tipo de productos como lo son comestibles, granos básicos, escobas, productos de limpieza, entre otros. 

Sus inicios fueros duros debido a que desde hace 8 años que decidió establecer el negocio, comenzó vendiendo pocas cantidades sin embargo a medida que el tiempo vino transcurriendo mejoró sus condiciones y adquirió mayores cantidades de productos para venderlos. Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para continuar en su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
In the municipal market of Chichigalpa, María Salomé N. is very happily dedicated to attending her grocery store selling all types of products such as snacks, basic grains, brooms, and cleaning products, among other things. In the beginning, it was difficult because eight years ago she decided to start the business and began selling only small quantities. Nevertheless, over time she improved her conditions and acquired greater quantities of products to sell. Today, the reason why she has sought out Ceprodel is to receive a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise and continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sujayet

texts.en: Sujayet S. and her husband believe that education is the most important inheritance they can give their children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their five children the opportunity to finish school. That is an opportunity they never had, due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more bills than she can afford. Therefore, she would like a loan of $1200 in order to buy 10 sheep and fodder, in order to increase their capital. Sujayet and her family are waiting for your quick response.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima I. is 46 years old. She is married with three children. Rahima is a market vendor, who sells dishes and plates of the oriental style in the central local market. Rahima has been in this business for 8 years already, and her business is successful enough to allow Rahima to support her family and her husband’s parents. Considering that the husband of Rahima is currently unemployed, her business generates the main income. Now Rahima is planning to increase stock by purchasing dishes and plates wholesale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting $800 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Rahima thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dishes and plates wholesale in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet M. is a forty five year old divorced mother of four children, two of whom are males. Two of her children have completed junior high school and are into trading, while the rest are still in basic school. She is the sole provider for her children. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  She works very hard as a food vendor in the evenings, in order to provide for the family. Janet prepares and sells a local dish called “Ga-Kenkey” which is produced from corn dough that is balled in a corn husk and cooked again. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish.  Janet has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is 54 years old. She is a married mother of six children. She says three children are working while three are still in school, in senior and junior high. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Janet is a trader. She trades in fashion accessories such as unisex belts, ladies’ bags and other leather products. She buys the products directly from the producers in the regional capital. She says she treks to towns to sell and also hawks in her community.

Janet has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fashion accessories for sale.

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
An active member of Paglaum MPC for two years, Mrs. Rosefina D. is 45 years old and married with three children. Her husband previously worked as a carpenter. He also helped his wife raise pigs because this is their one way of earning an income. Both want to have a decent living in the future so they want to be secure, especially for the future of their children.

They have heard good views on the cooperative and they like the insurance and savings services. Now, they need additional capital to acquire piglets. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP. She wishes that this will be her stepping stone to become popular in the piggery business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and additional piglets.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir K. is a 52-year old farmer who sells milk and milk products such as cheese, yogurt and butter. Shakir looks after his cows and pastures them and his wife makes all the milk products. Shakir has five children. They are all adults and Shakir works to cover his and his wife's needs. His pension is too small to cover their basic needs. Now Shakir is applying for a 1500 USD loan to purchase three calves and raise three more cows in future.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria S., a 53-year-old widow, sells food items in the street, selling different kinds of biscuits, candies and other food items to earn a living. Before, she tried to raise pigs. She was not able to manage it well and decided to stop her business and instead, manage a small stall filled with many foods to sell.

She is asking a loan of Php 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase food items for her business. Now, her business is going so well. She hopes to improve her stall someday.

CEVI help Silveria sustain her business even more. CEVI provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
H. Trần Thị, 62, lives in the town of Ninh Giang. She is widowed and has one adult child. To making a living, H. owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  She used the previous loan to expand her business. H. is now requesting a loan of 10000000 VND that she will use to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. The loan will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nirala

texts.en:
Nirala S. is the business owner of a small chain of beauty products. Nirala makes creams and lotions that are used by beauticians when they give facials. Nirala makes all of her products with herbal ingredients and learnt her skill when she was working at a beauty clinic.

Nirala is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase new ingredients and packaging for her lotions and creams.

Nirala currently supplies to a number of beauty parlours in her community but with the help of a Kiva loan, she is hoping to expand her business and begin supplying to beauticians beyond her own community.

Nirala’s husband works in an office for the government. The couple have one adult son who is now married with a son of his own. The whole family live together and Nirala’s daughter-in-law helps Nirala with her beauty product business.

loans.use: purchasing ingredients to make facial products

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy F. is a 19-year-old rice grower from Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. Though she is still young, she has the ambition that, someday, she will be able to uplift their lives out of poverty.

Because her family is not able to support her education, Ivy engages herself in a farming business. However, she needs additional capital to keep going in her business, especially in buying urea fertilizer and herbicides. She hopes that, by buying these things, she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps Ivy grow her livelihood. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of urea fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is a member of the Kibwana in Ilala,Iringa borrower group,she is 22 years old woman,she is single and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.

Cathy started her own clothing business selling clothes 6 years ago.She works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Cathy first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Cathy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the K. borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 43 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 20,17,13, and 9 years.

Veronica started her own business selling Timber 7 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,0000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Veronica`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more Timber for sale.

with the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save more money,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Timber for sale

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S., 55, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her seven children. She has three married children who live separately, while her four remaining children are staying in the family home, while holding a variety of jobs. Vann S. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, Vann S. goes to a fishermen's market to buy fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, where they sells them. Vann S. will be using her first loan to buy a motor for family's transportation purposes.  Any remaining money will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: To Buy a Motor for Transportation

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 08 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudios.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar algunas cabezas de ovino y porcino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias zonales.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino y porcino.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen L. is from the village of P-4, Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Arlen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlen owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as bags, eyeglasses, wallets and others in the local community. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arlen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 34 años, vive con sus 3 hijos: Milton de 17, Antony de 15, Karla de 12 y Adamary de 11 años, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, actividad que aprendió de su madre y le arroja buenos ingresos, ya que el acabado que le brinda Judith a sus prendas es muy bueno, por lo que todos sus clientes siempre la buscan para solicitar sus servicios.
A ella le gusta su trabajo y lo realiza muy contenta, aunque muchas veces deba lidiar con algunos inconvenientes, como el cansancio por las largas horas de trabajo que le dedica, a pesar de ello siempre logra entregar los pedidos que le realizan y dejar contenta a su clientela.  Para el futuro desea expandir su taller de costura y hacerlo más productivo.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, logrando que sea muy querida en su grupo solidario. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela y otros materiales necesarios para entregar los pedidos que le solicitaron y así mejorar los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a 34 year old woman who lives with her 4 children: Milton, 17; Antony, 15, Karla, 12, and Admary, 11. She lives in her own house.

For five years, she has been engaged in making clothing, an activity that she learned from her mother that produces good income for her since the styling Judith puts into her garments is very good. That’s why all her customers seek her out in order to ask for her services.

She likes her work and carries it out quite gladly, although many times she has to contend with inconveniences such as fatigue due to the long hours of work she performs. In spite of this, she always succeeds in delivering orders that she carries out and in leaving her customers happy. For the future, her wish is to expand her sewing workshop and make it more productive.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she has always been characterized by being very punctual in making all her payments, succeeding in being very well regarded in her communal bank. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy a greater quantity of fabric and other materials necessary in order to fill the orders given to her and, thus, improve the earnings of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities such as tomatoes, dagaa, onions etc.

loans.name: Marcia Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Marcia tiene un negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general como productos zermat, como cosméticos, perfumes y ropa de manera esporádica. Hace  más de 2 años y medio de trabajar en este negocio. Es madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico en Managua, doña Marcia sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, ella vende su mercadería en sus alrededores y en algunas comarcas y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija que lleva parte del producto a la universidad. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para mejorar el negocio, ya que recientemente no ha podido comprar los productos necesarios por el poco capital que tiene.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia sells general merchandise such as Zermat cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing. She has been working sporadically for more than 2½ years in this line of business. Her two children have been able to attend school thanks to her efforts and those of her husband, who works as a mechanic in Managua. Doña Marcia sells every day by traveling on her bicycle, her only mode of transportation. She sells her merchandise in the surrounding neighborhoods and districts. Her daughter helps her out by selling some of her products at the university.

The loan she is requesting will be used to improve her business. Most recently, she has not been able to order new products because she has very little capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is married with five children, between the ages of 4 months and 11 years. He runs a retail shop called Baba Faith, selling unga (flour), sukari (sugar), majani (tea leaves), and cooking fat. He's been in business for three years and has one employee. He also earns some income from masonry work. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 30,000 to buy cereals, cooking fat, and sugar for Kes. 10,000 each. 

He describes himself as hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu, he has begun saving money. In the future, he hopes to expand the business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulk supply of yam, vegetable oil, vegetables, charcoal and fish etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has five children who are all currently in school. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. 

Margaret works hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a table top by the road in her community. Margaret buys her raw materials from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and ingredients in bulk to make stew for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen M. M. is forty-seven years old, married, and has three children aged between twenty-four and twelve years old. Her business is located at Ndunyu Sabuk market in Thika, Kenya. She has been supplying cereals to the local people. She has been in this business for the last four years and she says that her major challenge is that there are many people doing the same business as hers. However, she is determined to work hard and become the market leader. She is using her loan to buy more cereals to expand her business. In future, she sees herself having a big business. She is very innovative and hard-working.

loans.use: beans and maize

loans.name: Onondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se conformo gracias a que integrantes de otro comité de mismo barrio informaron a sus vecinas acerca del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron juntarse junto con sus vecinas y conformar el dicho comité. Utilizaran  su crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles, compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra venta de ropas, bebidas, compra de cueros para la fabricación de zapatos para su posterior venta, etc
Entre sus integrantes se encuentra la señora Juana A. quien se dedca a la venta de ropa, esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulante, ella sale de su casa tres veces por semana recorriendo varios lugares de la ciudad y de esa forma ella vende sus productos y lograr traer un poco e ingreso que ayuda para el sosten de la casa, de esta forma todas las señoras trabajan para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Onondivepa group was formed after the members of another group in the same region talked to their neighbors about the group, Mujeres Emprendedoras. They decided to get together with their neighbors of that group. They will use their loan to fund various forms of purchasing, such as: purchase of ingredients for the production of food; to purchase milk and sugar, herbs, flour, salt, bread products and vegetables for resale; to purchase clothing, and drinks; to purchase leather for shoemaking, etc. Among their members is Juana A. and her business is clothing sales. She sells her clothing by traveling to various parts of the city sometimes three times per week. She sells her products this way and she manages to bring home some income to the home. All of the other women in the group travel hard to see their success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, leather for shoemaking, milk, sugar, herbs, flour, breads, other ingredients, and drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Elisea

texts.es: Rosa Elisea M. R. de 56 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es una persona soltera, la cual vive junto a su única hija la cual se dedica a trabajar, así mismo vive junto a sus tres nietos de 10, 5 y 1 año de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores se dedican a estudiar. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, es por esto que posee una venta de pan, cigarros, refrescos, golosinas y otros productos más, y es gracias a este negocio a través del cual ha logrado seguir adelante junto a su hija y sus nietos. Su puesto esta ubicado a las afueras de uno de los centros comerciales con más afluencia de personas, el cual esta ubicado en Soyapango, así mismo dicho centro comercial esta en expansión, situación la cual Rosa ha sabido aprovechar, iniciando otro negocio de comida, lugar en el que  su hija se encarga de atenderlo. Es por esto que Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como frutas, verduras, granos básicos, pan, bebidas y otros más, los cuales le permitan atender a toda la demanda que existe en el lugar, esto le permitirá obtener más ganancias, las cuales sean de beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Elisea M. R. is 56 years old and resides in the town of Soyapango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She is a single person who lives with her only daughter who is working. Rosa also lives with her three grandchildren (ages 10, 5, and 1), with the two oldest ones attending school.

Rosa is a hardworking woman who has always struggled to get ahead. She sells bread, cigarettes, soft drinks, candy, and other products. Thanks to her business she has been able to move forward along with her daughter and grandchildren. Her vending post is located outside of the largest commercial areas in Soyopango that has huge influx of people. Since this shopping center is expanding, Rosa wants to take advantage of this opportunity by starting another food business that her daughter will be responsible for managing. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more products such as fruit, vegetables, basic grains, bread, beverages, and other items. This will allow her to meet the entire demand of this area, thereby generating more earnings to benefit her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcase food products

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.en: Akouwa B. lives and works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. She is married to a taxi driver and has one child. Mrs. B. sells groceries and beauty products. She began this business in 2004 and is requesting her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase rice, cooking oil, powdered milk and other products needed to keep her shelves stocked. The continued growth of Mrs. B.’s business will not only benefit her, but her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheang K. is 42 years old and she lives in Krasang village in Takeo province. She is the leader of a group of eight people who are requesting a loan together. The group members, who selected Mrs. Kheang K. as their group leader, will each use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Kheang K. and her husband, Mr. Khy Krouch, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate rice in order to make a living. The couple has two children who both attend the local school. 

In addition to farming, Mrs. Kheang K. is a pig breeder and her husband is a rubber middleman. With both these businesses they can earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Kheang K. is requesting a loan to bU. pig food to support her pig breeding.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy pig food.

loans.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
La señora María  Augusta C. es socia del Bankito las Caleras, vive por el sector  El Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus ríos, paisajes,  donde podemos  disfrutar  lo colonial con lo moderno, su gente, su cultura y sus tradiciones  hacen esta urbe de ensueños atractiva para el turista nacional y extranjero.

María trabaja como empleada domestica de lunes a viernes con un  horario de 8H30 hasta las 14H00,  también se dedica a la venta de ropa los fines de semana desde hace  dos años la misma que vende recorriendo por distintas partes de la ciudad. Ella  es una mujer de  36 años de edad se casó muy joven,  su esposo hace tres años está en el exterior aportando económicamente para mantener a su familia, de sus cuatro hijos el mayor de 21 años es casado pero vive con ella compartiendo los gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos 16 y 14 años estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y el ultimo de 4 años pasa en casa o con ella. 


 Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en el bankito invitada por su nuera, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal  y ahora con su nuevo credito  comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, casacas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños  para así incrementar  su negocio,  su  sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia  porque aún viven arrendando.
texts.en:
Maria Augusta C. is a member of the Bankito Las Caleras village bank; she lives in the El Tejar area of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rivers and landscapes where people enjoy both the colonial feel and the modern feel; its people, its culture and traditions make this a dreamy city for both domestic and foreign tourists. Maria works as a housekeeper Monday to Friday from 830 am to 2 pm; for the past 2 years, she has also sold clothing on the weekends in different parts of the city. She is 36 years old and got married very young; 3 years ago, her husand left the country to find better work to support his family. They have 4 children; the oldest is 21 and is married but lives with Maria to help with household expenses; two children, 14 and 16, are still in school; and the youngest, who is 4, stays in the house with Maria. She is in her second cycle in the bank and was invited by her daughter in law; she is good friends with the other members of the village bank and will use this new loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, and underwear for men, women and children. This will help her to increase her business. Her dream is to have her own home as they are currently renting.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, and underwear for men, women and children

loans.name: Johana Sugey

texts.es: Johana Sugey S. O. una mujer trabajadora y esforzada quien el 2000 inicio su negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y electrodomesticos con el cual a sacado a delante a sus hijos de 17 y 15 años. Ella con el credito piensa cubrir los encargos que tiene en ropa e incurcionara en la realización de recargas.
texts.en:
Johana Sugey S. O. is a very hard-working woman. She started her business in 2000; she sells clothes, footwear and home appliances. With this business, she has been able to get her two children (17 and 15) ahead. With this loan she will cover the costs of clothing orders and to re-stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Aem's Group

texts.en: In Angk Khlaeu village, in Kandal province, four members of this group loan have selected Mr. Aem U. as a group leader. Each of the members will use a portion of the loan for different purposes, with the goal of improving their businesses in the future. Mr. Aem U. is 36 years old. He is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he can grow crops to sell to support his family. Now his problem is it is time to grow crops but he does not have enough money to support the field. So to improve production, Mr. Aem U. is seeking for a loan to do farming this current year. His wife, Mrs. Kosorl Lou, is a seamstress in a garment factory. He is a father of four children, all attending the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Mrs. Cristina C. is from the barangay (village) of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old and is married to Joelito C. who is a painter. They are blessed with four children all of whom are now adults. Three are already married and one is still single. Cristina is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has engaged in this kind of business for seven years already and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.
