In 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP as her 4th loan from PMPC. The loan will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. Cristina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, in savings for future use, for loan repayments and for possible house repairs. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
Madame Abra T. A. is 36 years old. She is married to another merchant and they live in Lomé, Togo with their one child. 

Madame A. sells pagnes, beautifully colored traditional Togolese cloths. She has been selling pagnes since 1999. She sells them by walking through her neighborhood, carrying the pagnes stacked on her head. This is a lucrative business, given that most women in Togo use pagnes as skirts or dresses, baby wraps, head wraps, or cloth for making other clothing. She is now taking her first loan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA in order to purchase 20 more pagnes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes, a traditional Togolese cloth

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et vivent la plupart dans les  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt et  les trois prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par KADIATOU B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 2 hectares . 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70 000 FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt en plus de l'intérêt  et aussi à préparer le trousseau de mariage de ses filles.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this BENKADI 2 group are married women who have an average age of 39 and on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in SEREKENI, one of the villages in the township of LOULOUNI in the Sous-prefecture of LOULOUNI, third administrative region of Mali. They work with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan and the three preceding ones have been correctly reimbursed. Kadiatou B., one of the members of the group, cultivates rice. With her loan, she expects to buy inputs and small equipment to maintain two hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market of Loulouni to a clientele composed essentially of middlemen who come from the big cities. Kadiatou expects to earn an average profit of 70,000 F CFA at the end of the season. Her profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest and also to prepare a trousseau for her daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida S. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 61 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a specialized retail store selling boost food, "longganisa", and "chorizo" (pork sausages) in the local community. Aida is just starting this business and already earned 4,000 PHP. In 2008, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bumu Development Group

texts.en:
A. Rose is a 42-year-old, good natured, suave, and happily-married mother to four high-spirited kids. She belongs to Bumu Development Group in Mukono.

Rose’s track record in the groundnut (peanut) sales business that she oversees, spans a period of over four years. With persistence and hard work, her business has seen the light of day up to now, notwithstanding the financial adversity that has plagued it. With this loan, she is hoping to improve on her only dependable source of livelihood.

Rose says she is going to buy more containers for her groundnut paste, processors, and more groundnut paste. This she says will be some kind of rebranding and reinvention for her business. She is hoping this will translate into more sales for her product.

Rose traces the advent of her business journey back to a pig husbandry enterprise that she still runs, though it now plays second fiddle to the aforementioned. In a week, her profits total up to 40,000 shillings.

loans.use: To purchase more containers, processors and groundnut paste

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es: Armanda, de 45 años, vive con Adán, de 48 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos, José de 20 y Jean Carlos de 12 años, juntos habitan en su casa propia en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Posee tres terrenos que son para cultivo, es así que todos los días, Armanda, sale a sembrar arvejas y espinaca; productos que cuida, riega y fertiliza durante tres meses aproximadamente; tiempo suficiente para poder cosecharlos y venderlos en el mercado central de sus localidad. Cuenta que hay temporadas en los cuales la demanda es mayor por ello viaja a la capital para poder ofrecerlos a mayor precio. Desde niña le enseñaron trabajar la tierra y producirla, sabe cuando es temporada de cultivo, cuando venderlas y a que precio; durante todo este tiempo Armanda siempre le disgusto ver como se malograban su producción debido a la constante helada que azota el sur del país.  Ahora ella quiere seguir cosechando,  por ello comprará más terrenos para así expandir la siembra. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece la ayuda que le brinda su banco comunal ya que con ello puede trabajar e invertir más.  Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de  espinaca y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Armanda, age 45, lives with Adán, age 48. They both have 5 children, but only live with 2 of them: Jose, age 20, and Jean Carlos, age 12. They live together in their own home in the Palcamayo village. They own three plots of land for growing crops. Every day, Armanda goes to sow peas and spinach: crops which she cares for, waters and fertilizers for approximately three months. This is sufficient time to harvest them and sell them in the central market of their area. She says that there are seasons when demand is greater, so she travels to the capital to offer them at a better price. From her childhood, she was taught to work the land and make it produce. She knows when it is harvest time, and when to sell and at what price; during all this time Armanda has always been upset to see her crops fail in the constant frost that batters the south of the country. She now wants to continue harvesting, so she will buy more land in order to expand her planting. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the help that her community bank offers her. With this help, she can work and invest more. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Luz Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota;   ella tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda; y tiene 5 hijos,  La socia es cesante del sector educación y ahora en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y pese a que ahora sus hijos ya están todos independientes ella siempre les ayuda económicamente y trabaja de esta forma para sentir que aún está ocupada y a modo de relajarse y conocer amistades y viajar. La socia ahora que es pate del banco comunal saca dinero para invertir en la compra de ropa de la ciudad de Lima y traer a sus amistades ropa para  la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank. The communal bank is located in the San Sebastián district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Carlota is a 56 year old widow with five children.  She is no longer employed in the education sector.  Now she sells clothes in her free time.  She is a very hard-working woman.  Now that her children are all independent, she always helps them economically.  She works this way in order to still feel busy, as a way to relax and make friendships, and to travel.

Now that she is part of the communal bank she will take money out to buy clothes in the city of Lima.  She will bring the clothes back to her friends to sell.  She is requesting the loan to buy clothes.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through these means, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Cette dame a 40 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente en détail  de Bijoux et de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à accra. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 ; sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. Les périodes de fin d’année étant proche, elle voudrait accroître son revenu pour mieux gagner. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pagnes hi-target, 5 pagnes GTP, et des bijoux.
texts.en: This lady is 40 years old and has an income-generating activity selling (on a retail basis) jewelry and "pagnes" (a West African term for very colourful pieces of fabric). She gets her supplies in Accra. She has been carrying out this business since 2004 and her customer base is predominantly feminine. With the end-of-year festivities approaching she would like to increase her income in order to make more profit. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten "hi-target pagnes", five "GTP pagnes" and jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and "pagnes"

loans.name: Maria Aryera

texts.es: La señora Maria Aryera U. T., tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio Veracruz, es una joven casada, que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad el cual uno de ellos cursa el tercer nivel de preescolar, ellos se dedican al negocio del comercio desde hace mas de 3 años el cual ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, ellos a futuro esperan tener los recursos para comprar un tramo en el mercado puesto que el arrendamiento de uno de estos es muy caro, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos tales como ropa y zapatos, que favorezcan a los niveles de ventas y poco  a poco mejorar las condiciones de habitad de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Aryera U. T. is 29 years old and lives in the Veracruz neighbourhood. She is married and has two small children of whom one is in the third year of kindergarten.

For over three years their main source of income has been commercial trade. In the future they hope to have the resources to purchase a booth in the market.

Since leasing one of these is very expensive, they are requesting a loan to purchase a larger inventory of products such as clothing and shoes, that will boost sales levels and gradually improve their family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes para niños como son pelotas, muñecas, robots, carros entre otros y lo vende en forma ambulatoria por las mañanas y por las tardes siendo este el único sustento para su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clotilde belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of  Cusco.  She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 4 children.  Clotilde's daily activities focus on her business, selling toys to children, including balls, dolls, robots, cars, and other things.  She sells them mornings and afternoons as an itinerant peddler.  This is her family's only source of sustenance.

Clotilde is requesting the loan to expand her small business and thus, advance her children.

Clotilde thanks all who in this manner form part of her dream and she promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO SUPPLY HER ITINERANT TOY-SELLING BUSINESS AND THUS, ADVANCE HER CHILDREN

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling retail and at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Josephine faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She hopes to expand and supply 10 bags of charcoal daily in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 40 bags of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 40 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly epenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a stall selling food for the past four years.  Her potential customers neighbours and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to prosper in the future. 

With the Kshsh 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Lola Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora Lola O. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

Doña Lola se encuentra en el crédito 23 que realiza en el banco comunal, tiene un puesto en el mercado en donde se dedica a la venta de almuerzos, esta labor la realiza hace 28 años, trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes.
 
La Señora. Lola tiene 72 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora ya que es madre soltera de 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para prepara sus almuerzos. Su sueño es conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Lola O. is a member of the community bank "April 12", she lives in the city of Cuenca, this city is known for its natural beauty, it's historic downtown was named Cultural Heritage of Humanity on December of 1999, its people continue to keep its traditions and culture.

Lola is currently on the 23th loan with the community bank, she has a stand in the market where she sells lunches, she has done this for 28 years, starts working at 9 in the morning and finishes at 6 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday.

Lola is 72 years old, she is a hardworking woman, a single mom of five children who are now adults, married and live independently.  She doesn't have a house of her own and lives with a family member.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries to prepare the lunches.  Her wish is to stay healthy to keep working.

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo R. Sr. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 50 years old. Eduardo is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services to local community members. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Eduardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie T. is a hardworking mother and the loving wife of Antonio T.. She is 44 years old, from Fragante, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. She and her husband  have three dependents. Two are at the college level while the other is an elementary graduate. 

Like others, her family has encountered problems brought about by poverty, but fortunately, they have overcome the problems because they really help each other. 

She is thankful to ASHI because she has been able to borrow a certain amount that they used in their business of buying and selling rice.

As of now, her business is improving and they earn from it, which has been a big help for them in sustaining their basic needs. At present, they have already successfully paid their previous loan and they are proposing a new loan of PHP 20,000. This amount will be used as additional capital for her rice business.

From their income, she hopes to repair their house so that it will be comfortable for them. She wants to extend their store and to have a dryer. Aside from that, she also wishes to expand the business so that they can help the people in the community through providing them a job.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Gangantsetseg

texts.en: Gangantsetseg, 42, is widowed and lives with her daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a house and her daughter attends local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. Gangantsetseg began in the water pipe trading business at a local market in 2004 and has been operating for seven years continuously. She used to operate her business with her husband who passed away in 2008. Now her sister operates one of her stalls for 200,000 MNT monthly. Gangantsesteg's daily net income is 200,000 MNT and she pays 160,000 MNT for monthly rent of the stalls that she operates. She imports water pipes from Erlian, the closest border city of China, and spends 400,000 MNT for transportation fees. Her monthly gross income is between 700,000 to 1,000,000 MNT. Gangantsesteg is a modest and polite person who says, " I try to save money because I want to send my daughter abroad to get a very good education in the future". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import water pipes or other items for her business.

loans.use: To import water pipes or other items for sale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with four children – two had graduated from school while two still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwaka  has been operating a retail shop business for the past six years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, crates of soda, beans and sacks of sugar. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, rice, soda, beans and sugar to resell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia R. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 62 years old. Emilia is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Emilia operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as banana and sweet potatoe cues in the local community. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory and fund working capital. 

Emilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, such as ripe bananas. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a hardworking married man with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to build his own house. For two years, Emmanuel has been in the transportation sector, and he is also a builder. This has facilitated him in taking care of the family. One of his challenges is vehicle breakdown, and his desire is to buy a new motorcycle. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a thirty-three-year-old married man with four children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. He runs the family with the help of his wife who is a teacher. Their goal is to build rental houses. 

For ten years he has been in the transport sector, he started as a hired driver and later bought a taxi. He faces the challenges of a poor road network and high taxes. His dream is to buy a new taxi. Shaban intends to use the loan to service his taxi for efficiency.

loans.use: to service his taxi for efficiency

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina T. is 56, married and has five children. She has been working as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language and literature at the school of Kyzyl-Ozgorush village for the last 32 years. She is known as a very persistent and responsible person.   Unfortunately, wages of teachers are low and do not cover their household expenses. That’s why, in 1999, Irina started her business breeding cattle. She worked hard and today has a farm with one horse, ten cows and five bulls. In 2009, she took her first loan from Bai Tushum. It was repaid in full and without any delays. Now Irina plans to use this loan of 80.000 KGS to purchase milk cows, which will allow her to increase the number of her cattle. With the revenues, she wants to buy a plot of land to construct a barn for her cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que queda ubicado en el mercado de Anta y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz y luego lo vende  en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar la tierra de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideos y comprar fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 50, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.  

She has a spouse and alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store located in the Anta market.   She also has a field where she grows potatoes and corn to later sell in the various markets in Anta District.  She supports her children through these businesses.

She wants to enlarge the grocery sales business and improve her farmland.  She is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, oil and noodles and also to buy fertilizer for her field.

She is happy with the loan and committed to repay.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, oil and noodles and to buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 25  años de edad, él es casado y tiene un hijo, con el cual vive en una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, cuenta solo con el servicio de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

Enrique se dedica desde hace 3 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado ovejas, los cuales alimentan con comida balanceada, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, y conoce muy bien el desarrollo de esta actividad.

Enrique solicita el está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de más ovejas y su respectivo alimento balanceado con la finalidad de poder ampliar su negocio y vender sus animales en diferentes localidades.

Enrique cuenta con muy buenas referencias, las personas de su comunidad le tienen mucho cariño por que siempre a demostrado su buena voluntad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Enrique tiene 25  años de edad, él es casado y tiene un hijo, con el cual vive en una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, cuenta solo con el servicio de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.

Enrique se dedica desde hace 3 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado ovejas, los cuales alimentan con comida balanceada, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, y conoce muy bien el desarrollo de esta actividad.

Enrique solicita el está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de más ovejas y su respectivo alimento balanceado con la finalidad de poder ampliar su negocio y vender sus animales en diferentes localidades.

Enrique cuenta con muy buenas referencias, las personas de su comunidad le tienen mucho cariño por que siempre a demostrado su buena voluntad y responsabilidad.

loans.use: Invertir en la compra de ovejas y su  respectivo alimento.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 35 años de edad, el es casado. cuenta con casa propia,  la cual está ubicada en la campiña Solecape , es un sector rural del distrito de Mochumi.

Julio  se dedica a la  comercialización de animales, entre ellos tenemos principalmente ganado caprino (cabritos), entre otros  los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio. Julio  se dedica a esta labor desde hace 5 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.

Julio desea comprar más animales con sus respectivos alimentos, pues para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida, con esta seguridad de querer ampliar sus negocio, Julio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr dichos objetivos.

Julio es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, y en todo momento a demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad,  Julio también cuenta con buenas referencia por parte de las personas que lo conocen, lo describen como una persona tranquila y honesta.
texts.en:
Julio is 35 years old, married and has a house of his own located in Solecape, a rural sector of Mochumí District.

Julio is an animal merchant, mainly little goats, among others which he raises in his back yard and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to dealers who always frequent the zone where he lives.  He works from home.  Julio’s been in this line of work for 5 years which is to say he knows it to perfection.

Julio wants to buy more animals with their respective feed because in this zone he does not have any competition in this line of work and he has an established clientele.  With this safety net in place he wants to expand his business.  Julio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to reach said objectives.

Julio is a longstanding client of Edpyme Alternativa and has shown responsibility and punctuality at all times.  Julio also has good references from people who know him; they describe him as a calm, honest person.

loans.use: to buy more animals with their respective feed.

loans.name: Marigee Group

texts.en:
Marigee is single, 32 years old, and lives in the Philippines.  Marigee is a farmer and raises cow and goats to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan to purchase two cows and one goat. 

Marigee has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. Marigee is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and one goat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, detergent, candies etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, detergent, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is 55, married and has three children. She works as an English language teacher at the school in Tokmok and is known as an accurate and open-hearted teacher. Her husband, Turatbek, also works as a teacher in mathematics. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Gulsara began to develop her business in cattle breeding in 1995. She bought milk cows with her start-up capital of 20.000 KGS and managed to earn about 20,000 KGS in a month from selling milk products.

Gulsara plans to use her loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her business by buying two milk cows. With the revenues from these investments, she will be able to help her son to reconstruct his house and raise her family's living standards. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulnura's Group

texts.en:
Gulnura, 32, is the leader of this group. She is married and has seven young children. The couple is blessed to have a stable financial position and is happy to bring up their children, four of whom are adopted. She and her husband consider this to be the main accomplishment of life. For the past three years, Gulnura has been helping her husband with technical and repair services for their automobile shop. Gulnura’s job responsibilities include repairing car parts and toning windows. The family’s monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

Gulnura is requesting a loan to open a car-repair center. She hopes the financial assistance of Kiva lenders will help her family accomplish their goal.


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to open a car-repair center

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 16 year old son. Natalya sells men’s and women’s clothing in the central market of Melitopol city. She has 10 years experience in this business. Her vending location is well equipped and clients like Natalya’s style of service and reasonable prices.
 
Natalya wants to increase the assortment of her stock for the coming fall season so, she has requested a loan of 20,000 UAH. With this additional merchandise, she hopes to generate extra profits and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stock range for the coming fall season

loans.name: Forjando Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Forjando Futuro” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran L. artesanía, L. venta D. ropa, venta D. joyas y venta D. abarrotes en un alM.én. Todos ellos pertenecientes a L. ciudad D. Temuco.
Carolina integrante del Banco comunal quien en L. foto se encuentra sentada en primera fiL., ocupando el primer puesto D. derecha a izquierda, viste con ropa oscura y su cabello está suelto y es D. color castaño oscuro. 
ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropa nueva desD. hace un año, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta y también desD. su casa. Generalmente su horario es D. lunes a viernes durante las tardes. Carolina brinda facilidades D. pago a sus clientes, lo que ha facilitado sus ventas y acrecentar el número D. clienteL.. Su mercadería L. compra usualmente en L. ciudad D. Santiago. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido D. venta D. ropa, en el cual también pueda incorporar L. venta D. juguetes. 
Con el crédito comprará chalecos, polerones, poleras, todo D. acuerdo a L. temporada. 
Carolina vive junto a su marido y su hija D. dos años D. edad. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y un mejor bienestar. 
ElL. está muy contenta y agradecida D. los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda compartiendo con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que son muy comprometidos, responsables y agradables. Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas L. han ayudado a administrar D. mejor manera su negocio.
Temuco es L. capital D. L. región D. L. Araucanía. L. ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur D. Santiago (capital D. Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie D. balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% D. los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Forjando Futuro" ("Shaping the Future").  It is maD. up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields.  Among them are handicrafts, clothing sales, jewelry sales, and grocery sales in a store.  All the entrepreneurs live in the city of Temuco.

Carolina is a member of the Communal Bank, who is seated in the front row of the photo, first person to the right.  She is wearing dark clothes, and her dark brown hair is down.

She has been working selling new clothes for the last year.  She makes her sales by going door to door, and also out of her home.  Generally, her schedule is to work Mondays to Fridays in the afternoons.  Carolina offers payment facilities to her customers, which has maD. her sales easier and gained her a number of customers.  She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago.

Her goals for her business are to have established premises selling clothing, where she can also incluD. toys for sale.  With the loan she will buy vests, sweatshirts, and shirts, according to the season.

Carolina lives with her husband and her two-year-old daughter.  Her dreams are to continue working to be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of live and improved well-being.

She is very happy and grateful for the loans and for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza.  She also feels very comfortable participating in the Communal Bank group, as they are very committed, responsible and nice people.  In regard to the trainings, these have helped her to manager her business in a better way.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There is a string of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) in the surrounding area, and striking native flora and fauna are concentrated in the national parks nearby.  It is worth nothing that 50% of the Mapuches, the indigenous people from our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy vests, sweatshirts, and shirts, according to the season.

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny Luz nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo  y tiene 25 años de edad, ella es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. 
Actualmente, Fanny Luz vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de platería artesanal, ella tiene un pequeño local alquilado donde se vende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Fanny Luz requiere el préstamo para comprar más joyas. El sueño de Fanny Luz es abrir una agencia de viajes. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Fanny Luz was born in the city of Paucartambo and is 25 years old. She is single and does not yet have children.

Currently, Fanny Luz lives and works in her native city. She sells handcrafted silver jewelry. She has a small rented shop where she sells her products. She has been involved in this business for several years already, and it is going very well for her.

At this time, Fanny Luz needs the loan to buy more jewelry. Her dream is to open a travel agency.

The "Comuzone I" communal bank meets every month in Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, as well as for having one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is aged 45 and married with three children in school, aged 17, 13 and 10. He has been in mixed farming for 10 years and currently employs two farmhands. His farm produces tomatoes, cabbages, maize, milk and eggs, which all go to the local market.

Daniel has requested a loan of 47,250 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will help improve his income and enable him to improve his family's living standards, educate the children and expand his crop farming.

He laments the low market prices for farm products but commends Juhudi Kilimo for being reliable.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Confidence

texts.fr:
Confidence est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Confidence fait le commerce de friperie depuis 2008. Il vend à tout le monde dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Il achète ses produits au Port autonome de Lomé. 
Confidence a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des bal des fripperie.
Dans les prochaines années, Confidence voudrait construire sa propre boutique et exploiter convenablement son activité.
texts.en:
Confidence is a 30-year-old single man.

Confidence has been selling second-hand clothes since 2008.  He sells his products to the general public in Hédzranawoé market.  He buys his products in the Port of Lomé.

Confidence has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy bundles of second-hand clothes.

In the coming years, Confidence would like to build his own store and run his business well.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Annointed Group

texts.en:
Kaitano is 33 years old and lives in the Midlands province of Zimbabwe. He is married and has one child aged 1. 

Kaitano has been in the poultry business for three years. His challenges are the scarcity of feeds and a lack of funds to buy stock in bulk when they are available.

He has applied for US$400 to buy feeds and chicks. With the additional income obtained from his business, Kaitano will pay school fees for his three brothers he is looking after.

Kaitano plans to own a farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Iye Bah

texts.en:
Iye is 33 years old and is married to a business man. She has two school-going children, ages six and three. She also has two additional dependents, her sister's children, who live with her in order to attend school in the city, as their parents live in the village where the school standard is low.  

In 2000, Iye established her imported foodstuff business. She began this business because she could not further her schooling, as she was not bright in school and her parents felt that it was a waste of their resources. She got married as a teenager. 

Iye had helped her husband to manage the business for a year when he thought of her starting her own business. He provided the initial capital of SLL 1,500,000 to start.  This business is special to her because she is able to prove herself that she can be what she wants to be in life. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from the business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Iye has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires this new loan in order to purchase 3 cartons of Bama mayonnaise, 5 cartons of Maggie seasonings, 10 bags of onions, 10 cartons of popcorn, and 10 cartons of Gino spaghetti. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Iye plans to build a house.  This loan will improve her business because she wants to open another outlet, which she is currently working on. She wants her children to obtain a good education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, seasonings, onions, popcorn, and spaghetti.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard, her elder son helps in her business, her middle son is a college student and the youngest one is a school student. 

She started her grocery trading business in 2007 by renting a counter in market. Now her product range has been extended and her income has increased. However, due to her son's college fee, she hasn't got sufficient funds to run the business. 

She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "I will do everything I can to get my children educated." 

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more candy and seasoning to resell.

loans.use: To buy candy and seasoning.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 43 year old married woman. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband works as a carpenter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phung has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Phung has been in business for five years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El señor Teófilo tiene 51 años, nació en Bolivar – Cochabamba, hace  31 años que llegó al Trópico en busca de un mejor futuro, actualmente vive en la provincia Carrasco, Municipio Puerto Villarroel.

Es padre soltero, hace 6 años es separado de su esposa y tiene 3 hijos varones  2 están bajo su responsabilidad a los cuales educa y apoya en su educación, es una persona responsable, con muchas ganas de superación.

Como agricultor y especialista en el cultivo de piña lleva 27 años, cuenta con 3 hectáreas de este cultivo, su parcela está a una distancia de 5 kilómetros de su casa, el camino es ripiado y tiene quebradas, para llegar debe hacerlo caminando o en bicicleta, ahora quiere comprarse una motocicleta para facilitar el transporte  es por este motivo que solicita que se le haga un préstamo en nuestra Institución, este motorizado le ayudara a ganar tiempo para poder desarrollar sus actividades mas temprano.
texts.en:
Señor Teófilo is 51 years old. He was born in Bolivar, Cochabamba. Thirty-one years ago he arrived in Trópico in search of a better future. He now lives in the province of Carrasco, in the town of Puerto Villarroel.

He is a single father. He separated from his wife 6 years ago. He has three sons. Two are in his care, and he is educating them and supporting their education. He is a responsible person with much will to achieve.

He has 27 years of experience as a farmer and a specialist in the cultivation of pineapples. He has three hectares in this crop. His parcel of land is located at a distance of 5 kilometers from his house. The road is bumpy and broken. To get there he must walk or use a bicycle. Now he wants to buy a motorcycle to make his transportation easier, and this is why he is applying for a loan at our institution. This motorized transport will help him save time so that he can begin his work earlier.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle to transport him to his fields.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They both work really hard to have a decent living, despite all the difficulties that they face. 

In 2000, Antoinette opened her own clothing shop. She sells good quality products at fair prices. As for her husband, he has been serving in the Lebanese army for the past five years. 

Today she’s asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional clothes for her shop so that she can earn a bigger income. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding new items to it.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Rejuntadas Group

texts.es:
Rejuntadas es el grupo formado por 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, quienes trabajan muy a gusto dentro del octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con las ganas de progresar y salir adelante, y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias, son mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Una de ellas es la señora Liz, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual se dedica a la costura desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Comenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, por lo cual no se queja, ya que ese es su medio de mantener a su familia. Ella desea poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Quiere comprar telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos necesarios para su taller. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rejuntadas" is comprised of 17 women from the city of Paraguarí.  They are doing very well in their eighth cycle of the women entrepreneur program at the Fundación Paraguaya.  Being very hard workers, they formed the group because of their desire to get ahead and become successful so they could help their respective families.

One of them is Mrs. Liz who is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in the sewing business for quite some time.  She says she always has a lot of work and cannot complain since this allows her to support her family.  With an aim toward filling customer orders she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other necessary supplies for her workshop.  She is grateful to the Fundación and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Camale

texts.en:
Camale is 31-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and their three children, for whom she works every day so that they can fulfill their goals in life.

Camale has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last five years. This loan will allow her to buy more animals, which she will raise and sell in the market. Camale requested 1,000 AZN and this is her first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, aged 57, lives in Masindi Uganda and has a dream of setting up a number of income-generating activities that are sustainable. He is a livestock farmer and his desire is to diversify his business by acquiring more land to grow crops & expand into new markets. Stephen intends to buy a lawn mower for cutting grass in a bid to diversify his income sources.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower for cutting grass.

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Yelen est un groupe de l’association Benkadi de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habits et de la restauration à l’image de Fanta qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Fanta, excelle dans la préparation et vente de nourritures. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelque sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d’ingrédients pour la restauration

loans.name: Younousse

texts.en:
This is a group loan which will be shared by the fifteen members of the Deggoo association in the village of Oussouye in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. The group describes their business plan as follows:

“The Deggoo group is an association of the youth of the Escale neighborhood of Oussouye, who have initiated this project in order to combat unemployment, migration from rural areas, the loss of security for young women and juvenile delinquency. The purpose of the loan is to provide all the traditional furniture craftsmen of the area with wood, as well as the producers of wooden pirogue boats for fishing on the high sea. We will go out and buy boards from the various sawmills of the region in order to meet the demand for wood, which far exceeds the supply in our area. We will set up a building to serve as a storeroom; in this way, therefore, we will start up and manage our wood-selling business.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Le groupement Deggoo est une association de jeunes du quartier Escale à Oussouye qui à initié ce projet pour lutter contre le chômage, l’exode rural, la déperdition des filles et la délinquance juvénile

Objectifs du Prêt : De pouvoir ravitailler tous les menuisiers du département en bois et lutter contre le chômage, l’exode rural, la déperdition des filles et la délinquance juvénile aussi les constructeurs de pirogues pour la pêche en haute mer.

Activités : Nous irons achetés des planche dans les différentes scieries de la région afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande qui est très supérieur l’offre dans le département. Nous aménagerons un local qui nous servira de magasin de stock ; ainsi donc, nous mènerons nos activités commerciales de vente de planche. »

Background :

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of wood from sawmills; equipping a storage facility; transportation of the wood to furniture craftsmen and shipbuilders

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat has over 8 years of experience in her business. She works at central open-air market. She lives in the same house with her family, parents-in-law and brother-in law. Muhabbat has three children. They all go to secondary school. Her husband is a worker in an aluminum plant. Her dream is for her older son to get a University degree and become an engineer in the aluminum plant and for her daughter to be an interpreter. So she tries her best to support them  to get high quality educations. Her current request is for purchasing new season goods from the wholesale market. She makes a trip to this market twice a week. If she had more money she would buy goods in a bigger volume and wouldn't have to make these trips so often. Even though the wholesale market is not far away Muhabbat still has high transportation expenses.

loans.use: Purchase spring season clothes

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie sells cooked rice local dishes outside her home in Makeni. She buys the ingredients on a daily basis and pays a retail based price. With the loans funds she will buy rice and other select ingredients in larger quanities wholesale, saving her money and time which will increase her profit. Her husband is a mechanic but is currently unemployed. They have 8 children to support and strive very hard to keep the children's school expenses paid.

loans.use: Purchase stock of ingredients for kiosk restaurant

loans.name: Mayda Elisa

texts.es:
Mayda is a very enterprising person. She is single and she started her business to be able to support herself and get ahead in life. She began to sell cosmetics, since it was what she knew how to do, and over time she has increased her number of clients via recommendations from her first clients, who were her family members and friends. She hopes to continue growing her business and improve it.

Maya is requesting a loan of $475.00 to acquire more products and cover the orders she already has from her clients. She offers to repay the loan in 6 months and she is very thankful for your support of the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayda es una mujer muy emprendedora, es soltera e inició su negocio para poder mantenerse y salir adelante en la vida, se dedicó a la venta de cosméticos ya que era lo que ella sabía hacer y con el tiempo ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes por recomendaciones de sus primeros clientes quienes fueron sus familiares y amistades. Ella tiene el deseo de continuar creciendo y mejorar con su negocio.

Mayda está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para adquirir más productos y cubrir sus pedidos que ya tiene de sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y te agradece mucho tu apoyo para su crecimiento con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics merchandise

loans.name: Alo

texts.en: Alo V. is middle aged and works very hard to show off her talent of how to take good care of pigs for her family's living.  She is thirty-six years of age and lives with her husband and kids, and they run their small business to help out their family financially.  All of her four children are attending school. She will use her loan to buy materials to start off her business.  It is her dream come true for her and her family. She really appreciates the help from S.P.B.D for lending her the money so that she can manage to start her business.  Her husband is the key man for their business, and together they will meet their family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her sty

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Mr. Luis Arturo Dejesus G. is 28 years old, he is still currently single and lives with his parents in San Ignacio, Paraguay. For the last seven years, Luis has run an auto repair business out of his parents' home. He began learning auto repair by helping in a variety of shops in his hometown. By working in these shops he obtained all the necessary tools and knowledge to start his own business. Now, he has established a number of regular clients who know he can be relied on to provide knowledgeable service at a good price.

The credit Luis has requested will go toward purchasing an air compressor for his shop. The compressor he had had previously broke down and has made his daily workload considerably more difficult. The lack of a compressor limits the number of clients he is able to assist. The acquisition of a new compressor will allow Luis to continue with his work and augment the income of his family.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her store.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng J., 33, a mother of 2 daughters, sells clothes on credit door-to-door, earning US$80 a month.  Her husband, Sukarman, does not work anymore, so she is the only source of income in the family. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$75 to buy more clothes so she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Meak

texts.en:
Mrs. Meak P., 44, works on her piece of land breeding pigs and typically makes about three dollars each day. Her husband is currently employed by a private company as a truck driver also earning about three dollars per day. They have three school age children. One child is employed at a nearby hospital as a surgeon.

Mrs. P. has requested a loan amount of $1200 to purchase surgical tools for her son to improve his ability to perform his job at the hospital.

loans.use: The purchase of surgical tools for a son to improve his work abilities at a nearby hospital.

loans.name: Froylan

texts.es:
Froylan Alexander is 25-years-old and since quite some time, he sales groceries at the Campo Verde market. He is the father of Catherine, a three year old girl, who is Froylan’s reason to succeed in life. His life partner Esther, works with him. They wish to provide all the necessary resources for their daughter in order to assure her full development. Froylan and his wife would like to expand their business and therefore their profits. This is the reason why Froylan is requesting a loan; to invest on remodeling his working space and to purchase a greater quantity of basic consumer products.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Froylan Alexander de 25 años de edad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo en un puesto del mercado de Campo Verde, es padre de 01 hija de nombre Catherine de 03 añitos de edad la cual es su razón de progreso, su conviviente la señora Esther trabaja junto a él.Las aspiraciones que tiene para su pequeña hija son brindarle los recursos necesarios para su pleno desarrollo. Desea incrementar sus instalaciones y las ganancias de su establecimiento, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la remodelación de su espacio de trabajo y la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.use: Start up a Business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng K. is 32 years old and has two children. At her home, she works hard raising pigs and cows as livestock. Her husband works as the village doctor. They each make about $5 a day. Beside his work as a doctor, her husband also owns a plot of farmland on which he grows vegetables. Mrs. Heng hopes to use her loan to buy a grinding mill for the village and to hire the workers needed to run it. This additional business could free her from the economic vulnerability of raising livestock and generate greater income for her family.  (Picture: her husband)

loans.use: To buy a grinding mill.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
The years of work that Yovana has put in have helped her to adapt and to successfully launch her business. She makes delicious juices at a stand in the market near the center of the city and from this location serves her entire community. The good service that she provides has enabled her to increase her customers that enjoy her delicious juices. For this reason she is now thinking of improving her sales stand and is placing her request for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Los años de trabajo de Yovana la han ayudado a adaptarse y emprender un negocio con éxito. Se dedica a preparar exquisitos jugos en un puesto dentro del mercado cerca de la zona central de la ciudad y desde aquí presta sus servicios a su comunidad entera; la buena atención que brinda le ha permitido incrementar su clientela que disfruta de sus deliciosos jugos es por ello que ahora está pensando en implementar su puesto de ventas y a esta razón atiende su solicitud.

loans.use: Improve her small sales stand.

loans.name: Wilmer Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Wilmer M. Gutiérrez and his wife (Ina Ticona Yanque) rent in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz.

Wilmer works in a paint store in the city and his wife is a domestic employee in the Sopocachi area. Wilmer is in his second year studying general accounting at the Atenea Institute, thanks to a previously granted loan from IMPRO.

The current loan will be used to pay the 2008 education expenses at the Atenea Institute.

As this is the second time that he is seeking a loan with us, we can confirm that Wilmer’s application is satisfactory and approved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Wilmer M. Gutiérrez y su esposa (Ina Ticona Yanque) viven en anticrético(una especie de arriendo/alquiler que se da en Bolivia) en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Wilmer trabaja en una tienda de pinturas de la ciudad y su esposa es empleada domestica en la zona de Sopocachi. Asimismo, el cliente cursa el segundo año de la carrera de contaduría general en el Instituto Atenea, gracias a un crédito otorgado anteriormente por IMPRO.

El crédito actual tiene el propósito de cancelar las pensiones de la gestión 2008 en el mencionado instituto.

Siendo esta la segunda vez que solicita un crédito con nosotros, confirmamos satisfactoriamente la solicitud de Wilmer.

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Onosai

texts.en: Onosai M., 70, is married with 10 children. She has 5 years of experience in the General Store business. She sells to the village people and public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans)with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~291 USD). SPBD loans are Onosai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to maintain the shop improvement. He husband has always been a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To fund items and products needed for replacement.

loans.name: Ndeshifose

texts.en:
Ndeshifose is married with a two year old child. She sells soap. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Ndeshifose now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Filadelfo José

texts.es:
Filadelfo, 43, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. He has two children, 7 and 14, who are both in school. He has worked two years as a driver for a private company. He has had a difficult time building his house because his income is so low. His wife, consequently, is working as a maid for another family so that she can help her husband and together they can apply for a loan. With the requested loan, they will build a wall, 12 meters along the outside and 5 meters along the house. For this, they will buy stone, cement, sand and iron bar. Filadelfo and his wife hope that with both of them now working, they can improve their house and provide the life that their family deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Filadelfo tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah. Tiene dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad, que están en el colegio. Trabaja como conductor, tiene dos años de estar laborando en una empresa privada, ha tenido muchas dificultades para construir su casa debido a los bajos ingresos que tiene, es por esa razón que su esposa está trabajando en una casa particular de servicios domésticos, para poder apoyar a su esposo, y juntos poder optar a un crédito. Con el préstamo solicitado construirá 12 mts lineales de muro y 5 mts de pared. Para esto se va a comprar piedra, cemento, arena y hierro. Esperan que ahora que ambos están trabajando puedan mejorar su casa y optar a una vida más digna para su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall around house.

loans.name: Alesi

texts.en: Alesi T., 40, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the retail shop business. She sells to the general public and villagers 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Alesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for renovating her house. Alesi's husband is a carpenter, and he will be renovating their place.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar and salt, boxes of lamp flaps, boxes of chicken, etc., to sell, plus home repair supplies.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Mrs. Bich P. is a villager in Kraing Krachang village in Takeo province. She weaves silk for a living. She now has a lot of customers in this business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave to meet her customers’ demand. Mrs. Bich P. is 55 years old and the mother of an 18-year-old child who helps her in the business.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Якубов Акбар житель житель района Рудаки. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 31 год. Уже 8 лет занимается бизнесом. Разным бизнесом он занимался все это время, но уже 2 года торгует мукой. Товар привозит из Казахстана. Бизнес прибыльный . Кроме того торговая точка , где он торгует находится в их кишлаке и население покупает муку прямо у него в магазине , не выезжая в город. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Akbar Y. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has two children. Akbar is 31 years old. He has been in business for 8 years. During this time he has had several businesses, but he has been selling flour for 2 years. Akbar brings his products in from Kazakhstan. The business is profitable. In addition, the sales location where he sells his products is located in a village and the residents can purchase flour at his store without having to travel to the city. Akbar would like to take out a loan to increase his inventory. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Ghulam Fatima and I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. My husband's name is M. who is a fruit seller with 15 years of experience. He collects fruit from fruit markets and sells it by bicycle in public places and earns a profit. I am a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. My elder son is a carpenter and my younger son runs a grocery shop. My elder daughter reads in 5th standard and my younger daughter reads in 2nd standard. I keep myself busy sewing clothes. This work provides me with two benefits: first it helps me to earn income and second it keeps me busy. I save my income to pay the school fees of my daughters. My husband and my sons bear the house expenses. I successfully repaid my first loan which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan again to buy groceries to expand my younger son’s grocery shop. 

I am a group leader of a few more women in my locality. Safia baji wants a loan to buy tea to resell. Sagheeran baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Parveen akhtar baji and Naheed akhtar baji each want a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando Ramírez M.  es una persona que piensa en su hija el cual esta preocupado por su estado de salud el la ha llevado con un ortopedista. El cual  ha pedido que le compre unos zapatos de acuerdo  a su problema el cual no cuenta con dinero para pagar al contado. La cantidad que solicita es de $3,000
Su esposa trabaja en una constructora donde se dedica a  vender casas y Fernando trabaja para una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Fernando Ramírez M. is a person who thinks about his daughter and, concerned about her health, took her to an orthopedist. The orthopedist asked that he buy some shoes to take care of her problem, but he does not have the money to pay for them. He is requesting 3,000 pesos. His wife works for a builder who sells houses and Fernando works in a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy orthopedic shoes.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bahati H. from Mwanza. She is single with one 5-year-old child. Bahati has been running a clothing business since 2008. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week. Bahati currently earns about $150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase "vitenge" (African traditional clothing), bed sheets, and trousers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Bahati thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge (African traditional clothing), bed sheets and trousers.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Шоев Сафар житель города Нурек. Возраст 38 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет столовую . РАботает уже около пяти лет. Для того, чтобы улучшить качество обслуживантя и качество предлагаемых блюд, он планирует закупить новый инвентарь. Для этого он решил получить кредит и купить новую посуду. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safar S. lives in Nurek. He is 38 years old and is married with four children. For the past five years he has been working in a canteen. In order to improve the quality of services and food, Safar would like to purchase new inventory. He is applying for a loan that would allow him to buy new dishware. Safar would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is 32 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have two sons, both of whom are in basic school. The family live in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Comfort trades in food stuffs, such as cassava, and has been in business for three years. She buys cassava from farmers in nearby villages and sells it in the local market square. Her customers are mostly food vendors and retailers. Comfort wants a loan to procure cassava in bulk so that she can supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure cassava in bulk

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda S. is 38 years old. She is married with three children, one in senior high, one in junior high and the youngest in primary school. Matilda lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Matilda is a hard-working woman. She is a trader in cosmetics. She buys cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc. and sells them on a table top in the community market. Matilda also treks to other markets to sell on their market days.
