She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy varieties of cosmetics in bulk. Matilda hopes to give her children the best education she can afford and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell at the markets.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
In order to support her family with their necessities, Ester is doing her best in managing her vending business. She sells different vegetables, fruits and some snacks. She started this business in 1998 and it has been very helpful to her family. Her dream is to make her business grow for better profits. For this, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos to buy additional products that she can sell. She believes that her dreams of having a successful business and of her children finishing their studies will become reality.

Ester N. is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She has also been one of the village councilors for two years. Her income from the business will be of great help in paying for her children's education.

loans.use: Food for resale

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara S. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of four children who are currently in school.

She is a retailer of charcoal in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Ajara obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails it to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more supply of charcoal to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called “Nyame be Kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and supply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Очилова Рохат, женщина которая занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сама она работает кондитером в кондитерском цехе. Но кроме этого она каждый воскресный базар вместе с мужем выходит на рынок скота и занимается бизнесом купли и продажи мелкорогатого скота. Рохат уже третий год кредитуется в Фонде и благодарна инвесторам за предоставившую возможность иметь дополнительный доход с бизнеса животноводства. На снимке Рохат у кассы в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Rohat O. is a woman who works buying and selling livestock. She works as a confectioner in a confectionery shop. But each Sunday she and her husband go to the livestock market to buy and sell sheep and goats. This is the third year Rohat has financed her business, and she is grateful to investors for giving her the opportunity to create additional income from animal husbandry. In the picture, Rohat is at the cashier's desk for her loan dispensation.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling livestock

loans.name: Irenita

texts.en:
Irenita E. is from the village of Santo Filomena in Iligan City. Irenita is a 44-year-old, married woman with seven school-age children. To make a living, Irenita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; specifically, she sells home products. Irenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities (primarily from selling personal home products on a consignment basis to local community members).

In 2009, Irenita joined HSPFI in order to gain much-needed access to financial services and, in turn, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan is the first loan she is seeking via HSPFI. Indeed, Irenita is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its purpose is to provide financial assistance to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Khursiyat

texts.en:
K. Khursiyat is the humble mother of a family with two children and she works hard to educate them. She has worked in agriculture, along with her husband, for 18 years, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at growing potatoes, carrots and other vegetables, which they sell in the market. Last season was very good, and after much effort, they achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the crop they had worked so hard on.

Currently Khursiyat’s family has a financial problem and she needs the help of all of us. The family’s desire is to continue planting their crop and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose, Khursiyat and her family are requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto F. is a rice farmer. He is 56 years old and has three children. As a father, he wants to provide for them, all their needs and give them a high quality life.

He is requesting a loan of php 6,000 to purchase four sacks of fertilizer and four sacks of Urea. Profits will help him pay for their home.

Now, he actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. He avails various CEVI services like loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and Urea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Dan

texts.es: Dan tiene 36 años, vive junto a su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años y es estudiante. Viven en la casa de sus suegros. Dan es muy emprendedor y polifacético laboralmente. Anteriormente contaba con 12 computadoras con las que brindaba el servicio de Internet en su casa. Sin embargo, por no ser compatibles a la nueva tecnología, tuvo que venderlas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de un carro, con el cual ahora brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Por otro lado, su necesidad de sentirse ocupado lo llevó también a vender líneas de teléfono, celulares y tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace 6 meses y no le es tan difícil vender estos artículos, pues sus principales clientes son sus pasajeros. A Dan le gusta su trabajo porque se mantiene ocupado y trabaja tranquilo, además está satisfecho que son negocios propios y no depende de nadie. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son responsables en sus pagos y muy unidos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará algunos repuestos para mandar a reparar su automóvil.

loans.use: Reparación de su auto

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the M. borrower group in Ilala, She is 46 year old woman, she is widowed and a mother of 5 children. Her children are 29, 25, 18, 15, and 10 years old.

Maria has owned a food business selling chicken with potatoes for 12 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180, 000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maria`s second loan from  BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes and chicken for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save more money an expand her business.

loans.use: To by more potatoes and chicken

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 01 hijo, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ropa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa interior, y ropa de abrigo casacas. Para comercializarlos en la feria de semanal de Yunguyo.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda grande de venta de ropa.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones, la puntualidad y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa interior, y ropa de abrigo casacas

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita B. is from Sinayawan in Valencia City. She is 39 years old. Rosalita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rosalita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo (Filomeno), de 60 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Ricardo de 28, Rubén de 25, Katherine de 18 y Antony de 15 años.

Ella es una mujer muy amable y carismática que se ha venido dedicando desde hace 6 años a la atención de su tienda. Cuenta su esposo, que comenzaron con un pequeño kiosco con muy poca cantidad de productos y poco a poco lograron mejorar y habilitar su casa para poner una pequeña bodega. 
Hoy en día este negocio es la primera fuente de ingresos de su familia, dándole ciertas facilidades para mantener a sus hijos menores, pues los mayores ya trabajan. Viviana se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias a su negocio puede mantenerse al lado de su esposo, quien la ayuda en la atención y al lado de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro quiere mejorar e implementar mejor su negocio para que arroje mayores ganancias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y espera que todo su grupo sea tan responsable como ella para cumplir en los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas y algunos productos comestibles para atraer a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Viviana is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her husband (Filomeno) of 60 years of age and their 4 children: Ricardo 28, Rubén 25, Katherine 18 and Antony 15.

She is a very nice and charismatic woman who since 6 years ago has taken care of her store. She has the support of her husband and when they began their business they had a little kiosk with a very limited quantity of products. Little by little they were able to better and set up their home and to start a small grocery store.

To this day the business remains the main source of income for the family especially to the younger children since the older ones work. Viviana is very happy because thanks to her business she can be with her husband who helps her with the responsibilities at home and work and they are able to be close to their children.

For the future she wants to improve her business and have greater earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and hopes that all of her group will be as responsible as her in their payments. With the money loaned, she will buy more drinks and groceries to attract a greater number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her genge business.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
el sr. RAUL ALBERTO G.,  Es comerciante, su actividad principal es la venta de muebles de hierro, electrodomesticos y ropa para cama, este producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante en la ciudad de Danli y comunidades Vecinas,  cuenta con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad
ya que el inicio en este negocio como vendedor de una distribuidora de estos productos y gracias a Dios y al apoyo que se le ha brindado el cuenta con su propio negocio, que le genera ingresos para hacerle frente a los compromisos y gastos de su familia.  es casado y tiene 2 hijos, que estan cursando la educacion primaria. actualmente solicita un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes varidadad de productos tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de navidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Raul Alberto is a businessman. His main business is selling iron furniture, electronic household appliances and bed sheets. He sells these items as a door-to-door salesman in the city of Danli and the neighboring communities. He has a lot of experience in this type of business. He started in this business as a salesperson for a distributor of these products. Thanks to God and with his own business earnings, he has been able to generate enough income to cover his liabilities and family expenses. He is married and has two children. The children are studying in primary school. He is asking for this loan in order to expand his business. In this way he will be able to offer his customers a greater variety of products since the Christmas season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron furniture for living rooms, kitchens and bath rooms. To buy bed sheets and household electronics.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Anibal es casado, con 4 hijos, uno de con mayoría de edad. La familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad Mayor Martinez, dentro del distrito de Tres Coronas. 
Dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar; en el mismo domicilio posee un local comercial, donde se comercializa, artículos de primera necesidad, ramos generales, etc.
Además de la actividad de la actividad comercial la pareja dedica a la producción de queso vacunos, que  posteriormente comercializa en la capital departamental. Esta en esta actividad llevan más de 10 años, posee todas las infraestructuras necesarias para el desarrollo de su actividad. 
Mediante la ayuda crediticia y asistencial  técnica de la Fundación Paraguaya logró mejores rendimientos en su tarea ya que siempre les brindamos nuestros buenos beneficios la cual le da un alto rendimiento en su comercio. En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para comprar insumos  para para su negocio, yaque tiene pedidos por las fiestas que se aproximan aumentaron.-
texts.en:
Anibal is married and has 4 children, of whom one is now an adult. The family lives in a house they own in the Mayor Martinez locality, within the Tres Coronas District. Said residence has all the comforts of a home; he also has his business, a general store where he sells basic daily necessities, in his home. In addition to the store, this couple dedicates itself to making cheese that they then sell in the city. They have been in business for more than 10 years, and have the necessary infrastructure in place to carry out their activities. Through the financial assistance and technical support from Fundación Paraguaya, he managed to improve his business’ performance. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business as he has orders for the approaching holiday season’s festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and general necessities for his business such as sugar, flour, rice, noodles, cooking oils, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Maria es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, artículos de librería, además vende cosméticos por catálogos, y en época escolar vende útiles escolares en el mercado.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cerveza y cosméticos.
Los sueños de Maria son hacer crecer su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) community bank. Maria is single. She is 38 years old and has 2 children. Maria has a store in her house where she sells general groceries and stationery items; in addition, she sells cosmetics through catalogs, and during the school season, she sells school supplies in the market.

Maria needs a loan of 1200 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, beer, and cosmetics. Maria's dreams are to increase her business and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beer, and cosmetics

loans.name: Timothy Odhiambo

texts.en:
Timothy O. is a tailor in the Gudcar area of Kisumu. He is married to Mercy Odhiambo and they have five children. Timothy has been a tailor for the last 16 years and has created a huge clientele because he looks for the latest designs. This makes him beat his competitors.

Timothy is looking for a loan through Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more sewing machines as well as to employ more people in the business to help with the increasing demand for clothes. He also hopes to use the money to buy material for school uniforms since they are in high demand when schools reopen in the month of January.

His future plans and hopes are to expand his business and become the prime supplier of school uniforms in the entire Kisumu region. His children are in college and high school and he intends to educate them to the university level so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: Mrs. Mi Moung Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan which consists of eight people is located in Srey Snom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mi M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members; all use the loan for different purposes. She is 55 years old and a chicken seller in the local market. She is a widow who has no children and she lives with four siblings, two of whom help with her business. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Mi M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens to re-sell to expand her business and increase the income from it.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to re-sell

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 37-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Hicham has owned a pickup truck, which allows him to transport merchandise since 1992. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his pickup, and to save some money for his children’s expenses. Hicham has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his work, as well as his family’s living conditions. With his previous loans, he was able to pay for his children’s school tuition. Hicham is speciA. in his work because of his punctuality. His clients can be anyone. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and to improve his income.

loans.use: To to do some maintenance work on his pickup.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria, se dedica junto con su esposo al negocio de tapicería pues ambos se han esforzado para lograr las mejoras a su casa como a su taller. Tiene 49 años de edad, tres hijos dos estudiante y el mayor trabaja. Tiene varios años de administrar la tapicería,  ante  trabajaba en zona franca lo cual su esposo trabajaba reparando los muebles. Renuncio a su trabajo y con su liquidación logro invertir en madera para producir más en sus ventas de sillas, sofás, y toda reparación de mueble. Lo difícil que la madera se pone cara, hasta los forros para dicho trabajo el cual tienen que cobrar un costo alto y las ventas bajan un poco. Con el préstamo anterior logro hacer un bajarete en frente de su casa para poder trabajar en mejores condiciones  en su negocio ya que no tiene un local propio. Con este financiamiento lograra cerrar el porche comprara los materiales necesarios como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y cerrar el porche lo cual será un beneficio más para su familia, cómo su negocio que espera poder captar clientes ofreciendo un trabajo de calidad y transporte. Planes a largo plazo es lograr hacer un local solo para su trabajo que espera hacer con el financiamiento de estos préstamos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, together with her husband, dedicates herself to the business of furniture upholstery. Both have worked hard to make improvements to their home and workshop. She is 49 years old and has three children; two are students, and one is working. She has a number of years managing the upholstery shop. Previously, she worked in the free trade zone where her husband worked in furniture repair. She quit her job, and with the liquidation was able to invest in lumber to generate more income by selling chairs, sofas, and fixing furniture. One challenge has been the high cost of lumber. Even the covers for this work are costly, forcing her to charge higher prices and therefore lose some sales. With the previous loan, she managed to install a location at the front of her house where she could work under better conditions given she does not have a locale of her own. With this loan, she will be able to close up the porch and buy materials such as: stone, sand, cement, and metal. Enclosing the area will have an added benefit for the family as well as the business, as she hopes to capture more customers by offering high-quality workmanship and delivery of her products. Long-term plans include establishing a separate workshop for her enterprise through financing from additional loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and metal to build a porch.

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en: Enhsaihan is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a yard which belongs to his mother-in-law. He uses his car to operate a taxi service. He takes local residents to and from various points in his province. Enhsaihan has been operating his business since 2006, and each year he repairs and renovates his car. Starting in 2010 he will take local residents from Ulaangom, the capital of Uvs province, to Hovd soum, the capital of Hovd province. His business has been expanding, and his wife plans to work in his business in the future. Enhsaihan is focused on the future and would like to purchase his own plot of land with a yard. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1055 USD) loan to buy an additional car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Reiner

texts.en:
Reiner M., 57, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. He is married to Emma M. and they are blessed with three children. He makes sure that he provides well so that their family can have a better life. He has been managing their personal pharmacy and rice stall for quite some time now.

Reiner has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his pharmacy and rice stall.

To ensure the success of his business, he would like to apply for a 22,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy more stock for both the pharmacy and the rice stall.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow and thus enable him to achieve his dreams for his family and his community.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buying more stock for both the pharmacy and the rice stall

loans.name: Roma

texts.en: Mrs. Roma S. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are too young to study or work. She and her husband, Mr. Sochea Ros (pictured left), are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In addition to farming, Mr. Sochea Ros is a construction worker and Mrs. Roma S. is a tobacco middleman. With these businesses, the couple are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support her tobacco business, Mrs. Roma S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more tobacco.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco

loans.name: Germán Esmeraldo

texts.es: Germán Esmeraldo S. M. de 35 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos de 11, 9, 6 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales los tres mayores se dedican a estudiar. Germán es un hombre muy trabajador quien posee dos trabajos para poder contar con el dinero necesario para llevar el sustento diarios hasta su hogar, él posee un carwash, el cual está ubicado en Tonacatepeque, cercano a varios talleres, lo cual le brinda mayor oportunidad de trabajo. Así mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual realiza su venta contando con mucha ventaja ya que es uno de los lugares de mayor comercio en todo el país, debido a que existen diversas fabricas, mercados y otros tipos de ventas, lo que lo hace un lugar muy concurrido y con muy buenas oportunidades para los comerciantes. Germán solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener los recursos necesarios para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes estampados, para aumentar sus ventas, así mismo comprar alguno implementos para equipar mejor el carwash y de esta manera mejorar su servicio. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Germán ya que le brinda la esperanza de crecer aún más como negociante.
texts.en:
35-year old Germán Esmeraldo S. M. lives in Tonacatepeque, located in San Salvador Department, with his wife and their four children aged 11, 9, 6, and 2. The three oldest ones attend school. Germán is a very hardworking man who has two jobs so that he earns enough money to cover the daily costs of his family. He has a carwash business located in Tonacatepeque close to several workshops which provide him with some good work opportunities. He also sells clothing in the streets of the municipality of Soyapango. It is a good location as it’s one of the best places to do business in the whole of the country. Many factories are located there as well as markets and other businesses, all of which make it a busy place with good opportunities for businessmen. Germán is asking for a loan to buy more clothing of different brands so that he can increase sales. He also wants to buy more equipment for the carwash and thus improve the service he offers. All these plans fill Germán with hope that he can expand his businesses even more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and carwash equipment

loans.name: Celestina  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Celestina es una mujer de 36 años de edad, con dos hijos, vive en el bario las agüitas, junto a su esposo que se desempeña como mensajero.
Ella trabaja como  conserje en una óptica para poder cubrir los gastos básicos de agua y luz ya que  Son de recursos económicos muy pobres, poco a poco han construido su casa de concreto, todavía hay partes de madera el cual cambiaran con el tiempo ya que no se ajusta por el momento para hacer las mejora. Con este financiamiento cerrara una parte de atrás de la casa y pondrá cerámica, para una mejor higiene ya que se le hace mucho lodo en el invierno y se multiplican los zancudos es por eso su necesidad de hacer la mejora.
texts.en:
Celestina is a 36 year old woman with two children. She lives in the "Las Agüitas" neighborhood with her husband who has a job as a courier. She works as a receptionist at an optician's so that she can cover the basic expenses of water and electricity since they have very little financial means. Little by little they have built their home from concrete, still there are sections of wood which they will change over time since it does not suit right now to make improvements. With this financing they will close off a section at the back of the house and will put in ceramics for better hygiene since it is very muddy in winter time and the mosquitoes multiply. This is why they need to make improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ceramics, cement, sand, to put in the back section and have better hygiene

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong E., 41, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. E. sells food at a tourist place in the province for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. E. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy J. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Judy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Judy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. is 30 years old and married to a nurse. She has two children who both go to school. Mary is currently in the business of selling bags of maize flour and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a store for her goods.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia belongs to a small city of south Punjab Pakistan called Vehari. She lives in a three room brick house with her husband and three sons. Her eldest son is studying in 6th standard, the next to him reads in 6th standard also, while the youngest one reads in kindergarten. 

Razia couldn't complete her own education due to the limited financial resources of her family but she wants to provide all the possible resources to her sons for getting a quality education. She is a very hard-working lady. She operates a grocery shop at her house. She has occupied a room of her house where she keeps the groceries and meets the requirements of her customers. She started doing this work a few years ago to financially support her husband. It is going well now. 

She also handles another business of selling clothes. She takes it as a part time business to supplement her income. She sells those clothes which she imports from Faisalabad and Multan. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who has been involved in the animal selling business for the past ten years.  With the loan amount, he will buy goats which he will sell on Eid (a muslim holiday which comes after Ramadan) for a good profit. 

Razia is confident that her husband will be able to earn a good profit on this Eid and that that will help her family to improve its living condition. 
Note: "In this photo, Razia is showing her selling-clothes business".

loans.use: Purchasing goats for animal selling business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita V. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 51 years old and is married with four adult children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells a raised animal. Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to expand the shelter for her pigs. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
qLa profesora Rosa Marìa de 35 años de edad trabaja en la Escuela Salomòn Ibarra Mayorga desde hace 9 años en la colonia Los Angeles a 5 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene de 2 hijos el mayor de 7 añitos de edad y un bebito de 6 meses de nacido, su esposo trabaja tambien como docente y ambos comparten con los gastos familiares del hogar. 

stà solicitando su 3er crèdito a la instituciòn con el objetivo de construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones y asì tener privacidad en el hogar ya que su familia esta creciendo y necesitan mas espacio para desarrollarse mejor, su sueño en la vida es sobre todo es que su familia tenga salud,estabilidad laboral y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a 35 year-old teacher who has worked for nine years at the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School in the Los Angeles settlement, five kilometers from Nueva Guinea. She has two children. The older is seven years old and the baby was born six months ago. Her husband also works as a teacher and they both share the family's household expenses. She is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC with the goal of building a room with better conditions, in order to have privacy in their home. Their family is growing and they need more space to develop well. Her dream in life is, above all, that her family have good health, stable jobs, and that her children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add a room to her house, for her growing family

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Reside junto a su familia en el sector Micaela Bastidas, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, zona conocida en el norte del país por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Bertha se gana la vida desde hace un año trabajando como vendedora de boletos de lotería en un puesto situado en el mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado mayorista de la ciudad), ella ofrece estos boletos en un puesto patrocinado por la empresa distribuidora y con lo que gana en su trabajo ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Bertha es una mujer bastante luchadora y que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda y comprar algunos productos que permitan a su familia llevar una vida mas estable y cómoda. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante emprendedora y persistente. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Bertha is 31 years old.  She is married and has two young children.  She lives with her family in the Micaela Bastidas sector, an urban zone on the edge of the city of Chiclayo, an area known in the north part of the country for its abundant commerce and transport industries.  It is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past year Bertha has earned a living working as a lottery ticket salesperson in a stand located in the Moshoqueque market (the city's wholesale market).  She offers these tickets in a stand sponsored by the distributing company, and with her earnings from work she helps her husband cover the family's expenses.

Bertha is quite a determined woman and is always looking for a way to help her family get ahead.  Currently she wants to make some improvements to her home and buy some products that will allow her family to have a more stable and comfortable life.  To carry out this plan, she has seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

She is quite an enterprising and persistent woman.  The people who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Improvements in home infrastructure and purchase of items for the home

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of four school-age children. He has more than 20 years of experience running a car repair shop. He is specialized in repairing automobile bodies. He is the main income provider of his family and his wife who works in a local school, tries to help him with her small income. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.al. to purchase new tools for his work. In the future, he hopes to continue his work properly and to be able to expand his business operation and gain more clients.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita M. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Estrellita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Estrellita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling biscuits, milk and chocolate drinks in sachets, snack foods, shampoos, soaps and detergents in the local community. Estrellita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estrellita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third one taken out by Estrellita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Lideres Del Tercer Milenio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Rosvet; ella es soltera; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cuyes, ella estudio la carrera profesional de zootecnia y se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ella vende en forma independiente en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cusco como en el mercado San Pedro, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de cuyes y también ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 300 a 250 cuyes.

 
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de libros, confección de ropa, distribución de libros y negocio de filmaciones de videos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These women belong to the “Líderes del Tercer Milenio” (Leaders of the Third Millenium) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rosvet is single.  She buys and sells guinea pigs.  She studied a university course in zootechnics (animal husbandry) and she raises guinea pigs which she sells independently in the different markets of the city of Cusco such as the San Pedro market.  She would like to improve her guinea pig business and would also like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy 250 to 300 guinea pigs.

The other members work selling books, making clothes, distributing books and shooting videos.

Rosvet is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy 250 - 300 guinea pigs

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a wife of N. H.. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari is a small city known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a two-room brick house in the area named 63-WB with her family. 

Kalsoom is a caring lady, who prefers to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities of a housewife. Her husband is a mason. He provides his services to building constructors by doing construction work for them. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy masonry tools, which will help him to do his work more efficiently. Her husband is the only breadwinner of the family and Kalsoom is hopeful that through this investment he will be able to improve his working conditions and improve his standard of work.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy K., 26, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, Kuy K. she raise a few cows, in a pen, behind her home. She is married to Sam Laiy, ages 24, who helps her with the farming business. The couple have two children who are single and attending school. To improve her farm, Kuy K. is applying for loan to purchase small cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase small cow to raise.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Reynaldo R., tiene 74 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Calvario, en Estelí, actualmente esta soltero y tiene 2 hijos.
Inicio muy jovencito a trabajar, el recuerda que trabaja desde los 11 años de edad como Peón de una Finca, pero luego se quiso independizar y puso una sastrería, luego un pequeño restaurante con pista de baile, en Jalapa, pero por su edad ya no pudo seguir con ese tipo de trabajo y decidió poner alquiler de Sillas para todo tipo de Eventos y Venta de Ropa Americana.  Es decir que tiene más de 60 años de trabajar y una basta experiencia en el sector servicio y comercio.
Tiene a su cargo un nieto de 11 años, a quien el dice estar ensenándole poco a poco todo lo que el sabe.
Realizo este Crédito para comprar mas mesas y sillas para su negocio, pues la demanda ha incrementado  y algunas con el tiempo se han dañado y necesita cambiarlas.
texts.en:
Reynaldo R. is 74 years old and lives in the Barrio El Calvario neighborhood of Estelí. He is currently single and has two children. He started working at a very young age. He remembers that he began working as a farmhand when he was 11 years old. Later on, he wanted to become more independent so he opened up a tailor's shop, then a small restaurant with a dance floor in Jalapa. However, because of his age he couldn't continue this kind of work and decided to open up a business renting chairs for all kinds of events and to start selling American clothing. All this to say that he has worked for over 60 years and has a lot of experience in the service and commercial sectors.

He takes care of an 11-year-old grandchild, whom he says he is teaching everything he knows, bit by bit. He requested this loan in order to buy more tables and chairs for his business. The demand for his rentals has increased. Also, a few tables and chairs have gotten damaged over time so he needs to exchange them for new ones.

loans.use: Purchase of goods/ Business renting chairs for events

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Elsa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products  including dried fish and squid in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy K. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Prossy has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for three years. She has a second business selling food (bananas).
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and bananas for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies.
Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself from HIV/AIDS, and allowing her to take loans, which have improved her business.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and bananas for resale

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Having come from the province of Masbate, Novie E., 55, dreams of a better life in Manila. Novie barely finished high school, but she definitely believes that there is more in store for her. She is married to Lindro, a security guard. They now live in Baseco, Manila.

Novie operates her own sari-sari (variety) store, and at the same time rents out karaoke machines to friends and acquaintances who are fond of incorporating music into their personal events. Novie has two employees who help her with the daily work of accommodating clients and maintaining the business. Monthly, she earns around Php11,000.

Determined to grow her business, Novie is requesting a Php 28, 000 loan. She aims to use this money to boost her sari-sari store business. She will buy sacks of rice and charcoal, which she will repackage for retail. She will also buy trays of eggs, canned goods, and diapers for babies, which she knows her community needs based on her ten years of experience in the business.

From the moment she arrived in Manila, Novie holds on to her dream of a peaceful and abundant life. One hindrance to this is the headache she receives from customers who do not pay. However, she gets hold of a way to solve this issue. She desires for an expansion of her business, and that implies not settling for anything less in terms of service and profit.

As a CCT community partner, Novie faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in store

loans.name: Edgar's Group

texts.en:
Edgar D. is from the village of Dummon. He is 36 years old. Edgar is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Edgar D.".

Edgar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Edgar owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edgar has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Edgar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Edgar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A., from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 45 years old and single. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a business venture providing hairdressing and beauty services, and also sells silver-plated jewelry to local community members. Engaged in his business for over six years, he earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Having repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials such as beauty products, Richard is requesting his fifth loan of 10000 PHP to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Aysar

texts.en:
Aysar is a young man from Arraba village in Jenin district. Aysar is a public school teacher. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Aysar lives with his family and is working on starting a small poultry business to increase his income. Aysar is photographed above.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man and the father of one young child. He is from Lebanon. He is the owner of a barber shop located in his town and has 14 years of experience in this occupation; he learned this job when he was very young.  Today, he is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation. 

With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will perform needed maintenance on his shop and improve its decoration in order to serve his clients in a proper place. He reports that both his income and productivity will increase as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his working capital.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his shop and improve its decoration.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.en:
Aisalkyn S. is 40, married, and has two daughters.  She is engaged in breeding cattle, and with the help of her husband has managed to maintain her farm successfully, which they started with the initial capital of 3.000 KGS.  They worked hard and managed to earn about $172 in a month from selling milk and meat. With the revenues, they bought a car for their family and paid for education for the children.  

Aisalkyn has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle. It will allow her to increase her sales of milk products, and in the future will improve her household. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre soltera de 20 años de edad. Juana es una mujer trabajadora que construyo su propia casa en tierras que sus padres le heredaron. Ella vive allí con su menor hijo. La casa construida por Juana se encuentra en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria- Chiclayo. Esta casa no cuenta con los servicios básicos (luz, agua y  desagüe). El consumo de agua lo realiza extrayéndola a través de un pozo o noria.

En la zona donde vive Juana, los pobladores  se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. 

Juana tiene como actividad principal la artesanía. Confecciona desde hace 3 años unos hermosos sombreros que luego comercializa a precios muy bajos. Adicionalmente Juana realiza labores agrícolas (mallado de verduras y cosecha de estas) en la zona donde vive, pues los ingresos que obtiene de la confección de sombreros no le son suficientes para mantener a su niño.

Juana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra palmas (material utilizado para confeccionar sombreros) y para terminar de construir su casa.

Juana ya ha tenido varios créditos satisfactorios con nuestra empresa.
texts.en:
Juana, a 20-year-old single mother, is a hard worker who built her own house on the land she inherited from her parents.  She lives there with her youngest son.  The house built by Juana is in the rural area of the district of La Victoria - Chiclayo. It does not have basic utilies such as electricity, running water or plumbing.  She has to draw water from a well.

The local population where Juana lives is active, mainly, in agriculture and livestock farming.

Juana's main source of income is handicrafts.  For three years she has been making beautiful hats that she sells at low prices.  She also does agricultural work (harvesting and packaging vegetables) in the area where she lives since the income from her hat-making is not enough to support her child.

Juana is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy reeds (material used to make hats) and finish building her house.

She has had several loans through our company which she has paid back satisfactorily.

loans.use: To buy material to make hats.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maricela le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior y exterior. 
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar la pintura que necesita para remodelar su casa ya que con el sol y las lluvias esta en malas condiciones. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una maquiladora en el aria de producción, ya que su esposo Josué Israel se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo.  
Desea mejorar y asegurar el patrimonio que será para sus tres hijos que tiene.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Maricela is lacking interior and exterior finishes. She is requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary paint to be used in the renovation of her house since it has deteriorated as a result of the sun and the rain.

Maricela plans to repay her loan with the income she earns working at a production factory. Her husband Josué Israel will take care of the family expenses with the salary he receives from his job.

Maricela wants to improve and secure her property so that she can leave it to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase paint so that she can finish the interior and exterior of her house.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 27 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Annie has had this business for three years.

Annie is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional groceries and rice to sell. Each month, Annie earns about PHP 8,000 from her business.

In the future, Annie hopes that she can maintain her business and make it more productive to provide her with more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and rice to sell

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina runs a retail shop selling soap and tea leaves. Her shop is located close to her home and she sells these goods to local residents. Anjelina intends to use her loan to stock up on soap. 

Anjelina hopes to become a wholesaler of tea leaves. She also dreams of owning her own house so she can avoid paying rent. Anjelina describes herself as polite and caring.

loans.use: to stock up on soap she intends to resell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 41 years old and lives in Tuburan Villafor, Oroquita City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lucia has a food vending business. She sells freshly prepared snacks and viands to earn a living. She sells at the offices, schools and her neighbors. She has been running her business for over three years. She earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000 in this vending business. Lucia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase food ingredients and some kitchenware.

Lucia has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Lucia hopes to save the income from food vending so that she can build a food stall in the city.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and some kitchenware.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comite denominado San Cayetano es de la Ciudad de Comcepcion, está integrado por 13 mujeres de la misma Ciudad. Ellas se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa trabajando de forma solidaria y dentro de un marco de respeto y de colaboracón. Lo que las motivo a formar el comité fue la idea de producir un bien para sus familias
Comentan ellas que trabajan muy duro para conseguir todos los fines que se propusieron, además manifiestan que todo lo que hacen es para generar un poco más de ingresos para sus familias y así tener un mejor futuro.
La Sra. Nancy se dedica a la venta venta de frazadas, sabanas, fundas, edredones y demás, gracias e este trabajo que realiza hace ya varios, puede solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que considera que es un trabajo digno y honesto. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde poder ofrecer sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de frazadas, edredones y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse para esta época de invierno.
texts.en:
The 'San Cayetano' committee is from the city of Concepción.  It is made up of 13 women from the city.  They are on their second loan cycle within the program, working in a supportive manner, in a framework of respect and cooperation.  What motivated them to form their committee was the idea of doing something good for their families.

The ladies tell us that they work very hard to achieve all of the goals that they set themselves.  They also say that everything they do is done to make a little extra income for their families so that they can enjoy a better future.

Nancy sells bedspreads, sheets, pillowcases, comforters and other items.  Thanks to this work, which she has been doing for several years now, she is able to cover her household expenses.  She is very proud of what she does as she considers it to be decent and honest work.  She dreams of some day being able to have premises where she can sell her merchandise.

Nancy is requesting this loan to buy bedspreads, comforters and other items so that she can stock her business for this winter season.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Awaggwa Eku Kirinya Development Group

texts.en:
She always stays good humored and fresh as a daisy, especially in regards to making common cause with her workers at her stone quarry business in the metropolis of Kampala. These stocks in trade have endeared her not only to her laborers but also her clients. As such, she has been notching up successes in her transactions the last six years since she took root. Every business has its downsides and quarry businesses are invariably fraught with them, including 38-year-old Harriet's but her unwavering tenacity has been her recourse. The experience mill she has gone through in this business has taught her a lot. She says laying great store on patience has been key. Her business was thrown into gear after a pep talk by close friends and family. Before that, she was mostly preoccupied by tailoring. She has been carving out a niche gradually and she reckons her future prospects will only get better with time. Her clientele base principally consists of middle class civil servants beginning to build and construction firm people.

Harriet who is a married mother of three says her gross weekly sales revenue is to the tune of Ugandan shillings 40,000. This may be paltry, but she says by the end of this year, she expects to be making more. By all accounts, this is the group's maiden loan from Pearl Micro-finance. The integrity of the other group members is something Harriet speaks highly of and she does not expect any difficulty in repaying their loan. Given Harriet's tenacity, diligence, optimism and good working relationships, her odds of business success look good. This Kiva loan she anticipates will throw her business in an even stronger gear. She says this Kiva loan will lend her countenance in the purchase of another piece of land to expand her quarrying.

loans.use: to purchase another piece of land to expand her quarrying

loans.name: Abram

texts.en:
Abram is 45 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Abram has a small retail shop that sells sugar and soap, which he has had for seven years.         
	
To help expand his business, Abram has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap, and salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Abram hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Abram hopes to expand his business.  Abram is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Luis Simeon

texts.es: El Señor Luis Simeón su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa. El es un padre responsable, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 14 y 18 años de edad. El negocio lo inicio porque en su negocio anterior tenia perdidas, pero fue así que el logro aprender  a administrar mejor el que tiene actualmente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de camisetas, faldas, trajes, vestidos, pantalones entre otros. El obstáculo que ha vencido ha sido el conseguir financiamiento que gracias a él podrá comprar la materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en: Luis Simeón’s business consists in clothing sales.  He’s a responsible father; he has three children who are 10, 14 and 18 years of age.  He started the business because he suffered losses in his previous business but he learned how to run his present business better.  He is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, skirts, suits, dresses and pants, among others.  The obstacle he’s overcome is getting financing because thanks to it he’ll be able to buy raw materials necessary for his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio nació en la provincia del Cusco y tiene 60 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos de las cuales los dos son independientes.  

Actualmente, Julio vive en la misma provincia donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la venta de artesanía, él tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Juliaca y al país de Bolivia a comprar artesanía. En esta oportunidad Julio requiere el préstamo para comprar collares de plata, mantas y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Julio was born in Cusco Province. He is 60 years old, married, and has two children who live independently.

Julio currently lives in the same province where he was born. This is also where he conducts his business activities. Julio sells handicrafts. He travels to the city of Juliaca and to the country of Bolivia to buy his merchandise. He is taking this opportunity to request loan in order to buy silver necklaces, blankets, and other products.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy silver necklaces, blankets, and other handcrafted products.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Melinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas to sell.

Melinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza.  In 2011, Ahmad decided he wanted to have a farm of his own, including several sheep. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to own his own farm that focuses on breeding and trading sheep, since there is no business like this in the area. He hopes that this will allow him to have a successful business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy sheep for the farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 52 years old, married to Antony, and they have three children going to school.  

Jane was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and has been producing maize, milk and poultry birds for the local market. She lives with her family of three children in Kitale. She has been in farming for 15 years and owns low-cost rental houses in the local market to supplement her farming income. 

Gladys has requested a loan of 85,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use 25,000 KES to purchase more poultry birds, and the rest to buy milk cans and a cooler to avoid the waste incurred when the milk goes bad, which has been a major challenge for her milk business. She hopes the loan will boost her income and help in educating the children. 

She laments the high cost of managing animal diseases and low market prices for milk and other farm products.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and milk cooling cans

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married with five children. Pacita is 57 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Pacita sells a variety of snacks. She has operated this business for five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to generate more savings for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, milk and other ingredients

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She works as a garment factory worker, earning a monthly salary of $80 for a living. She has a common law relationship with her husband, who works as a construction worker in and around the community. The couple has been married for a long time but unfortunately they are not blessed with any children at all. Bun strives to work overtime and she has saved some money to buy a motorcycle for the family's use. Due to lack of funds, she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her saved money to purchase a good motorcycle. Through this loan, the family will cut down on their daily transportation expenses. In the future, she dreams of having her own seamstress shop in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a good motorcycle for daily transportation.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila de 51 años, es una mujer felizmente casada con Víctor, con quien tiene 5 hijos de 28, 25, 20, 16 y 14 años. Teo y Víctor solo viven con los 3 menores en una casa propia en el caserío de Ricricán en el  distrito de Palcamayo. Teo es una incansable mujer, a pesar de sus años, las fuerzas le sobran para dedicarse de lleno a la agricultura. En sus terrenos tiene sembrado papas y ollucos, los que le dan ingresos solo en algunas temporadas del año.
A su vez se desempeña como comerciante de carnes y verduras que expende en la ciudad de Chanchamayo. En el caso de las carnes, Teo cuenta con 50 carneros, los que sacrifica para su venta en carnes y derivados. Para las verduras tiene que comprar al por mayor del mercado mayorista para ofrecerlos al menudeo en la cuidad Chanchamayo. Para este negocio, tiene que viajar cada 2 veces a la semana.
A este ritmo, Teo está convencida que podrá construir su casa en el mismo centro del distrito de Palcamayo, por ahora de material rústico. Este acto lo hará por sus hijos para que estén más cercanos al centro de sus estudios. Con su apoyo, éste sería su préstamo número 15 de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. En cuanto a su banco comunal, menciona sentirse contenta por la solidaridad que encuentra en su grupo.
Invertirá la mitad del dinero en la compra de sacos de abonos orgánicos. Y la otra mitad en la compra de verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila, 51, a happy woman, is married to Victor and they have 5 children: 28, 25, 20, 16 and 14, although only the 3 youngest still live with them.  They have their own house in the  Ricricán village, Palcamayo district.  Teo is a tireless woman who despite her years, has lots of energy to work full-time     in farming.  She has planted potatoes and ollucos (indigenous Peruvian tuber) in her fields but these only earn her money in certain seasons of the year.  

She also sells meats and vegetables in Chanchamayo.  Teo has 50 sheep that she sells for their meat and parts.  She buys the vegetables at the wholesale market and sells them retail in Chanchamayo.  She has to travel to make these sales twice a week.
Teo is sure that at this pace she will be able to build her house in the center of Palcamayo but for now it will be constructed of rustic materials.  She will do this for her children so that they will live closer to their schools.  With your help, this will be her 15th loan with MFP.  She promises to be punctual with her payments and she feels content with the communal bank because of the solidarity among the members.
She will use half the money to buy sacks of organic fertilier and the other half to purchase vegetables for the business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for the vegetables to supply her business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is in school, is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has operated a beauty products business in the Philippines for the past year. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, Mary Jean would like to develop and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Edicta Beatriz

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edicta, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos que es soltero aun viven con ella. Su marido tiene un negocio propio.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de alquiler de maquinas lavadoras de ropa, adema sella también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, carteras, zapatillas y de productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00 ya que a veces s esposo sale a entregar las maquinas y es ella quien se queda en el local vendiendo y tomando los pedidos de sus clientes.
