Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, carteras, sandalias y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen esta viejo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of Unión y Solidaridad Communal Bank meet in San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Edicta.  She is 57 years old and married, and from this relationship has three children who are already grown.  One of her children is single and still lives with her.  Her husband has his own business.

She and her husband have a business renting washing machines.  She also works selling clothing of all types, purses, sandals, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells in her house where she has a small space.  She works every day from 8:00 until 6:00, since sometimes her husband leaves to deliver the machines and she stays in the space selling and taking orders from customers.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been doing this work for more than 12 years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing, wallets, sandals, and Yanbal products.  She has been in the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because of the help they offer with the loans.

Her dream is to buy another car since the one she has is old.

loans.use: to buy clothing, purses, sandals, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only one child. Her husband is the one responsible for covering their life expenses. 

She started to work as a tailor from her home in 2009. In parallel, she has been working in a local company for the past four years. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added tailoring tools, which will allow her to increase her production. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring tools.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old, married to Victoria and they are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Toirjon

texts.en: Toirjon since childhood has a dream to be a successful entrepreneur. Nowadays he has realized his dream because he is an entrepreneur. Toirjon is 27 years old. He is not married. Toirjon lives with his mother. He began his business with selling food items 1.5 years ago. He sells bread, butter, oil, sugar, candies and etc. in a food shop. Toirjon little by little attracts more clients because he sells fresh food items. He is only feed keeper of his family, so he works hard to earn for living. He is going to increase working capital now and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 1400 USD to buy food items. He awaits your kindness and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde Argentina, es madre soltera de ocho hijos de los cuales estan bajo su tutela y en edad escolar, se dedica al comercio desde hace 9 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de marisco anteriormente vendía frutas y verduras, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela de 06:00 am finalizando 03:00 pm con este mismo horario de lunes a domingo, ella realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus hijos.   

Doña Matilde solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo en la compra de pescados y camarones,esto le permitirá incrementar su inventario de productos y su capital de trabajo, obteniendo mayores venta y  así tener un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de pescados y camarones

loans.name: Pordogo Group

texts.fr:
Mme  PASCALINE  est responsable du groupe PORDOGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du maraichage  depuis  15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent  octroyé, elle compte acheter 05 boîtes  de semence et 03 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto pompe pour l’agrandissement des surfaces cultivables et assurer le bien- être  de la famille (habits, nourriture…).
texts.en:
Ms. Pascaline is the leader of the Pordogo borrowers' group. She is married and has four children ranging from four to 10 years of age. Two of her children attend school; she has five dependents. Pascaline has been growing vegetables for 15 years. She stocks up at the nearby markets. 

With her loan, she plans to buy five boxes of seeds and three 50-kg [110 lbs] bags of fertilizers. She would like to use her revenues to pay the school fees of her children. She would also like to buy a motorized pump in order to increase the size of land used for farming and provide for her family's well-being (clothing, food etc).

loans.use: to buy five boxes of seeds and three 50-kg bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Зулфия. Ей 55 лет. Она из района Вахш. Зулфия имеет двоих детей. Детям 10 и 15 лет. Зулфия занимается животноводством более 10 лет. Она покупает крупнорогатого скота, откармливает их 40 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ей в этой помогает ее дети. Зулфия решила увеличить поголовья скотов и расширить животноводческой деятельности. Ей нужно определенная сумма для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Зулфия верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для закупа крупнорогатого скота.

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Madam Akou A. was born in 1964 at Tsévié. Mother of tree (03) children, she is married to a farmer who, for a certain moment, face difficulties from her activities due to the climatic ups and downs which are considerably decreasing the incomes. In this situation, Madam A. is abandoned alone to face the family needs. Very dynamic and undertaking, she was launched in the first basic products which she controls very well. Though illiterate, she manages well with a surprising rigour her businesses and has succeeded to repaid the two credits got without incident. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be backed in view to strengthen her activity and make in profitable. Madam Akou A. requests a credit of $850 which will allow her to buy the merchandises in whole (soaps, sugar, milk, tomatoes, etc.) and to supply her shop of various rare products in the area. She could then face the household expenditures and improve the family living conditions.

Madame A. Akou est née en 1964 à Tsévié. Mère de trois (03) enfant, elle est mariée à un cultivateur qui, depuis un certains temps, rencontre des difficultés ses activités dues aux aléas climatiques qui font baisser considérablement le rendement et de facto, ses revenus. Dans cette situation, Madame A. est seule à faire face aux besoins de la famille. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité qu’elle maîtrise assez bien. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle gère avec une étonnante rigueur ses affaires et a su bien rembourser les deux crédits obtenus sans incident. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu en vue de renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser. Madame A. Akou sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’acheter les marchandises en gros (savons, sucre, lait, tomate etc.) et d’approvisionner sa boutique de divers produits recherchés dans le milieu. Elle pourra alors faire face aux charges de foyer et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: to buy the merchandises in whole and to supply her shop

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Vero is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has gone through the TEACH Lending program. She has also been trained in record-keeping. Vero needs a loan of $850 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea K. H., is 55 years old and the mother of 8 children. She lives with her husband in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by growing crops, raising animals and making Khmer noodles to sell retail. They typically make about $25/day, which is a part of financing an entire household. One of their children is a tuk tuk driver ( a passenger taxi cart attached to a motorcycle) and another rents traditional music instruments for wedding and funeral ceremonies. The other six are students and help their parents in crop growing and animal raising. K. H. requests a loan of $1100 to purchase a piece of land for her agriculture and for raising animals. This will increase her income, because she won't have to rent land on which to grow crops and animals.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for growing crops and raising animals.

loans.name: Mirthala

texts.es:
Mirthala is an enterprising married woman with two children. Eleven years ago, she started a business selling clothes and shining shoes. To help her children get ahead, she decided she needed to do something to achieve the financial stability she now has, but she needs your help in expanding her business. Her husband is a maintenance worker in a factory in Monterrey. Mirthala sells her clothes in busy markets, where foot traffic is heavy.

Mirthala is asking for $500 to buy inventory for the business and expects to repay the loan in six months. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Mirthala es casada y tiene dos hijos, es una mujer emprendedora y hace 11 años empezó a trabajar en su negocio vendiendo ropa y lustrando calzado, ella para sacar a sus hijos adelante decidió hacer algo que le de la estabilidad que ahora tiene pero necesita del apoyo financiero para poder crecer y por eso es que esta solicitando de su ayuda. Su esposo es trabajador de mantenimiento en una empresa en Monterrey y Mirthala vende sus productos afuera de su casa y en mercados ambulantes que son muy concurridos, de esta manera es como puede llegar a un mayor numero de clientes.

Mirthala necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $500 para comprar mercadería para su negocio comprometiéndose a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les das para salir adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her clothing stall

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: This lady’s aim is to save for her children’s future.  Lagi joined S.P.B.D. in order to get a loan to start a small business.  With 3 young ones still at home and soon to start school, and her husband being the only supporter, she decided to help him by earning money to save for her children’s education.  She does this by selling clothes, t-shirts, and handicrafts at the flea market, six days a week.  This earns her a daily income of $60 after all expenses, and is more than enough to help her husband and to save for her kids' educations.

loans.use: Flea market and taxi business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina is 54 years old, an active and entrepreneurial mother who attends to her general store from early morning and thanks to her politeness and dedication the business has grown little by little and currently it has become one of the most popular stores in the area. While she is busy attending to her daily orders, her husband, Martín, is working as a mechanic at a repair shop and thanks to their jobs they can offer their two sons university studies. Doña Guillermina wishes to expand and increase the variety of her products in order to offer a better and more complete service to her regular customers and she is asking for a loan of $500 which will be invested in increasing the stock and that way improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Guillermina D. 54 años, es una madre activa y emprendedora, desD. tempranas horas se dedica a atender su bodeguita D. abarrotes, negocio que gracias a su amabilidad y dedicación fue creciendo poco a poco, y hoy en día se convirtió en una D. las tienditas más concurridas D. su localidad, mientras ella se dedica a atender sus pedidos diarios; Martín su esposo trabaja como mecánico en un taller, gracias al oficio que ambos desempeñan pueden brindarles estudios universitarios a sus dos hijos.El deseo D. Guillermina es ampliar y aumentar la variedad D. sus productos con el fin D. ofrecer un mejor y completo servicio a sus asiduos clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo D. 500 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir en aumentar el stock D. su mercadería y así mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase stock and  improve sales at general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her restaurant, including wheat and maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin S., 35, is the mother of three little children. She runs a butcher stand in her community selling pork and beef and earning about $4 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman and generally makes around $2 each day. Khin intends to use this loan to purchase more butchery supplies to meet her increasing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more butchery supplies

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
Nozim K. is 30 years old, and is married with three children. Nozim lives with his parents, and is the main bread-winner for his large family.

Nozim sells fruit, such as apples, oranges, and pears, in the central local market. He has been in this business for 11 years. After such a long time, Nozim has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruit to keep their marketable condition and not lose their taste and useful properties. Being located in the biggest central market, Nozim's business has a large clientele and is rather stable, generating the main income to support the family.

Nozim has proved himself to be an honest reliable client. Today he is requesting 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. He plans to use the loan to purchase fruit, such as apples, oranges, and pears in order to increase the range of goods for sale. He would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase fruit in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth is 36 years old and has two children who are 12 and 10 years old. Maria works selling sweets out of a small kiosk that she had built a while ago. Her daily efforts have made her popular and she has met the requests of all of her young customers. Her desire to enlarge her small store has driven her to request a loan in order to put the project in motion.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Maria Elizabeth de 36 años, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 02 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender golosinas en un pequeño kiosco que mandó a construir hace mucho tiempo, su esfuerzo diario ha contribuido a su popularidad y ha albergado durante mucho tiempo las solicitudes de los niños.El deseo de incrementar sus veces y ampliar su pequeño espacio de ventas la conducen a solicitar un préstamo a fin de poner en marcha su gran proyecto.

loans.use: To fix up and prepare her small sales area
